title: Xawery Żuławski
text: Xawery Żuławski (born 22 December 1971 in Warsaw) is a Polish film director. In 1995 he graduated National Film School in Łódź.

title: Xawery Żuławski
text: He is the son of actress Małgorzata Braunek and director Andrzej Żuławski.

title: Xawery Żuławski
text: His second feature "Wojna polsko-ruska" (2009), adapted from the controversial best-selling novel by Dorota Masłowska, won First Prize in the New Polish Films competition at the 9th Era New Horizons Film Festival in Wrocław.

title: Xawery Żuławski
text: In 2013, he stated he intends to direct a Polish novel "Zły" by Leopold Tyrmand. Żuławski and his wife Maria Strzelecka had 2 children together: son Kaj Żuławski (born 2002) and daughter Jagna Żuławska (born 2009).

title: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (1955 film)
text: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs( USA:" Snow White") is a 1955 German film, directed by Erich Kobler, based on the story of Schneewittchen by the Brothers Grimm.

title: Maheen Khan
text: Maheen Khan is a Pakistani fashion and costume designer, also an award winner fashion designer for fashion labels like" The Embroidery HouseMaheen" and" Gulabo".

title: Maheen Khan
text: She has done many national and international fashion events and shows. She undertook embroidery for the film Snow White and the Huntsman and television series The Jewel in the Crown.

title: A Snow White Christmas
text: A Snow White Christmas is a Christmas animated television special produced by Filmation and telecast December 19, 1980, on CBS.

title: A Snow White Christmas
text: It is a sequel to the fairy tale" Snow White", unrelated to Filmation's other sequel to" Snow White" titled" Happily Ever After"( 1990).

title: A Snow White Christmas
text: The film's plot revolves around the return of the Wicked Queen, who is unexpectedly brought back to life during Christmas and casts an evil spell that freezes the entire land.

title: A Snow White Christmas
text: Only the young Snow White, the daughter of the original Snow White, manages to escape and take refuge with the seven giants with her dwarf friend.

title: A Snow White Christmas
text: It is now up to the giants to defeat the Queen forever and save the kingdom.

title: Alice Washburn
text: Alice Washburn( 1860- 1929) was an American stage and film actress. She worked at the Edison, Vitagraph and Kalem studios.

title: Alice Washburn
text: Her final film Snow White was her only known feature film. She died of heart attack in November 1929.

title: Polish-Russian War (film)
text: Polish-Russian War (Wojna polsko-ruska) is a 2009 Polish film directed by Xawery Żuławski based on the novel Polish-Russian War under the white-red flag by Dorota Masłowska.

title: Viktor Yeliseyev
text: Viktor Petrovich Yeliseyev( born June 9, 1950) is a Russian general, orchestra conductor and music teacher.

title: Viktor Yeliseyev
text: He is the director of the Ministry of the Interior Ensemble, one of the two Russian Red Army Choirs.

title: Minamoto no Chikako
text: She was the mother of Prince Morinaga.

title: Liberty Ross
text: Liberty Lettice Lark Ross( born 23 September 1978) is an English model and actress. She has appeared in publications such as" VogueHarper's Bazaari- D", and" Dazed& Confused".

title: Liberty Ross
text: She played the role of Queen Eleanor in the 2012 fantasy film" Snow White and the Huntsman", directed by her then- husband, Rupert Sanders.

title: Liberty Ross
text: She is the sister of composers Atticus and Leopold Ross.

title: Snow White and the Three Stooges
text: Snow White and the Three Stooges is the second feature film to star the Three Stooges after their 1959 resurgence in popularity.

title: Snow White and the Three Stooges
text: By this time, the trio consisted of Moe Howard, Larry Fine, and Joe DeRita( dubbed" Curly Joe").

title: Snow White and the Three Stooges
text: Released by 20th Century Fox, this was the trio's take on the classic fairy tale" Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs".

title: Snow White and the Three Stooges
text: The film was retitled Snow White and the Three Clowns in Great Britain. This was Walter Lang ‘s final directing film before his retirement.

title: Snow White and the Three Stooges
text: Olympic gold medalist figure skater Carol Heiss starred as Snow White, who must flee her home after The Evil Queen, her evil stepmother, wishes her to be dead.

title: Snow White and the Three Stooges
text: Seeking refuge in the cottage of the seven dwarfs, she accidentally meets the Stooges, who are house sitting for them while they are away.

title: The Return of Dr. Fu Manchu
text: The Return of Dr. Fu Manchu is a 1930 American pre-Code film directed by Rowland V. Lee.

title: The Return of Dr. Fu Manchu
text: It is the second of three films starring Warner Oland as the fiendish Fu Manchu, who returns from apparent death in the previous film," The Mysterious Dr. Fu Manchu"( 1929), to seek revenge on those he holds responsible for the death of his wife and child.

title: The Blood of Fu Manchu
text: The Blood of Fu Manchu, also known as Fu Manchu and the Kiss of Death, Kiss of Death, Kiss and Kill( U.S. title) and Against All Odds( original U.S. video title), is a 1968 British adventure crime film directed by Jesús Franco, based on the fictional Asian villain Dr. Fu Manchu created by Sax Rohmer.

title: The Blood of Fu Manchu
text: It was the fourth film in a series, and was preceded by" The Vengeance of Fu Manchu The Castle of Fu Manchu" followed in 1969.

title: The Blood of Fu Manchu
text: It was produced by Harry Alan Towers for Udastex Films. It starred Christopher Lee as Dr. Fu Manchu, Richard Greene as Scotland Yard detective Nayland Smith, and Howard Marion- Crawford as Dr. Petrie.

title: The Blood of Fu Manchu
text: The movie was filmed in Spain and Brazil.

title: The Blood of Fu Manchu
text: Shirley Eaton appears in a scene that she claimed she was never paid for; apparently, the director Jesús Franco had inserted some stock footage of her from one of her films(" The Girl from Rio"( 1968)) into the film without telling her.

title: The Blood of Fu Manchu
text: She only found out years later that she had been in a Fu Manchu film.

title: The Mask of the Gorilla
text: The Mask of the Gorilla is a 1958 French action film directed by Bernard Borderie.

title: The Mask of Fu Manchu
text: The Mask of Fu Manchu is a 1932 pre-Code adventure film directed by Charles Brabin. It was written by Irene Kuhn, Edgar Allan Woolf and John Willard based on the 1932 novel of the same name by Sax Rohmer.

title: The Mask of Fu Manchu
text: Starring Boris Karloff as Fu Manchu, and featuring Myrna Loy as his depraved daughter, the movie revolves around Fu Manchu's quest for the golden sword and mask of Genghis Khan.

title: The Mask of Fu Manchu
text: Lewis Stone plays his nemesis. Dr. Petrie is absent from this film.

title: The Face of Fu Manchu
text: The Face of Fu Manchu is a 1965 thriller film directed by Don Sharp and based on the characters created by Sax Rohmer.

title: The Face of Fu Manchu
text: It stars Christopher Lee as the eponymous villain, a Chinese criminal mastermind, and Nigel Green as his pursuing rival Nayland Smith, a Scotland Yard detective.

title: The Face of Fu Manchu
text: The film was a British- West German co-production, and was the first in a five- part series starring Lee and produced by Harry Alan Towers for Constantin Film, the second of which was" The Brides of Fu Manchu" released the next year, with the final entry being" The Castle of Fu Manchu" in 1969.

title: The Face of Fu Manchu
text: It was shot in Technicolor and Techniscope, on- location in County Dublin, Ireland.

title: The Brides of Fu Manchu
text: The Brides of Fu Manchu is a 1966 British/ West German Constantin Film co-production adventure crime film based on the fictional Chinese villain Dr. Fu Manchu, created by Sax Rohmer.

title: The Brides of Fu Manchu
text: It was the second film in a series, and was preceded by" The Face of Fu ManchuThe Vengeance of Fu Manchu" followed in 1967," The Blood of Fu Manchu" in 1968, and" The Castle of Fu Manchu" in 1969.

title: The Brides of Fu Manchu
text: It was produced by Harry Alan Towers for Hallam Productions. Like the first film, it was directed by Don Sharp, and starred Christopher Lee as Fu Manchu.

title: The Brides of Fu Manchu
text: Nigel Green was replaced by Douglas Wilmer as Scotland Yard detective Nayland Smith. The action takes place mainly in London, where much of the location filming took place.

title: The Castle of Fu Manchu
text: The Castle of Fu Manchu( also known as The Torture Chamber of Dr. Fu Manchu and also known by its German title Die Folterkammer des Dr. Fu Man Chu) is a 1969 film and the fifth and final Dr. Fu Manchu film with Christopher Lee portraying the title character.

title: The Mysterious Dr. Fu Manchu
text: The Mysterious Dr. Fu Manchu is a 1929 American pre-Code drama film directed by Rowland V. Lee and starring Warner Oland as Dr. Fu Manchu.

title: The Mysterious Dr. Fu Manchu
text: It was the first Fu Manchu film of the talkie era. Since this was during the transition period to sound, a silent version was also released in the United States.

title: Les Trottoirs de Bangkok
text: Les Trottoirs de Bangkok( English:" The Sidewalks of Bangkok", also known as" Bangkok Interdit") is a 1984 erotic thriller film directed by Jean Rollin.

title: Les Trottoirs de Bangkok
text: The film was inspired by the 1932 Boris Karloff classic" The Mask of Fu Manchu".

title: Les Trottoirs de Bangkok
text: In contrast to Rollin's usual themes of vampires, dream- like atmosphere and crumbling châteaus," Les Trottoirs des Bangkok" mixes themes of adventure, crime and mystery with comic book dialogue, while still featuring naked women and sex, which his films were known for.

title: Blind Shaft
text: Blind Shaft is a 2003 film about a pair of brutal con artists operating in the illegal coal mines of present- day northern China.

title: Blind Shaft
text: The film was written and directed by Li Yang( 李杨), and is based on Chinese writer Liu Qingbang's short novel" Shen MuSacred Wood").

title: Karl I, Prince of Anhalt-Zerbst
text: Karl I of Anhalt- Zerbst( 17 November 1534 in Dessau – 4 May 1561 in Zerbst), was a German prince of the House of Ascania and ruler of the principality of Anhalt- Zerbst.

title: Karl I, Prince of Anhalt-Zerbst
text: He was the eldest son of John V, Prince of Anhalt- Zerbst, by his wife Margaret, daughter of Joachim I Nestor, Elector of Brandenburg.

title: Bernhard VII, Prince of Anhalt-Zerbst
text: Bernhard VII of Anhalt- Zerbst( 17 March 1540 – 1 March 1570), was a German prince of the House of Ascania and ruler of the principality of Anhalt- Zerbst.

title: Bernhard VII, Prince of Anhalt-Zerbst
text: He was born and died in Dessau, and was the third and youngest son of John V, Prince of Anhalt- Zerbst by his wife Margaret, daughter of Joachim I Nestor, Elector of Brandenburg.

title: Ernest I, Prince of Anhalt-Dessau
text: Ernest I, Prince of Anhalt-Dessau (died Dessau, 12 June 1516), was a German prince of the House of Ascania and ruler of the principality of Anhalt-Dessau.

title: Ernest I, Prince of Anhalt-Dessau
text: He was the second son of George I, Prince of Anhalt-Dessau, yet the first born by his fourth wife Anna, daughter of Albert VIII, Count of Lindow-Ruppin.

title: Waldemar I, Prince of Anhalt-Zerbst
text: Waldemar I, Prince of Anhalt- Zerbst( died 7 January 1368) was a German prince of the House of Ascania and ruler of the principality of Anhalt- Zerbst.

title: Waldemar I, Prince of Anhalt-Zerbst
text: He was the youngest son of Albert I, Prince of Anhalt- Zerbst, by his second wife Agnes, daughter of Conrad, Margrave of Brandenburg- Stendal.

title: Albert III, Prince of Anhalt-Zerbst
text: Albert III, Prince of Anhalt- Zerbst( died ca. 1 August 1359) was a German prince of the House of Ascania and ruler of the principality of Anhalt- Zerbst.

title: Albert III, Prince of Anhalt-Zerbst
text: He was the eldest son of Albert II, Prince of Anhalt- Zerbst, by his second wife Beatrix, daughter of Rudolf I, Elector of Saxony and Duke of Saxe- Wittemberg.

title: Albert II, Prince of Anhalt-Zerbst
text: Albert II, Prince of Anhalt- Zerbst( died 17 July 1362) was a German prince of the House of Ascania and ruler of the principality of Anhalt- Zerbst.

title: Albert II, Prince of Anhalt-Zerbst
text: He was the third son of Albert I, Prince of Anhalt- Zerbst, but the eldest child born to his second wife Agnes, daughter of Conrad, Margrave of Brandenburg- Stendal.

title: Waldemar III, Prince of Anhalt-Zerbst
text: Waldemar III, Prince of Anhalt- Zerbst( died 1391) was a German prince of the House of Ascania and ruler of the principality of Anhalt- Zerbst.

title: Waldemar III, Prince of Anhalt-Zerbst
text: He was the youngest son of John II, Prince of Anhalt- Zerbst, by his wife Elisabeth, daughter of John I, Count of Henneberg- Schleusingen.

title: John VI, Prince of Anhalt-Zerbst
text: John VI of Anhalt-Zerbst (Zerbst, 24 March 1621 – Zerbst, 4 July 1667), was a German prince of the House of Ascania and ruler of the principality of Anhalt-Zerbst.

title: John VI, Prince of Anhalt-Zerbst
text: He was the only son of Rudolph, Prince of Anhalt-Zerbst, by his second wife Magdalene, daughter of John VII, Count of Oldenburg.

title: John II, Prince of Anhalt-Zerbst
text: John II, Prince of Anhalt- Zerbst( died 11 April 1382) was a German prince of the House of Ascania and ruler of the principality of Anhalt- Zerbst.

title: John II, Prince of Anhalt-Zerbst
text: He was the youngest son of Albert II, Prince of Anhalt- Zerbst, by his second wife Beatrix, daughter of Rudolf I, Elector of Saxony and Duke of Saxe- Wittemberg.

title: John V, Prince of Anhalt-Zerbst
text: John V of Anhalt-Zerbst (Dessau, 4 September 1504 – Zerbst, 4 February 1551), was a German prince of the House of Ascania and ruler of the principality of Anhalt-Dessau.

title: John V, Prince of Anhalt-Zerbst
text: From 1544, he assumed rule of the re-created principality of Anhalt-Zerbst.

title: John V, Prince of Anhalt-Zerbst
text: John was the second (but eldest surviving) son of Ernest I, Prince of Anhalt-Dessau, by his wife Margarete, daughter of Henry I, Duke of Münsterberg-Oels, and granddaughter of George of Poděbrady, King of Bohemia.

title: All in the Family (film)

title: All in the Family (film)
text: Despite starring in the film, Jackie Chan does not appear until 1 hour into the movie.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Etan Boritzer( born 1950) is an American writer of children ’s literature who is best known for his book" What is God? " first published in 1989.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His best selling" What is? " illustrated children's book series on character education and difficult subjects for children is a popular teaching guide for parents, teachers and child- life professionals.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer gained national critical acclaim after" What is God? " was published in 1989 although the book has caused controversy from religious fundamentalists for its universalist views.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: The other current books in the" What is? " series include What is Love? , What is Death? , What is Beautiful? , What is Funny? , What is Right?

title: Etan Boritzer
text: , What is Peace? , What is Money? , What is Dreaming? , What is a Friend? , What is True? , What is a Family? , What is a Feeling?

title: Etan Boritzer
text: " The series is now also translated into 15 languages. Boritzer was first published in 1963 at the age of 13 when he wrote an essay in his English class at Wade Junior High School in the Bronx, New York on the assassination of John F. Kennedy.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His essay was included in a special anthology by New York City public school children compiled and published by the New York City Department of Education.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer now lives in Venice, California and maintains his publishing office there also. He has helped numerous other authors to get published through" How to Get Your Book Published!

title: Etan Boritzer
text: " programs. Boritzer is also a yoga teacher who teaches regular classes locally and guest- teaches nationally.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: He is also recognized nationally as an erudite speaker on" The Teachings of the Buddha. "

title: Wunna
text: Maung Wunna was a two-time Myanmar Motion Picture Academy Awards-winning Burmese director and writer.

title: Wunna
text: He came from a family heavily involved in the entertainment industry—his father Thadu was a director and his brother Thu Maung was a prominent singer and actor and Min Lu was a reputed satirist.

title: Wunna
text: Maung Wunna died of lung cancer in 2011.

title: Wearing Velvet Slippers under a Golden Umbrella
text: Wearing Velvet Slippers under a Golden Umbrella (Pronounced as Katipa phanat see shwe htee hsaung) is a 1970 Burmese film directed by Maung Wunna starring Myat Mon, Myat Lay and Thet Naung.

title: Wearing Velvet Slippers under a Golden Umbrella
text: The film was Maung Wunna's first feature as director and he also wrote the screenplay, based on the novel of the same name by Maung Thara.

title: Ian Barry (director)
text: Ian Barry is an Australian director of film and TV.

title: Michael Govan
text: Michael Govan( born 1963) is the director of the Los Angeles County Museum of Art since 2006. Prior to this, Govan worked as the director of the Dia Art Foundation in New York City.

title: John Donatich
text: John Donatich is the Director of Yale University Press.

title: David Lynch
text: David Keith Lynch (born January 20, 1946) is an American filmmaker, painter, musician, actor, and photographer.

title: David Lynch
text: He is best known for films such as "Eraserhead" (1977), "Blue Velvet" (1986) and "Mulholland Drive" (2001), often regarded by critics as among the best films of their respective decades, and for his successful 1990–91 television series "Twin Peaks", which led to him being labeled "the first popular Surrealist" by noted film critic Pauline Kael.

title: David Lynch
text: A recipient of an Academy Honorary Award in 2019, he has received three Academy Award nominations for Best Director, and has won France's César Award for Best Foreign Film twice, as well as the Palme d'Or at the Cannes Film Festival and a Golden Lion award for lifetime achievement at the Venice Film Festival.

title: David Lynch
text: He has been described by "The Guardian" as "the most important director of this era", while AllMovie called him "the Renaissance man of modern American filmmaking".

title: David Lynch
text: Born to a middle-class family in Missoula, Montana, Lynch spent his childhood traveling around the United States before he studied painting at the Pennsylvania Academy of Fine Arts in Philadelphia, where he first made the transition to producing short films.

title: David Lynch
text: He moved to Los Angeles, where he produced his first motion picture, the surrealist horror film "Eraserhead" (1977).

title: David Lynch
text: After "Eraserhead" became a success on the midnight movie circuit, Lynch was employed to direct the biographical film "The Elephant Man" (1980), from which he gained mainstream success.

title: David Lynch
text: He was then employed by the De Laurentiis Entertainment Group and proceeded to make two films: the science-fiction epic "Dune" (1984), which proved to be a critical and commercial failure, and then a neo-noir mystery film "Blue Velvet" (1986), which stirred controversy over its violence but later grew in critical reputation.

title: David Lynch
text: Next, Lynch created his own television series with Mark Frost, the popular murder mystery entitled "Twin Peaks" (1990–1991).

title: David Lynch
text: He also created a cinematic prequel, (1992), a road film "Wild at Heart" (1990) and a family film "The Straight Story" (1999) in the same period.

title: David Lynch
text: Turning further towards surrealist filmmaking, three of his subsequent films operated on dream logic non-linear narrative structures: "Lost Highway" (1997), "Mulholland Drive" (2001), and "Inland Empire" (2006).

title: David Lynch
text: Meanwhile, Lynch embraced the Internet as a medium, producing several web-based shows, such as the animated "DumbLand" (2002) and the surreal sitcom "Rabbits" (2002).

title: David Lynch
text: Lynch and Frost reunited for a third season of "Twin Peaks", airing in on Showtime in 2017. Lynch co-wrote and directed every episode, as well as reprising his role as Gordon Cole.

title: David Lynch
text: Lynch's other artistic endeavours include: his work as a musician, encompassing three studio albums—"BlueBOB" (2001), "Crazy Clown Time" (2011) and "The Big Dream" ( 2013)—as well as music and sound design for a variety of his films; painting and photography; writing three books—"Images" (1994), "Catching the Big Fish" (2006), and "Room to Dream" (2018); and directing several music videos and advertisements, including the Dior promotional film "Lady Blue Shanghai" (2006).

title: David Lynch
text: An avid practitioner of Transcendental Meditation (TM), Lynch founded the David Lynch Foundation in 2005, which sought to fund the teaching of TM in schools and has since widened its scope to other at-risk populations, including the homeless, veterans and refugees.

title: David Lynch
text: In 2019, he received an Academy Honorary Award; his first Oscar win.

title: Olav Aaraas
text: Olav Aaraas( born 10 July 1950) is a Norwegian historian and museum director. He was born in Fredrikstad.

title: Olav Aaraas
text: From 1982 to 1993 he was the director of Sogn Folk Museum, from 1993 to 2010 he was the director of Maihaugen and from 2001 he has been the director of the Norwegian Museum of Cultural History.

title: Olav Aaraas
text: In 2010 he was decorated with the Royal Norwegian Order of St. Olav.

text: Dana Blankstein- Cohen( born March 3, 1981) is the director of the Israeli Academy of Film and Television. She is a film director, and an Israeli culture entrepreneur.

text: Peter Levin is an American director of film, television and theatre.

title: Brian Kennedy (gallery director)
text: Brian Patrick Kennedy( born 5 November 1961) is an Irish- born art museum director who has worked in Ireland and Australia, and now lives and works in the United States.

title: Brian Kennedy (gallery director)
text: He is currently the director of the Peabody Essex Museum. He was the director of the Toledo Museum of Art in Ohio from 2010 to 2019.

title: Brian Kennedy (gallery director)
text: He was the director of the Hood Museum of Art from 2005 to 2010, and the National Gallery of Australia( Canberra) from 1997- 2004.

title: Jason Moore (director)
text: Jason Moore( born October 22, 1970) is an American director of film, theatre and television.

title: Jesse E. Hobson
text: Jesse Edward Hobson( May 2, 1911 – November 5, 1970) was the director of SRI International from 1947 to 1955. Prior to SRI, he was the director of the Armour Research Foundation.

title: Ronnie Rocket
text: Ronnie Rocket is an unfinished film project written by David Lynch, who also intended to direct it.

title: Ronnie Rocket
text: Begun after the success of Lynch's 1977 film "EraserheadRonnie Rocket" was shelved after Lynch felt he would be unable to find financial backing for the project.

title: Ronnie Rocket
text: He instead sought out an existing script on which to base his next film, settling on what would become 1980's "The Elephant Man".

title: Ronnie Rocket
text: "Ronnie Rocket" was to feature many of the elements which have since come to be seen as Lynch's hallmarks; including industrial art direction, 1950s popular culture and physical deformity.

title: Ronnie Rocket
text: The script featured a three-foot tall man with control over electricity; Lynch first met Michael J. Anderson when tentatively casting for this role, and later cast him in "Twin Peaks" and "Mulholland Drive" as a result.

title: Ian Barry (director)
text: Ian Barry is an Australian director of film and TV.

title: S. N. Mathur
text: S.N. Mathur was the Director of the Indian Intelligence Bureau between September 1975 and February 1980. He was also the Director General of Police in Punjab.

title: Claude de La Trémoille
text: Claude de La Trémoille, 2nd Duke of Thouars (1566 – 25 October 1604) was a sixteenth-century French nobleman of the La Tremoille family.

title: Claude de La Trémoille
text: He was the son of Louis III de La Trémoille and his wife, Jeanne de Montmorency.

title: Claude de La Trémoille
text: King Henry IV of France had been friendly with La Trémoille when he was King of Navarre, but kept him in a subordinate position once he became King of France, preferring La Trémoille's cousin, Henry de La Tour d'Auvergne, the Viscount of Turenne.

title: Claude de La Trémoille
text: In 1587, La Trémoille converted to Protestantism. He fought for Henry IV at the battle of Coutras and also at Ivry, and was rewarded by elevation to the peerage, as Duke of Thouars, in 1595.

title: Claude de La Trémoille
text: This new title, however, made La Trémoille lose more money than it earned him. In 1598, Turenne proposed to his sister-in-law Charlotte-Brabantine to marry La Trémoille.

title: Claude de La Trémoille
text: Thanks to her relations with the houses of Orange and Bouillon, Charlotte-Brabantine played an important part in the French Protestant diplomacy.

title: Claude de La Trémoille
text: They had four children: Henry; Charlotte, who married James Stanley, Earl of Derby; Élisabeth (1601–1604); and Frédéric (1602–1642) comte de Laval.

title: Claude de La Trémoille
text: In 1602, Charlotte-Brabantine dissuaded her husband from engaging in the conspiracy of Biron and encouraged him to lend allegiance to the king.

title: Claude de La Trémoille
text: He died in 1604.

title: Charles Armand René de La Trémoille
text: Charles Armand René de La Trémoille (14 January 1708, in Paris – 23 May 1741), 6th duc de Thouars, was the son of Charles Louis Bretagne de La Trémoille and his wife, Marie Madeleine Motier de la Fayette.

title: Charles Armand René de La Trémoille
text: La Trémoille was a French soldier and president of the States of Brittany. He joined the military at a young age and became a colonel of the Champagne regiment at the age of eighteen.

title: Charles Armand René de La Trémoille
text: Later, he became governor of Île-de-France. He distinguished himself in the battle of Guastalla, in Italy, and was named shortly thereafter sergeant of the armies of the king.

title: Charles Armand René de La Trémoille
text: La Trémoille was the author of some works and was elected a member of the Académie française on 13 February 1738.

title: Charles Armand René de La Trémoille
text: On 29 January 1725 he married his cousin Marie Hortense de La Tour d'Auvergne, the daughter of Marie Armande Victoire de la Trémoïlle (1677–1717) and Emmanuel-Théodose de La Tour d'Auvergne, duc de Bouillon (1668–1730).

title: Charles Armand René de La Trémoille
text: Marie Hortense, like her husband was a granddaughter of Charles Belgique Hollande de La Trémoille.

title: Charles Armand René de La Trémoille
text: From this union was born a son: Jean Bretagne Charles de La Trémoille and a daughter who died in infancy.

title: Henri Charles de La Trémoille
text: Henri Charles de La Trémoille( 17 December 1620 – 14 September 1672) was a French military commander.

title: Henri Charles de La Trémoille
text: He the son of Henry de La Trémoille, duc of Thouars and of La Trémoille, and his wife, Marie de La Tour d'Auvergne.

title: Henri Charles de La Trémoille
text: In 1628, La Trémoille's father, Henri III of Trémoïlle, converted himself and his children to Catholicism, but La Trémoille's mother convinced him to reconvert to Protestantism when he reached the age of majority.

title: Henri Charles de La Trémoille
text: In 1638, he joined the army of his uncle, Frederick Henry, Prince of Orange. In 1648, he married the Calvinist Émilie of Hesse- Kassel, the daughter of William V of Hesse- Kassel( or Hesse- Cassel).

title: Henri Charles de La Trémoille
text: They had five children, including Charles Belgique, his heir, and Charlotte Amélie de la Trémoille. In October 1651, during the Fronde, he came out against Cardinal Mazarin and supported Condé openly.

title: Henri Charles de La Trémoille
text: As a result, in 1656 he was imprisoned in Amiens. La Trémoille's mother obtained his release after several months of imprisonment.

title: Henri Charles de La Trémoille
text: He was then relegated in Poitou then turned over to serve in Holland.

title: Henri Charles de La Trémoille
text: In 1668, he returned from Holland to manage the affairs of the duchy of Thouars, his father being weakened by the gout, and he again re-converted to Catholicism, taking away the children from his wife who fled to the Netherlands.

title: Henri Charles de La Trémoille
text: He died two years before his father in 1672; it was thus his elder son, Charles, who succeeded as the fourth duke of Thouars.

title: Charlotte de La Trémoille
text: " Not to be confused with Charlotte Stanley, Countess of Derby.

title: Charlotte de La Trémoille
text: " Princess Charlotte de La Trémoille( Charlotte Marie Clotilde de La Trémoille; 20 November 1892 – 27 October 1971), 12th Duchess of Thouars, 11th Duchess of La Trémoïlle, 14th Princess de Tarente, 18th princess de Talmond and 18th Countess of Laval was a French noblewoman and the daughter of Prince Louis Charles Marie de La Trémoille and his wife, Hélène Marie Léonie Pillet- Will.

title: Henri de La Trémoille
text: Henri de La Trémoille( 22 December 1598 – 21 January 1674) was the 3rd Duke of Thouars, 2nd Duke of La Tremoille, and Prince of Talmond and Taranto.

title: Henri de La Trémoille
text: He was the son of Claude de La Trémoille and his wife, Charlotte Brabantina of Nassau, and a descendant of the medieval general Louis de La Trémoille.

title: François II de La Trémoille
text: François de La Trémoille( 1505 – 1541) was a French nobleman of the La Tremoille family. He was the son of Charles I de la Trémoille( killed in 1515 at the battle of Marignano) and of Louise de Coëtivy.

title: Charles Bretagne Marie de La Trémoille
text: Prince Charles Bretagne Marie de La Trémoille (24 March 1764 – 10 November 1839), 8th Duke of Thouars, 7th Duke of La Trémoïlle, 10th prince de Tarente, 14th prince de Talmond and 14th Count of Laval, was a French aristocrat and soldier; he was the son of Jean Bretagne Charles de La Trémoille and his wife Princess Marie-Maximilienne of Salm-Kyrburg.

title: Marie Charlotte de La Trémoille
text: Marie Charlotte de La Trémoille( 26 January 1632 – 24 August 1682). was a French noblewoman member of the House of La Trémoille and by marriage Duchess of Saxe- Jena.

title: Marie Charlotte de La Trémoille
text: Born in Thouars, she was the fifth of six children born from the marriage of Henri III de La Trémoille, 3rd Duke of Thouars, 2nd Duke of La Tremoille, Prince of Talmond and Taranto, and Marie de La Tour d'Auvergne.

title: Jean Bretagne Charles de La Trémoille
text: Prince Jean-Bretagne-Charles de La Trémoille (5 February 1737 – 19 May 1792), 7th Duke of Thouars, was a French soldier and the son of Charles Armand René de La Trémoille and his wife, Marie Hortense de La Tour d'Auvergne of Bouillon.

title: Louis Charles de La Trémoille
text: Prince Louis Charles de La Trémoille( 26 October 1838 – 4 July 1911), 9th Duke of Thouars, 8th Duke of La Trémoïlle, 11th prince de Tarente, 15th prince de Talmond and 15th Count of Laval was a French aristocrat and the son of Charles Bretagne Marie de La Trémoille and his third wife, Valentine Eugénie Joséphine Walsh de Serrant.

title: Louis Charles de La Trémoille
text: Louis Charles was also an archivist, bibliophile and also collector.

title: Inoue Masaru (bureaucrat)
text: Viscount was the first Director of Railways in Japan and is known as the" father of the Japanese railways".

title: John Templeton (botanist)
text: John Templeton( 1766–1825) was an early Irish naturalist and botanist. He is often referred to as the" Father of Irish Botany".

title: John Templeton (botanist)
text: He was the father of naturalist, artist and entomologist Robert Templeton.

title: Arthur Beauchamp
text: Arthur Beauchamp( 1827 – 28 April 1910) was a Member of Parliament from New Zealand.

title: Arthur Beauchamp
text: He is remembered as the father of Harold Beauchamp, who rose to fame as chairman of the Bank of New Zealand and was the father of writer Katherine Mansfield.

title: Eystein Glumra
text: Eystein Glumra(" Eystein the Noisy" or" Eystein the Clatterer"; Modern Norwegian" Øystein Glumra") also known as Eystein Ivarsson, was reputedly a petty king on the west coast of Norway, during the 9th Century.

title: Eystein Glumra
text: The" Heimskringla" saga states that Eystein Glumra was the father of Rognvald Eysteinsson and Sigurd Eysteinsson:" The first earl in the Orkney Islands was called Sigurd, who was a son of Eystein Glumra, and brother of Ragnvald earl of More.

title: Eystein Glumra
text: After Sigurd, his son Guthorm was earl for one year. After him Torf- Einar, a son of Ragnvald, took the earldom, and was long earl, and was a man of great power".

title: Eystein Glumra
text: According to the" Orkneyinga Saga", Eystein Glumra was the son of Ivar the jarl of Uplanders and grandson of Halfdan the Old.

title: Eystein Glumra
text: " Orkneyinga Saga" also named Eystein Glumra as the father of Rognvald Eysteinsson:" Heiti, Gorr ’s son, was father of Sveiði the sea-king, the father of Halfdan the old, the father of Ivar the Uplanders ’ earl, the father of Eystein the noisy, the father of earl Rognvald the mighty and wise in council".

title: Eystein Glumra
text: Linnea Hartsuyker's books The Half- drowned King and The Sea Queen cover the lives of Eystein's children.

title: Obata Toramori
text: He was the father of Obata Masamori.

title: Ștefan I. Nenițescu
text: Ștefan I. Nenițescu (October 8, 1897–October 1979) was a Romanian poet and aesthetician. Born in Bucharest, his parents were the poet Ioan S. Nenițescu and his wife Elena ("née" Ștefan).

title: Ștefan I. Nenițescu
text: He attended Sapienza University of Rome from 1920, as well as the literature and philosophy department of Bucharest University.

title: Ștefan I. Nenițescu
text: At first an assistant professor of aesthetics, he later became an associate professor at Bucharest. He served as press secretary and later economic adviser to the Romanian legation in The Hague.

title: Ștefan I. Nenițescu
text: Nenițescu's first publication was a 1915 article about William Shakespeare that appeared in "Noua revistă română".

title: Ștefan I. Nenițescu
text: His first book of poetry, "Denii" (1919), was followed by "Vrajă" (1923) and "Ode italice" (1925). His single volume of theatre was "Trei mistere" (1922).

title: Ștefan I. Nenițescu
text: From 1924, he wrote for "Gândirea", and was a founding member of Romania's PEN Club.

title: Ștefan I. Nenițescu
text: He also contributed poetry and art criticism to "Convorbiri LiterareIdeea europeanăVremeaUniversul literarViața RomâneascăAdevărul" and "Arta plastică".

title: Ștefan I. Nenițescu
text: In 1925, Nenițescu published a treatise, "Istoria artei ca filosofie a istoriei". He translated from Benedetto Croce ("Aesthetic", 1922) and Niccolò Machiavelli ("The Mandrake", 1926).

title: Ștefan I. Nenițescu
text: Initially, Nenițescu's poetry was discursive and religious, in line with the "Gândirist" current. His verse became progressively more hermetic, as can be seen in the anthology volume "Ani" (1973).

title: Ștefan I. Nenițescu
text: Including texts published in the 1940s and '50s, it reveals the intellectualized lyric verse of an eminently classical nature.

title: Anacyndaraxes
text: Anacyndaraxes was the father of Sardanapalus, king of Assyria.

title: Takayama Tomoteru
text: He was the father of Takayama Ukon, and was a Kirishitan.

title: Cleomenes II
text: Cleomenes II( died 309 BC) was Agiad King of Sparta from 369 to 309 BC. The son of Cleombrotus I, he succeeded his brother Agesipolis II.

title: Cleomenes II
text: He was the father of Acrotatus I, the father of Areus I, and of Cleonymus, the father of Leonidas II.

title: Ioan S. Nenițescu
text: Ioan S. Nenițescu (April 11, 1854–February 23, 1901) was a Romanian poet and playwright. Born in Galați, his parents were Ștefan Vasiliu, a manual laborer, and his wife Elisabeta ("née" Zaharia).

title: Ioan S. Nenițescu
text: After completing the Alexandru Ioan I commercial school in his native town , he finished high school, passing the exit examination at Iași.

title: Ioan S. Nenițescu
text: He also audited courses at Iași University's literature faculty. Nenițescu attended an officers' school, volunteered in the Romanian War of Independence and was wounded at Grivitsa.

title: Ioan S. Nenițescu
text: He then studied at the philosophy faculty of Berlin University, taking a doctorate in 1887 at Leipzig University with a thesis on Baruch Spinoza.

title: Ioan S. Nenițescu
text: He worked as a schoolteacher and inspector in Bucharest. He traveled south of the Danube, a trip that resulted in an ample "ethnic and statistical study of the AromaniansDe la românii din Turcia Europeană", 1895).

title: Ioan S. Nenițescu
text: He sat in the Assembly of Deputies for his native Covurlui County, and also served as prefect of Tulcea County in the Dobruja region.

title: Ioan S. Nenițescu
text: Nenițescu's first work appeared in the Galați newspaper "Gardistul civic". A member of "Junimea", he published numerous poems in its organ "Convorbiri Literare".

title: Ioan S. Nenițescu
text: He also contributed to "AlbinaAmicul copiilorRevista nouăRomânul literarȘezătoarea" and "Ziarul presei".

title: Ioan S. Nenițescu
text: While in Bucharest from 1884 to 1888, he published "Țara nouă" magazine, mainly submitting articles on pedagogy, ethics and sociology.

title: Ioan S. Nenițescu
text: His first book was the 1880 poetry volume "Flori de primăvară", followed by "Șoimii de la Războieni" (1882) and "Pui de lei" (1891).

title: Ioan S. Nenițescu
text: Of the plays he wrote, the only one he published was "Radu de la Afumați" (1897). In 1896, Nenițescu was elected a corresponding member of the Romanian Academy.

title: Ioan S. Nenițescu
text: He died in Buzău. His son Ștefan also became a poet.

title: Marion High School (Kansas)
text: Marion High School is a public high school in Marion, Kansas, USA. It is one of three schools operated by Marion USD 408, and is the sole high school in the district.

title: Seoul High School
text: Seoul High School( Hangul: 서울고등학교) is a public high school located in the heart of Seoul, South Korea.

title: North Marion High School (West Virginia)
text: North Marion High School is a public Double A ("AA") high school in the U.S. state of West Virginia, with a current enrollment of 851 students.

title: North Marion High School (West Virginia)
text: North Marion High School is located approximately 4 miles from Farmington, West Virginia on US Route 250 north.

title: North Marion High School (West Virginia)
text: While it is closer to the city of Mannington, West Virginia, and is often considered to be located in Rachel, West Virginia, the school mailing address is Farmington.

title: North Marion High School (West Virginia)
text: Rachel is a small coal mining community located adjacent to the school, and is an unincorporated municipality.

title: North Marion High School (West Virginia)
text: North Marion High School is represented as "Grantville High School" in the popular alternative history novel "1632" by writer Eric Flint.

title: North Marion High School (West Virginia)
text: The novel is set in the fictional town of Grantville, which is based on the real town and surroundings of Mannington.

title: Marion High School (Indiana)
text: Marion High School is a high school in Marion, Indiana with more than 1,000 students.

title: Wheeling High School
text: Wheeling High School, or WHS, is a public four- year high school located in Wheeling, Illinois, a northwest suburb of Chicago, Illinois, in the United States.

title: Wheeling High School
text: It is part of Township High School District 214, which also includes Buffalo Grove High School, Elk Grove High School, John Hersey High School, Prospect High School, and Rolling Meadows High School.

title: Wheeling High School
text: The school serves the communities of Wheeling, Prospect Heights, Arlington Heights, and Buffalo Grove and Mount Prospect.

title: Wheeling High School
text: " U.S. News& World Report" ranked WHS as the 6th high school in District 214, the 90th high school in Illinois, and as the 2,448th high school in the United States in 2019.

title: North Marion High School (Oregon)
text: North Marion High School is a public high school in Aurora, Oregon, United States. The school is part of the North Marion School District with all four schools being located on the same campus.

title: North Marion High School (Oregon)
text: The school draws students from the cities of Aurora, Hubbard, and Donald as well as the communities of Broadacres and Butteville.

title: Creswell High School (Oregon)
text: Creswell High School( Oregon) is a public high school in Creswell, Oregon, United States.

title: Ottawa High School and Junior High School
text: The Ottawa High School and Junior High School, located at 526 and 506 S. Main St. respectively, are the historic former high school and junior high school in Ottawa, Kansas.

title: Ottawa High School and Junior High School
text: The high school was built in 1917, while the junior high school was built from 1927 to 1928; an enclosed hallway connecting the two buildings was built with the junior high school.

title: Ottawa High School and Junior High School
text: The high school was the first school in Ottawa to be built solely as a high school and the eighth school built in Ottawa.

title: Ottawa High School and Junior High School
text: George P. Washburn& Son designed the high school in the Collegiate Gothic style.

title: Ottawa High School and Junior High School
text: When the junior high school was constructed ten years later, the firm, by then known as Washburn& Stookey, designed the building in the same style as the high school.

title: Ottawa High School and Junior High School
text: In 1966, a new high school was built for the upper three classes of students; the freshman class moved to the building in 1976, and the old high school and junior high school became a middle school.

title: Ottawa High School and Junior High School
text: The two buildings were connected by a multi-purpose room in the same year. The middle school later vacated the building.

title: Ottawa High School and Junior High School
text: The school was added to the National Register of Historic Places on October 6, 2000.

title: Calloway County High School
text: Calloway County High School is a public high school located in Murray, Kentucky.

title: Calloway County High School
text: The school was formed from the consolidation of six high schools from across the county: Hazel High School, Lynn Grove High School, Kirksey High School, Almo High School, New Concord High School, and Faxon High School.

title: East High School (Denver)
text: Denver East High School is a public high school located in the City Park neighborhood on the east side of Denver, Colorado, United States.

title: East High School (Denver)
text: It is part of the Denver Public Schools system, and is one of four original high schools in Denver. The other three are North High School, West High School, and South High School.

title: The Strange Case of the Man and the Beast
text: The Strange Case of the Man and the Beast( Spanish: El Extraño caso del hombre y la bestia) is a 1951 Argentine film.

title: W. Augustus Barratt
text: W. Augustus Barratt( 1873- 1947) was a Scottish- born, later American, songwriter and musician.

title: Fernando Fernán Gómez
text: Fernando Fernández Gómez (28 August 1921 – 21 November 2007) better known as Fernando Fernán-Gómez was a Spanish actor, screenwriter, film director, theater director and member of the Royal Spanish Academy for seven years.

title: Fernando Fernán Gómez
text: He was born in Argentina while his mother, Spanish actress Carola Fernán-Gómez, was making a tour in Latin America.

title: Fernando Fernán Gómez
text: He would later use her surname for his stage name when he moved to Spain in 1924. After the Spanish Civil War he began to study law but interrupted his studies to work in theater.

title: Fernando Fernán Gómez
text: In 1942 he began to act in movies but also continued working on plays. He formed his own theater company and received awards for directing and writing.

title: Fernando Fernán Gómez
text: In the 1950s he began to direct movies, including the film of his novel, "El viaje a ninguna parte".

title: Fernando Fernán Gómez
text: He received praise for his 1958 comedy "La vida por delante", which led to a sequel, "La vida alrededor".

title: Fernando Fernán Gómez
text: In 1977, he won the Silver Bear for Best Actor at the 27th Berlin International Film Festival for his role in "The Anchorite".

title: Fernando Fernán Gómez
text: He won the award again at the 35th Berlin International Film Festival in 1985 for his role in "Stico" and finally the Honorary Golden Bear at the 55th Berlin International Film Festival in 2005.

title: Fernando Fernán Gómez
text: Having been very much in demand during the 1970s and 1980s, the 1990s was a less active period for him, but towards the end of his life, he enjoyed something of a revival, featuring in three major projects: "Todo sobre mi madrePlenilunio", and a starring role in the hit "La lengua de las mariposas".

title: Fernando Fernán Gómez
text: He married María Dolores Pradera in 1945; they divorced in 1959. He married Emma Cohen in 2000. Fernando Fernán Gómez died in Madrid on 21 November 2007 from a heart failure.

title: Fernando Fernán Gómez
text: As he was a lifelong anarchist, his coffin was covered in a black and red anarchist flag.

title: Luck in Pawn
text: Luck in Pawn is a 1919 American silent romance film starring Marguerite Clark and directed by Walter Edwards.

title: Luck in Pawn
text: It was produced by Famous Players- Lasky and distributed through Paramount Pictures. The film is based on a play by Marvin Taylor," Luck in Pawn", and ran briefly on Broadway in 1919.

title: Luck in Pawn
text: The film is listed as being preserved at the Library of Congress and New Zealand Film Archive.

title: A Lover in Pawn
text: A Lover in Pawn is a 1920 Swedish silent drama film directed by Victor Sjöström.

title: Rafaela Aparicio
text: Rafaela Díaz Valiente( 9 April 1906 – 9 June 1996) better known as Rafaela Aparicio was a famous Spanish film and theatre actress. She made more than 100 films.

title: Rafaela Aparicio
text: The most remembered are Carlos Saura's" Anna and the WolvesMama Turns 100" and Fernando Fernán Gómez's" El extraño viaje". She died of a stroke in Madrid in a retirement home.

title: El extraño viaje
text: El extraño viaje is a 1964 Spanish black drama film directed by Fernando Fernán Gómez. Famous film director Jess Franco acts as the brother of the protagonist.

title: El extraño viaje
text: The film was a huge flop on its limited release. It was voted seventh best Spanish film by professionals and critics in 1996 Spanish cinema centenary.

title: El extraño caso de la mujer asesinada
text: El Extraño caso de la mujer asesinada is a 1949 Argentine film.

title: Love in Pawn
text: Love in Pawn is a 1953 British comedy film directed by Charles Saunders and starring Bernard Braden and Barbara Kelly.

title: Charles Saunders (director)
text: Charles Joel Saunders (8 April 1904 – April 1997) was an English film director and screenwriter who started in the industry as a film editor, and who also contributed to television.

title: Charles Saunders (director)
text: He was the brother of the theatrical producer Sir Peter Saunders.

title: Fujiwara no Nagara
text: , also known as Fujiwara no Nagayoshi, was a Japanese statesman, courtier and politician of the early Heian period. He was the grandfather of Emperor Yōzei.

title: Laodice of the Sameans
text: Laodice was a Queen of an unknown Kingdom in Asia. She lived at the time of the Seleucid king of Syria Antiochus X Eusebes who reigned 95 BC- 92 or 88 BC.

title: Cleopatra IV of Egypt
text: Cleopatra IV was Queen of Egypt briefly from 116 to 115 BC, jointly with her husband Ptolemy IX Lathyros. She later became queen consort of Syria as the wife of Antiochus IX Cyzicenus.

title: Antiochus X Eusebes
text: Antiochus X Eusebes Philopator (–92 or 88 BC) was a Hellenistic Seleucid monarch who reigned as the King of Syria between 95 BC and 92 BC or 89/88 BC (224 SE (Seleucid year)).

title: Antiochus X Eusebes
text: He was the son of Antiochus IX and perhaps his Egyptian wife Cleopatra IV.

title: Antiochus X Eusebes
text: He lived in a period during which there was a general disintegration of Seleucid Syria characterized by civil wars, foreign interference by Ptolemaic Egypt and incursions by the Parthians.

title: Antiochus X Eusebes
text: Antiochus IX was killed in 95BC at the hands of Seleucus VI, the son of his half-brother and rival Antiochus VIII.

title: Antiochus X Eusebes
text: Antiochus X then went to the city of Aradus where he declared himself king. He avenged his father by defeating Seleucus VI, who was eventually killed.

title: Antiochus X Eusebes
text: Antiochus X did not enjoy a stable reign as he had to face three of Seleucus VI's brothers, Antiochus XI, Philip I and Demetrius III.

title: Antiochus X Eusebes
text: Antiochus XI defeated AntiochusX and expelled him from the capital Antioch in 93 BC. A few months later, AntiochusX regained his position and killed Antiochus XI.

title: Antiochus X Eusebes
text: This led to both Philip I and Demetrius III becoming involved. The civil war continued but its final outcome is uncertain due to the contradictions between different ancient historians' accounts.

title: Antiochus X Eusebes
text: AntiochusX married his stepmother, Antiochus IX's widow Cleopatra Selene, and had several children with her, including a future king Antiochus XIII.

title: Antiochus X Eusebes
text: The death of Antiochus X is shrouded in mystery. The year of his demise is traditionally given by modern scholars as 92 BC, but other dates are also possible including the year 224 SE (89/88BC).

title: Antiochus X Eusebes
text: The most reliable account of his end is that of the first century historian Josephus, who wrote that AntiochusX marched east to fight off the Parthians who were attacking a queen called Laodice; the identity of this queen and who her people were continues to be debated.

title: Antiochus X Eusebes
text: Other accounts exist: the ancient Greek historian Appian has AntiochusX defeated by the Armenian king Tigranes II and losing his kingdom; the third century historian Eusebius wrote that AntiochusX was defeated by his cousins and escaped to the Parthians before asking the Romans for help in having him reinstated on the throne.

title: Antiochus X Eusebes
text: Modern scholars prefer the account of Josephus and question practically every aspect of the versions presented by other ancient historians.

title: Antiochus X Eusebes
text: Numismatic evidence shows that AntiochusX was succeeded in Antioch by Demetrius III, who controlled the capital in SE (88/87 BC).

title: Abd al-Muttalib
text: Abd al- Muttalib Shaybah ibn Hashim( c. 497 – 578) was the grandfather of Islamic prophet Muhammad.

title: Guillaume Wittouck
text: Guillaume Wittouck( 1749- 1829) was a Belgian lawyer and High Magistrate. He was the Grandfather of industrialist Paul Wittouck.

title: Kaya Alp
text: Kaya Alp was, according to Ottoman tradition, the son of Kızıl Buğa and the father of Suleyman Shah, who was, in turn, the grandfather of Ertuğrul, and the great grandfather of the Ottoman Empire founder, Osman I.

title: Prithvipati Shah
text: Prithvipati Shah( ? –1716) was the king of the Gorkha Kingdom in the Indian subcontinent, present- day Nepal. He was the grandfather of Nara Bhupal Shah.

title: Lyon Cohen
text: Lyon Cohen( 1868–1937) was a Polish- born Canadian businessman and a philanthropist. He was the grandfather of singer/ poet Leonard Cohen.

title: John Westley
text: Rev. John Westley( 1636 – 78) was an English nonconformist minister. He was the grandfather of John Wesley( founder of Methodism).

title: Ruth Frow
text: Ruth Frow( 1922–2008) was a peace activist and historian of the labour movement. She co-founded the Working Class Movement Library in Salford, a collection of material associated with labour and working class history.

title: Carlos Eduardo Gutiérrez
text: Carlos Eduardo Gutiérrez Silva( born December 25, 1976 in Treinta y Tres), or simply Carlos Gutiérrez, is a Uruguayan professional footballer.

title: Carlos Eduardo Gutiérrez
text: He played for Uruguay at the Copa América 2001.

title: Ronaldo Tres
text: Ronaldo Tres or simply Ronaldo (born February 13, 1987 in Rodeio Bonito), is a Brazilian defensive midfielder. He currently plays for Figueirense.

title: Crimen a las tres
text: Crimen a las tres is a Argentine crime film directed and written by Luis Saslavsky.

title: The Mattei Affair
text: The Mattei Affair is a 1972 film directed by Francesco Rosi.

title: The Mattei Affair
text: It depicts the life and mysterious death of Enrico Mattei, an Italian businessman who in the aftermath of World War II managed to avoid the sale of the nascent Italian oil and hydrocarbon industry to US companies and developed them in the Eni, a state- owned oil company which rivaled the' seven sisters' for oil and gas deals in northern African and Middle Eastern countries.

title: The Mattei Affair
text: The film shared the" Grand Prix" with" The Working Class Goes to Heaven" at the 1972 Cannes Film Festival. Italian star Gian Maria Volonté was the leading actor in both films.

title: The Mattei Affair
text: The film is an innovative hybrid of documentary and fiction, representing Francesco Rosi ’s concept of cine- inchieste( film investigation).

title: The Mattei Affair
text: The flashback structure shows the influence of" Citizen Kane" and Rosi ’s" Salvatore Giuliano"( 1962).

title: The Mattei Affair
text: Rosi remains faithful to his neo-realist roots with on- location shooting and non-professional actors.

title: The Mattei Affair
text: The film is interspersed with footage of the director trying to find his friend, the investigative journalist Mauro De Mauro, who disappeared while doing research for the film.

title: The Mattei Affair
text: He was killed by the Sicilian Mafia, but like the death of Mattei, De Mauro ’s case was never solved.

title: The Working Class Goes to Heaven
text: The Working Class Goes to Heaven( released in the US as Lulu the Tool) is a 1971 political drama film directed by Elio Petri.

title: The Working Class Goes to Heaven
text: It depicts a factory worker's realisation of his own condition as a simple" tool" in the process of production and, implicitly, his struggle with the trade unions.

title: The Working Class Goes to Heaven
text: The film competed at the 1972 Cannes Film Festival, where it tied with" The Mattei Affair" for the Grand Prix International du Festival, the festival's highest honour.

title: The Working Class Goes to Heaven
text: In Italy, it also won the David di Donatello for Best Film.

title: Boy Goes to Heaven
text: Boy Goes to Heaven, also known as A Boy Who Went to Heaven, is a 2005 South Korean film directed by Yoon Tae- yong, starring Yum Jung -ah and Park Hae- il.

title: Escala en la ciudad
text: Escala en la ciudad(" A stop in the city") is a Argentine film directed and written by Alberto De Zavalia with Carlos Aden.

title: Escala en la ciudad
text: It was produced by SIFAL, a production company run by de Zavalia and his partner Luis Saslavsky.

title: Escala en la ciudad
text: The production company disbanded the following year, after de Zavalia had made" Escala en la ciudad", his feature film debut, and Saslavsky had completed his second and most famous movie," Crimen a las tres".

title: Elio Petri
text: Elio Petri( 29 January 1929 – 10 November 1982) was an Italian political filmmaker best known for the 1970 Academy Award- winning film" Investigation of a Citizen Above Suspicion".

title: Luis Saslavsky
text: Luis Saslavsky( April 21, 1903 – March 20, 1995) was an Argentine film director, screenwriter and film producer, and one of the influential directors in the Cinema of Argentina of the classic era.

title: Luis Saslavsky
text: He was Jewish. Saskavsky was born in Rosario, Santa Fe, Argentina. He directed and wrote over 40 films between 1931 and 1979.

title: Luis Saslavsky
text: He directed films such as Crimen a las tres in 1935 and wrote for films such as Allá en el Norte in 1973. He retired from the industry in 1979.

title: Luis Saslavsky
text: He died in Buenos Aires, aged 91.

title: The Girl in the Fog
text: The Girl in the Fog is a 2017 Italian psychological thriller film based on the novel of the same name by Donato Carrisi.

title: James Cruze
text: James Cruze( born Jens Vera Cruz Bosen, March 27, 1884 near Ogden, Utah – August 3, 1942 in Hollywood, California) was a silent film actor and film director.

title: Wale Adebanwi
text: Wale Adebanwi( born 1969) is a Nigerian- born first Black Rhodes Professor at St Antony's College, Oxford.

title: The Girl in White
text: The Girl in White is a 1952 film drama directed by John Sturges. It is based on the memoirs of the pioneering female surgeon Emily Dunning Barringer.

title: John Sturges
text: John Eliot Sturges( January 3, 1910 – August 18, 1992) was an American film director.

title: John Sturges
text: His movies include" Bad Day at Black Rock"( 1955)," Gunfight at the O.K. Corral"( 1957)," The Magnificent Seven"( 1960)," The Great Escape"( 1963), and" Ice Station Zebra"( 1968).

title: John Sturges

title: Robert Bresson
text: Robert Bresson( 25 September 1901 – 18 December 1999) was a French film director.

title: Robert Bresson
text: Known for his ascetic approach, Bresson contributed notably to the art of cinema; his non-professional actors, ellipses, and sparse use of scoring have led his works to be regarded as preeminent examples of minimalist film.

title: Robert Bresson
text: Bresson is among the most highly regarded French filmmakers of all time.

title: Robert Bresson
text: His works" A Man Escaped"( 1956)," Pickpocket"( 1959) and" Au hasard Balthazar"( 1966) were ranked among the 100 greatest films ever made in the 2012" Sight& Sound" critics' poll.

title: Robert Bresson
text: Other films of his, such as" Mouchette"( 1967) and" L' Argent"( 1983), also received many votes.

title: Robert Bresson
text: Jean- Luc Godard once wrote," He is the French cinema, as Dostoevsky is the Russian novel and Mozart is German music. "

title: Daniel Hobbins
text: Daniel Hobbins is a Professor of History at the University of Notre Dame and an American historian specializing in Medieval France.

title: Daniel Hobbins
text: He has also written in the American Historical Review. In this article, Hobbins writes on Jean Gerson.

title: Daniel Hobbins
text: Although his recent research involves Gerson, Dr. Hobbins' most significant work is" The Trial of Joan of Arc". Published scholarly reviews have been universally positive.

title: Daniel Hobbins
text: For example, Wendy Maier of Oakton Community College writes that this" text is suitable for students, scholars, and anyone with an interest in Joan of Arc.

title: Daniel Hobbins
text: " Other reviews note the significance of the book as being the" first translation of the trial transcripts in fifty years!

title: Daniel Hobbins
text: " Larissa Juliet Taylor, a professor at Colby College, says " The entire scholarly community will welcome two new books that offer English translations of many Johannine sources -- Hobbins' trial translation and introduction, reviewed here, ...

title: Daniel Hobbins
text: " The reviewer thinks that Hobbins' book will be a useful for the classroom, because other editions of the trial transcripts are inadequate in various ways — not enough notes, bad OCR, etc. If this reviewer is correct, Hobbins' book will probably be in use in many college courses.

title: Daniel Hobbins
text: Taylor's review ends:" Daniel Hobbins has provided an extraordinary service to the scholarly and educational community with this outstanding new translation of the Latin trial compilation.

title: Daniel Hobbins
text: Equally important, his critical introduction and notes stand alongside the most valuable recent contributions to scholarship on Joan of Arc.

title: Daniel Hobbins
text: " Another positive reviewer refers to the book as" excellent" and" informative. " The reviewer asks why" do we need Hobbins' new English translation?

title: Daniel Hobbins
text: " The reasons given in this review by Susan Tiefenbrun are that Hobbins' book is" more reliable" and" more convenient.

title: Daniel Hobbins
text: " He" gave guest lectures on Joan of Arc at Bowling Green State University( October 17) and at Ohio Northern University( October 23".

title: Daniel Hobbins
text: He is the recipient of the Nina Maria Gorrissen Prize and Fellow at the American Academy in Berlin for Fall 2011.

title: The Trial of Joan of Arc
text: The Trial of Joan of Arc is a 1962 French historical film directed by Robert Bresson. Joan of Arc is played by Florence Delay.

title: The Trial of Joan of Arc

title: The Trial of Joan of Arc
text: Bresson's screenplay is drawn from the transcriptions of Joan's trial and rehabilitation. Bresson's" Joan of Arc" is often compared with" The Passion of Joan of Arc"( 1928) by Carl Theodor Dreyer.

title: The Trial of Joan of Arc
text: Bresson compared that film unfavorably with his own, expressing his dislike of the actors'" grotesque buffooneries" in Dreyer's film.

title: Ken Burns

title: Ken Burns
text: His widely known documentary series include "The Civil War" (1990), "Baseball" (1994), "Jazz" (2001), "The War" (2007), (2009), "Prohibition" (2011), "The Roosevelts" (2014), "The Vietnam War" (2017), and "Country Music" (2019).

title: Ken Burns
text: He was also executive producer of both "The West" (1996, directed by Stephen Ives), and "Cancer: The Emperor of All Maladies" (2015, directed by Barak Goodman).

title: Ken Burns
text: Burns' documentaries have earned two Academy Award nominations (for 1981's "Brooklyn Bridge" and 1985's "The Statue of Liberty") and have won several Emmy Awards, among other honors.

title: Thomas Jefferson (film)
text: In the film Jefferson is portrayed as renaissance man. Not only was he a dedicated public servant, but was also a writer, an inventor, and a noted architect.

title: Thomas Jefferson (film)
text: Burns captures both the public and private person.

title: Princess Irene of Hesse and by Rhine
text: Princess Irene of Hesse and by Rhine(" Irene Luise Marie Anne, Princess of Hesse and by Rhine", 11 July 1866 – 11 November 1953) was the third child and third daughter of Princess Alice of the United Kingdom and Louis IV, Grand Duke of Hesse and by Rhine.

title: Princess Irene of Hesse and by Rhine
text: Her maternal grandparents were Queen Victoria and Prince Albert of Saxe- Coburg and Gotha. Her paternal grandparents were Prince Charles of Hesse and by Rhine and Princess Elizabeth of Prussia.

title: Princess Irene of Hesse and by Rhine
text: She was the wife of Prince Henry of Prussia, a younger brother of Wilhelm II, German Emperor and her first cousin.

title: Princess Irene of Hesse and by Rhine
text: The SS" Prinzessin Irene", a liner of the North German Lloyd was named after her.

title: Princess Irene of Hesse and by Rhine
text: Her siblings included Princess Victoria of Hesse and by Rhine, wife of Prince Louis of Battenberg, Grand Duchess Elizabeth Feodorovna of Russia, wife of Grand Duke Sergei Alexandrovich of Russia, Ernest Louis, Grand Duke of Hesse and by Rhine, and Empress Alexandra Feodorovna of Russia, wife of Tsar Nicholas II of Russia.

title: Princess Irene of Hesse and by Rhine
text: Like her younger sister, the empress, Irene was a carrier of the hemophilia gene, and Irene would lose her sisters Alix and Elisabeth in Russia to the Bolsheviks.

title: Grand Duke Nicholas Konstantinovich of Russia
text: Grand Duke Nicholas Constantinovich of Russia( 14 February 1850 – 26 January 1918) was the first- born son of Grand Duke Konstantin Nikolayevich and Grand Duchess Alexandra Iosifovna of Russia and a grandson of Nicholas I of Russia.

title: Grand Duke Kirill Vladimirovich of Russia
text: Grand Duke Kirill Vladimirovich of Russia, ("Kirill Vladimirovich Romanov"; – 12 October 1938) was a son of Grand Duke Vladimir Alexandrovich of Russia, a grandson of Emperor Alexander II and a first cousin of Nicholas II, Russia’s last Tsar.

title: Grand Duke Kirill Vladimirovich of Russia
text: Grand Duke Kirill followed a career in the Russian navy serving during twenty years in the Naval Guards.

title: Grand Duke Kirill Vladimirovich of Russia
text: He took part in the Russo-Japanese War, barely surviving the sinking of the battleship at Port Arthur in April 1904.

title: Grand Duke Kirill Vladimirovich of Russia
text: In 1905, he married his paternal first cousin, Princess Victoria Melita of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha. They wed in defiance of Tsar Nicholas II prohibition.

title: Grand Duke Kirill Vladimirovich of Russia
text: In retaliation, the Tsar stripped Kirill of his offices and honors, also initially banishing the couple from Russia.

title: Grand Duke Kirill Vladimirovich of Russia
text: They had two daughters and settled in Paris before being allowed to visit Russia in 1909. In 1910 they moved to Russia, where Nicholas II recognized their marriage.

title: Grand Duke Kirill Vladimirovich of Russia
text: During World War I, Grand Duke Kirill was appointed Commander of the Naval Depot of the Guards in 1915 and in 1916, he achieved the rank of rear Admiral in the Imperial Navy.

title: Grand Duke Kirill Vladimirovich of Russia
text: During the February Revolution of 1917, Kirill marched to the Tauride Palace at the head of the Naval Guards swearing allegiance to the Russian Provisional Government.

title: Grand Duke Kirill Vladimirovich of Russia
text: During the rule of the provisional governmental in the summer 1917, Kirill escaped to Finland where his wife gave birth to the couple's only son.

title: Grand Duke Kirill Vladimirovich of Russia
text: In exile they lived for some years among his wife's relatives in Germany, and from the late 1920s on an estate they bought in Saint-Briac.

title: Grand Duke Kirill Vladimirovich of Russia
text: With the murder of his cousins Tsar Nicholas II and Grand Duke Michael, Kirill assumed the headship of the Imperial Family of Russia and, as next in line to the throne as the Guardian of the Throne in 1924.

title: Grand Duke Kirill Vladimirovich of Russia
text: Kirill proclaimed himself emperor in exile in 1926. He worked for the restoration of the monarchy from exile for the rest of his life, but his claims were contested by some factions of the monarchy movement in a division that continues until today.

title: Grand Duke Kirill Vladimirovich of Russia
text: He wrote a book of memoirs, "My Life in Russia's Service", published after his death. His granddaughter, Grand Duchess Maria Vladimirovna, is the current claimant to the headship of the House of Romanov.

title: Louis II, Grand Duke of Baden
text: Louis II, Grand Duke of Baden( 15 August 1824 – 22 January 1858) was the son of Leopold I, Grand Duke of Baden and Sophie of Holstein- Gottorp, Princess of Sweden.

title: Louis II, Grand Duke of Baden
text: Louis succeeded his father as Grand Duke of Baden on 24 April 1852. His brother Frederick acted as regent, because Louis suffered from mental illness.

title: Louis II, Grand Duke of Baden
text: However, in 1856, Frederick became grand duke as well. He was also an honorary citizen of Karlsruhe.

title: Grand Duke Vyacheslav Konstantinovich of Russia
text: Grand Duke Vyacheslav Konstantinovich of Russia,( 13 July 1862 – 27 February 1879), was a Romanov grand duke and the youngest son of Grand Duke Konstantin Nikolayevich of Russia and his wife Princess Alexandra of Saxe- Altenburg.

title: Grand Duke Vyacheslav Konstantinovich of Russia
text: The English form of his first name is Wenceslas.

title: Prince Karl of Leiningen
text: Prince Karl Vladimir Ernst Heinrich of Leiningen( 2 January 1928 – 28 September 1990) was the younger son of Karl, 6th Prince of Leiningen( 1898 – 1946) and Grand Duchess Maria Kirillovna of Russia.

title: Prince Karl of Leiningen
text: Maria was the daughter of Princess Victoria Melita of Edinburgh and Saxe- Coburg- Gotha and Cyril Vladimirovich, Grand Duke of Russia.

title: Prince Karl of Leiningen
text: As such, Karl was a great- great- grandson of both Queen Victoria of Great Britain and Emperor Alexander II of Russia( as Victoria Melita and Cyril Vladimirovich were both grandchildren of Alexander II).

title: Grand Duke Andrei Vladimirovich of Russia
text: Grand Duke Andrei Vladimirovich of Russia ((14 May 1879 – 30 October 1956) was a son of Grand Duke Vladimir Alexandrovich of Russia, a grandson of Emperor Alexander II and a first cousin of Nicholas II, Russia’s last Tsar.

title: Grand Duke Andrei Vladimirovich of Russia
text: In 1900, he began an affair with the famous ballerina Mathilde Kschessinska, becoming the third grand duke to fall for her.

title: Grand Duke Andrei Vladimirovich of Russia
text: Grand Duke Andrei followed a military career and graduated from the Alexandrovskaya Military Law academy in 1905.

title: Grand Duke Andrei Vladimirovich of Russia
text: He occupied different military positions during the reign of Tsar Nicholas II, but with no particular distinction.

title: Grand Duke Andrei Vladimirovich of Russia
text: He became senator in 1911 and was appointed Major General in the Russian Army in 1915.

title: Grand Duke Andrei Vladimirovich of Russia
text: He took part in World War I, but was away from real combat spending most of the conflict at Russia's headquarters or in idle time in Saint Petersburg.

title: Grand Duke Andrei Vladimirovich of Russia
text: In February 1917, shortly before the fall of the Russian monarchy, Grand Duke Andrei left Saint Petersburg to join his mother in Kislovodsk.

title: Grand Duke Andrei Vladimirovich of Russia
text: He remained in the Caucasus for the next three years. After the October Revolution he was briefly arrested along with his brother, Grand Duke Boris, but they escaped.

title: Grand Duke Andrei Vladimirovich of Russia
text: He departed revolutionary Russia in March 1920, being the last grand duke to leave for exile. In 1921, he married his longtime mistress Mathilde Kschessinska and recognized her son as his.

title: Grand Duke Andrei Vladimirovich of Russia
text: The couple lived in the South of France until 1929 when they moved permanently to Paris, where Kschessinska opened a ballet school.

title: Grand Duke Andrei Vladimirovich of Russia
text: After World War II, Grand Duke Andrei lived under reduced circumstances. Until his death at age 77, he was the last surviving Russian grand duke born in Imperial Russia.

title: Princess Victoria Melita of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha
text: Princess Victoria Melita of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha , later Grand Duchess Victoria Feodorovna of Russia (25 November 1876 – 2 March 1936) was the third child and second daughter of Alfred, Duke of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha, and Grand Duchess Maria Alexandrovna of Russia.

title: Princess Victoria Melita of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha
text: She was a granddaughter of Queen Victoria of the United Kingdom and Emperor Alexander II of Russia.

title: Princess Victoria Melita of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha
text: Born a British princess, Victoria spent her early life in England and lived in Malta for three years, where her father was serving in the Royal Navy.

title: Princess Victoria Melita of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha
text: In 1889 the family moved to Coburg, where Victoria's father became the reigning duke in 1893.

title: Princess Victoria Melita of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha
text: In her teens Victoria fell in love with her maternal first cousin Grand Duke Kirill Vladimirovich of Russia, but the disapprobation of marriage between first cousins of his faith, Orthodox Christianity, discouraged their romance.

title: Princess Victoria Melita of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha
text: Bowing to family pressure, Victoria married her paternal first cousin, Ernest Louis, Grand Duke of Hesse and by Rhine in 1894, following the wishes of their grandmother, Queen Victoria.

title: Princess Victoria Melita of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha
text: Their marriage was a failure. Victoria scandalized the royal families of Europe when she divorced her husband in 1901.

title: Princess Victoria Melita of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha
text: The couple's only child, Princess Elisabeth of Hesse and by Rhine, died of typhoid fever in 1903. Victoria married Grand Duke Kirill Vladimirovich in 1905.

title: Princess Victoria Melita of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha
text: They wed without the formal approval of Britain's King Edward VII, required by the Royal Marriages Act 1772, and in defiance of Tsar Nicholas II.

title: Princess Victoria Melita of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha
text: In retaliation, the Tsar stripped Kirill of his offices and honours, also initially banishing the couple from Russia.

title: Princess Victoria Melita of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha
text: They had two daughters and settled in Paris before being allowed to visit Russia in 1909. In 1910 they moved to Russia, where Nicholas recognized her as Grand Duchess Victoria Feodorovna.

title: Princess Victoria Melita of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha
text: After the fall of the Russian monarchy in 1917, they escaped to Finland (then part of the Russian Empire) where she gave birth to her only son.

title: Princess Victoria Melita of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha
text: In exile they lived for some years among her relatives in Germany, and from the late 1920s on an estate they bought in Saint-Briac.

title: Princess Victoria Melita of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha
text: In 1926, Kirill proclaimed himself emperor in exile and Victoria supported her husband's claims. Victoria died after suffering a stroke while visiting her daughter Maria in Amorbach.

title: Olav Aaraas
text: From 1982 to 1993 he was the director of Sogn Folk Museum, from 1993 to 2010 he was the director of Maihaugen and from 2001 he has been the director of the Norwegian Museum of Cultural History.

title: Olav Aaraas
text: In 2010 he was decorated with the Royal Norwegian Order of St. Olav.

title: Jesse E. Hobson

title: Brian Kennedy (gallery director)
text: Brian Patrick Kennedy( born 5 November 1961) is an Irish- born art museum director who has worked in Ireland and Australia, and now lives and works in the United States.

title: Brian Kennedy (gallery director)
text: He is currently the director of the Peabody Essex Museum. He was the director of the Toledo Museum of Art in Ohio from 2010 to 2019.

title: Brian Kennedy (gallery director)

title: Beat Girl
text: Beat Girl is a 1960 British teen exploitation film directed by Edmond T. Gréville. The film was released in the United States under the title Wild for Kicks.

title: Beat Girl
text: The title character of "Beat Girl" was played by starlet Gillian Hills, who later went on to have numerous small roles in 1960s and 1970s films, such as "Blowup" and "A Clockwork Orange", and became a successful ye-ye singer in France.

title: Beat Girl
text: "Beat Girl" marked the first film roles of British pop idol Adam Faith and actor Peter McEnery, although it was not released until after other films featuring Faith ("Never Let Go") and McEnery ("Tunes of Glory") had already come out.

title: Beat Girl
text: The film also features Christopher Lee and Nigel Green as strip joint operators, and Oliver Reed in a small role as one of the "beat" youth.

title: Beat Girl
text: The original music was composer John Barry's first film commission, and was performed by the John Barry Seven and Orchestra, Adam Faith, and Shirley Anne Field.

title: Beat Girl
text: The "Beat Girl" soundtrack was the first British soundtrack album to be released on a vinyl LP, and it reached number 11 on the UK Albums Chart, paving the way for the release of other film soundtrack albums.
