text: Flavius Eusebius( died after AD 371) was a Roman Senator, who was the brother- in- law of the emperor Constantius II.

title: Julia (daughter of Caesar)
text: Julia (c. 76 BC – 54 BC) was the daughter of Roman dictator Julius Caesar by his first or second wife Cornelia, and his only child from his marriages.

title: Julia (daughter of Caesar)
text: Julia became the fourth wife of Pompey the Great and was renowned for her beauty and virtue.

title: Robert W. Levering
text: Robert Woodrow Levering( October 3, 1914 – August 11, 1989) was a U.S. Representative from Ohio, son-in- law of Usher L. Burdick and brother- in- law of Quentin N. Burdick.

title: Robert Vadra
text: Robert Vadra is an Indian businessman, entrepreneur and the husband of Priyanka Gandhi. He is the son -in- law of Sonia Gandhi and Rajiv Gandhi, and the brother- in- law of Rahul Gandhi.

title: Charles Francis Norton
text: Charles Francis Norton( 1807 – 1835) was a 19th- century Member of Parliament for Guildford.

title: Charles Francis Norton
text: Norton was also a Captain of 52nd Light Infantry; son-in- law of Sir Colin Campbell; brother- in- law of writer Caroline Norton

title: Cornelia (wife of Caesar)
text: Cornelia (c. 97 – c. 69 BC) was the first or second wife of Caesar, and the mother of his only daughter, Julia.

title: Cornelia (wife of Caesar)
text: A daughter of Lucius Cornelius Cinna, Cornelia was related by birth or marriage to many of the most influential figures of the late Republic.

title: Wyndham Goold
text: Wyndham Goold( 1812-1854) was a Member of Parliament( MP) for County Limerick from 1850 to 1854. Goold was educated at Westminster School and Trinity College, Dublin.

title: Wyndham Goold
text: He was the son in law of Frederick Falkiner Goold, Archdeacon of Raphoe and brother in law of Bishop Hamilton Verschoyle

title: John Middleton (architect)
text: John Middleton( 1820–1885) was an English architect of the 19th century. He was born in York, in August 1820.

title: John Middleton Murry Jr.
text: John Middleton Murry Jr. (9 May 1926 – 31 March 2002) was an English writer who used the names Colin Murry and Richard Cowper.

title: Anne Estelle Rice
text: Anne Estelle Rice( 1877 – 1959) was an American sculptor and artist who was one of the chief illustrators for the British periodical" Rhythm", edited by John Middleton Murry and Michael Sadleir from 1911 to 1913.

title: Anne Estelle Rice
text: She established a close relationship with Katherine Mansfield, and famously painted her wearing red.

title: Katherine Mansfield
text: Kathleen Mansfield Murry ("née" Beauchamp; 14 October 1888 – 9 January 1923) was a prominent New Zealand modernist short story writer and poet who was born and brought up in colonial New Zealand and wrote under the pen name of Katherine Mansfield.

title: Katherine Mansfield
text: At the age of 19, she left New Zealand and settled in England, where she became a friend of writers such as D. H. Lawrence and Virginia Woolf.

title: Katherine Mansfield
text: Mansfield was diagnosed with extrapulmonary tuberculosis in 1917; the disease claimed her life at the age of 34.

title: Richard T. Jones
text: Richard Timothy Jones( born January 16, 1972) is an American actor. Jones is best known for his portrayals of Laveinio in the dramatic film" The Wood"( 1999) and Mike of the dramatic films" Why Did I Get Married?

title: Richard T. Jones
text: "( 2007) and" Why Did I Get Married Too? "( 2010). He is also well known for his role as Bruce Van Exel, court services officer on the CBS television series" Judging Amy" that aired from 1999 to 2005.

title: Lamman Rucker
text: Lamman Rucker( born October 6, 1971) is an American actor. Rucker began his career on the daytime soap operas" As the World Turns" and" All My Children", before roles in Tyler Perry's films " Why Did I Get Married?

title: Lamman Rucker
text: Why Did I Get Married Too? ", and" Meet the Browns", and its television adaptation. In 2016, he began starring as Jacob Greenleaf in the Oprah Winfrey Network drama series," Greenleaf".

title: Philip Mairet
text: Philip Mairet( full name: Philippe Auguste Mairet; 1886–1975) was a designer, writer and journalist. He had a wide range of interest: crafts, Alfred Adler and psychiatry, and Social Credit.

title: Philip Mairet
text: He translated major figures including Jean- Paul Sartre. He wrote biographies of Sir Patrick Geddes and A. R. Orage, with both of whom he was closely associated, as well as of John Middleton Murry.

title: Philip Mairet
text: As editor of the" New English Weekly" in the 1930s, he championed both Christian socialism, as it was known at the time, and ideas on agriculture that would come together later as organic farming.

title: John Middleton (footballer, born 1955)
text: John Middleton( born 11 July 1955) is an English former footballer who played for Bradford City and Macclesfield Town. He was born in Rawmarsh, near Rotherham.

title: J. W. N. Sullivan
text: John William Navin Sullivan( 1886–1937) was a popular science writer and literary journalist, and the author of a study of Beethoven.

title: J. W. N. Sullivan
text: He wrote some of the earliest non-technical accounts of Einstein ’s General Theory of Relativity, and was known personally to many important writers in London in the 1920s, including Aldous Huxley, John Middleton Murry, Wyndham Lewis, Aleister Crowley and T. S. Eliot.

title: John Middleton Murry
text: John Middleton Murry (6 August 1889 – 12 March 1957) was an English writer.

title: John Middleton Murry
text: He was a prolific author, producing more than 60 books and thousands of essays and reviews on literature, social issues, politics, and religion during his lifetime.

title: John Middleton Murry
text: A prominent critic, Murry is best remembered for his association with Katherine Mansfield, whom he married in 1918 as her second husband, for his friendship with D. H. Lawrence and T. S. Eliot, and for his friendship (and brief affair) with Frieda Lawrence.

title: John Middleton Murry
text: Following Mansfield's death, Murry edited her work.

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: Fannā (Panāh) Khusraw , better known by his laqab of ʿAḍud al-Dawla ("Pillar of the Dynasty") (September 24, 936 – March 26, 983) was an emir of the Buyid dynasty, ruling from 949 to 983, and at his height of power ruling an empire stretching from Makran as far to Yemen and the shores of the Mediterranean Sea.

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: He is widely regarded as the greatest monarch of the dynasty, and by the end of his reign was the most powerful ruler in the Middle East.

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: The son of Rukn al-Dawla, Fanna Khusraw was given the title of Adud al-Dawla by the Abbasid caliph in 948 when he was made emir of Fars after the death of his childless uncle Imad al-Dawla, after which Rukn al-Dawla became the senior emir of the Buyids.

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: In 974 Adud al-Dawla was sent by his father to save his cousin Izz al-Dawla from a rebellion. After defeating the rebel forces, he claimed the emirate of Iraq for himself, and forced his cousin to abdicate.

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: His father, however, became angered by this decision and restored Izz al-Dawla. After the death of Adud al-Dawla's father, his cousin rebelled against him, but was defeated.

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: Adud al-Dawla became afterwards the sole ruler of the Buyid dynasty and assumed the ancient Iranian title of Shahanshah ("King of Kings").

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: When Adud al-Dawla became emir of Iraq, the capital city, Baghdad, was suffering from violence and instability owing to sectarian conflict.

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: In order to bring peace and stability to the city, he ordered the banning of public demonstrations and polemics.

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: At the same time, he patronized a number of Shia scholars such as al-Mufid, and sponsored the renovation of a number of important Shia shrines.

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: In addition, 'Adud al-Dawla is credited with sponsoring and patronizing other scientific projects during his time. An observatory was built by his orders in Isfahan where Azophi worked.

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: Al-Muqaddasi also reports that he ordered the construction of a great dam between Shiraz and Estakhr in 960.

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: The dam irrigated some 300 villages in Fars province and became known as "Band-e Amir" (Dam of the emir).

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: Among his other major constructions was the digging of the Haffar channel, that joined the Karun river to the Shatt al-Arab river (the confluence of the Tigris and the Euphrates).

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: The port of Khorramshahr was built on the Haffar, at its joining point with the Shatt al-Arab.

title: Safiyy al-Dawla
text: Ṣafiyy al- Dawla Muḥammad ibn ʿ Ali ibn Jaʾfar ibn Falāh was the Fatimid governor of Aleppo between October 1022 and April 1023.

title: Safiyy al-Dawla
text: He was specifically assigned to govern the city, while the citadel of Aleppo was assigned to a separate governor, the eunuch Yumn al- Dawla Sa'adat.

title: Safiyy al-Dawla
text: This marked the first time the Fatimids appointed separate rulers for the city and citadel of Aleppo since they gained direct control over the city in October 1016.

title: Safiyy al-Dawla
text: Safiyy al- Dawla belonged to the Kutama, a militant Berber group that played a major role in the Fatimid military, and he was the grandson of the Fatimid general Ja'far ibn Fallah.

title: Safiyy al-Dawla
text: He was bestowed with the title" ṣafiyy al- dawla"( chosen of the State). Safiyy al- Dawla and Yumn al- Dawla were appointed to Aleppo to replace Abu'l- Najm Badr.

title: Safiyy al-Dawla
text: Nothing is known about their reign and Safiyy al- Dawla was dismissed in April 1023, and succeeded by Sanad al- Dawla Hasan.

title: Eskandar II
text: Eskandar II, was the ruler of the Paduspanid dynasty from 1333 to 1359. He was the son and successor of Taj al- Dawla Ziyar.

title: Sama' al-Dawla
text: Sama' al- Dawla was the Buyid ruler of Hamadan( 1021- 1023 or 1024). He was the son of Shams al- Dawla. Upon his father's death, Sama' al- Dawla succeeded him to the governorship of that province.

title: Sama' al-Dawla
text: Only after a short reign, however, the Kakuyid ruler Muhammad ibn Rustam Dushmanziyar overran Hamadan and ended Sama' al- Dawla's rule.

title: Aziz al-Dawla
text: ʿ Azīz al- Dawla Abū Shujāʿ Fātik al- Waḥīd ī ibn ʿ Abd Allāh al- Rūmī, better known simply as Aziz al- Dawla( d. 1022), was the first Fatimid governor of Aleppo in 1016/ 17–1022.

title: Aziz al-Dawla
text: An ethnic Armenian, Aziz al- Dawla started his political career as a trusted" ghulam"( military slave) of Manjutakin al- Azizi, the Fatimid governor of Damascus during the reign of Caliph al- Hakim( 996–1021).

title: Aziz al-Dawla
text: The latter appointed Aziz al- Dawla governor of Aleppo, which experienced prosperity during his rule.

title: Aziz al-Dawla
text: By 1020, Aziz al- Dawla was acting independently of al- Hakim's authority by issuing coins in his name and having his political sovereignty declared in Friday prayers.

title: Aziz al-Dawla
text: When al- Hakim sent an army to force Aziz al- Dawla into submission, the latter appealed for Byzantine support but canceled the appeal when al- Hakim mysteriously disappeared in early 1021.

title: Aziz al-Dawla
text: Afterward, the Fatimid court attempted to reconcile with Aziz al- Dawla, who nonetheless moved to secure his rule by building a well- fortified palace at the foot of the Aleppo's citadel.

title: Aziz al-Dawla
text: In July 1022, Aziz al- Dawla was murdered in his sleep by one of his" ghulams"( slave soldier) in a plot devised by another of his" ghulams", Abu'l- Najm Badr, with likely backing from al- Hakim's virtual successor, Sitt al- Mulk.

title: Aziz al-Dawla
text: Badr briefly succeeded Aziz al- Dawla as governor but was arrested three months later.

title: Asfar ibn Kurduya
text: Asfar ibn Kurduya( also spelled Kurdawayh, Kardawayh and Kurdawaih), was a Daylamite officer who served the Buyid dynasty.

title: Asfar ibn Kurduya
text: Asfar is first mentioned during the reign of the Buyid ruler Adud al- Dawla, as one of the most prominent officers of the Empire.

title: Asfar ibn Kurduya
text: After the death of Adud al- Dawla in 983, the Buyid Empire was thrown into civil war; the Empire was disputed between his two sons Samsam al- Dawla and Sharaf al- Dawla.

title: Asfar ibn Kurduya
text: Samsam al- Dawla ruled Iraq, while Sharaf al- Dawla ruled Fars and Kerman. In 986, Asfar rebelled against Samsam al- Dawla, and changed his allegiance to Sharaf al- Dawla.

title: Asfar ibn Kurduya
text: However, Asfar quickly changed his mind, and declared allegiance to the latter's other brother Abu Nasr Firuz Kharshadh, who was shortly given the" laqab" of" Baha' al- Dawla.

title: Asfar ibn Kurduya
text: " However, Samsam al- Dawla, with the aid of Fuladh ibn Manadhar, suppressed the rebellion, and imprisoned Baha al- Dawla. After this event, Asfar is no longer mentioned.

title: Ali ibn Kama
text: Ali ibn Kama, the uncle of the Buyid ruler Rukn al- Dawla and the latter's other brothers Mu'izz al- Dawla and Imad al- Dawla, was a Buyid military officer who became prominent among the Buyids of Jibal, and was greatly honored among his Daylamite kinsmen.

title: Ali ibn Kama
text: At the death of Imad al- Dawla in 949, Ali was appointed as the viceroy of Ray by Rukn al- Dawla, who went to Shiraz to secure the succession of his son there, Adud al- Dawla.

title: Ali ibn Kama
text: Meanwhile, the Samanids used this opportunity to invade the territories of Rukn al- Dawla, forcing Ali to flee from Jibal. In ca.

title: Ali ibn Kama
text: 959, a battle ensured between Ali and the Ziyarid prince Bisutun, which resulted in a Buyid victory. In 966, Ali and Rukn al- Dawla defeated a large force of" ghazis" who had arrived from Khorasan.

title: Ali ibn Kama
text: Rukn al- Dawla later died in 976 and was succeeded by his son Fakhr al- Dawla, who had Ali executed.

title: Taj al-Dawla
text: Abu'l-Husain Ahmad , better known by his "laqab" of Taj al-Dawla (Arabic: تاج الدولة،, "Crown of the Dynasty"), was the Buyid ruler of Khuzestan during the 980s.

title: Taj al-Dawla
text: He was the son of 'Adud al-Dawla.

title: Ka'us III
text: Ka'us III, was the fourth ruler of the Paduspanid branch of Kojur. He was the son and successor of Ashraf ibn Taj al- Dawla.

title: Ziyar ibn Shahrakuya
text: Ziyar ibn Shahrakuya( also spelled Shahrakawayh), was a high- ranking Gilaki military officer who served the Buyids.

title: Ziyar ibn Shahrakuya
text: Ziyar was the son of Shahrakawayh, the son of Harusindan, the maternal uncle of the Ziyarid ruler Mardavij.

title: Ziyar ibn Shahrakuya
text: Ziyar had a cousin, who married the Buyid ruler Adud al- Dawla, and bore him one son named Abu Kalijar Marzuban.

title: Ziyar ibn Shahrakuya
text: During that period, Ziyar, along with a Daylamite officer named Fuladh ibn Manadhar, dominated the Buyid court of Baghdad.

title: Ziyar ibn Shahrakuya
text: After the death of Adud al- Dawla in 983, the Buyid Empire was thrown into civil war; the Empire was disputed between his two sons Abu Kalijar Marzuban( who took the name Samsam al- Dawla) and Sharaf al- Dawla.

title: Ziyar ibn Shahrakuya
text: The Turkic soldiers of Iraq shortly betrayed Samsam al- Dawla, and went towards to the court of Sharaf al- Dawla.

title: Ziyar ibn Shahrakuya
text: However, Ziyar managed to make most of them change their mind and stay loyal to Samsam al- Dawla. In 987, Sharaf al- Dawla marched towards Baghdad and deposed Samsam al- Dawla.

title: Ziyar ibn Shahrakuya
text: He then imprisoned Fuladh and had Ziyar executed.

title: My Cousin from Warsaw (film)
text: My Cousin from Warsaw is a 1931 French- German comedy film directed by Carmine Gallone and starring Elvire Popesco, André Roanne and Madeleine Lambert.

title: My Cousin from Warsaw (film)
text: The films screenplay was adapted by Henri-Georges Clouzot. A separate German- language version was also made. The film's art direction was by Julius von Borsody.

title: The Cousin from Nowhere (1934 film)
text: The Cousin from Nowhere is a 1934 German operetta film directed by Georg Zoch and starring Lien Deyers, Lizzi Holzschuh and Walter von Lennep.

title: The Cousin from Nowhere (1934 film)
text: It is based on the 1921 operetta" The Cousin from Nowhere" composed by Eduard Künneke. It was later turned into a 1953 film of the same title.

title: The Cousin from Nowhere (1953 film)
text: The Cousin from Nowhere is a 1953 West German operetta film directed by Karl Anton and starring Vera Molnar, Gerhard Riedmann and Grethe Weiser.

title: The Cousin from Nowhere (1953 film)
text: It is based on the 1921 operetta" The Cousin from Nowhere" composed by Eduard Künneke.

title: Dale Launer
text: Dale Launer( born May 19, 1952) is an American comedy screenwriter. His films include" Ruthless PeopleBlind DateDirty Rotten Scoundrels" and" My Cousin Vinny".

title: Curtis Bernhardt
text: Curtis Bernhardt( 15 April 1899 – 22 February 1981) was a German film director born in Worms, Germany, under the name Kurt Bernhardt.

title: Curtis Bernhardt
text: He trained as an actor in Germany, and performed on the stage, before starting as a film director in 1924, with" Nameless Heroes".

title: Curtis Bernhardt
text: Other films include" A Stolen Life"( 1946) and" Sirocco"( 1951). Bernhardt made films in Germany from 1925 until 1933, when he was forced to flee the Nazi regime — who briefly had him arrested — because he was Jewish.

title: Curtis Bernhardt
text: Bernhardt directed films in France and England before moving on to Hollywood to work for Warner Brothers in 1940.

title: Curtis Bernhardt
text: He produced and directed his last Hollywood picture," Kisses for My President"( 1964), about the nation's first female Chief Executive starring Polly Bergen and Fred MacMurray.

title: Curtis Bernhardt
text: He is interred at Glendale's Forest Lawn Memorial Park Cemetery, near his wife, Pearl Argyle Wellman Bernhardt.

title: Payment on Demand
text: Payment on Demand is a 1951 drama film directed by Curtis Bernhardt and starring Bette Davis and Barry Sullivan.

title: Payment on Demand
text: The screenplay by Bernhardt and Bruce Manning chronicles a marriage from its idealistic early days to its dissolution.

title: Carl Boese
text: Carl Boese( 26 August 1887 – 6 July 1958) was a German film director, screenwriter and producer. He directed 158 films between 1917 and 1957.

title: My Cousin from Warsaw
text: My Cousin from Warsaw is a 1931 German comedy film directed by Carl Boese and starring Liane Haid, Tala Birell and Fritz Schulz.

title: My Cousin from Warsaw
text: A separate French- language version" Ma cousine de Varsovie" was also made, directed by Carmine Gallone. The film was based upon the play by Louis Verneuil.

title: My Cousin from Warsaw
text: The film's art direction was by Julius von Borsody.

title: Kaydyacha Bola
text: Kaydyacha Bola is a Marathi movie released on 4 November 2005. It is inspired by the Hollywood movie My Cousin Vinny.

title: Kaydyacha Bola
text: The movie is produced by Dr. Uday Tamhankar and directed by Chandrakant Kulkarni.

title: Kaydyacha Bola
text: The movie is based on two wrongly accused youngsters whose only lifeline is their clumsy uncle who has to go up against an undefeated prosecutor.

title: Kaydyacha Bola
text: This movie is inspired from the 1992 English My cousin Vinny

title: Mieczysław Krawicz
text: Mieczysław Krawicz( 1893–1944) was a Polish film director from Warsaw.

title: Rachel Feldman
text: Rachel Feldman( born August 22, 1954) is an American director of film and television and screenwriter of television films.

title: Debra Christofferson
text: Debra Christofferson is an American actress of film and TV.

title: Dana Blankstein
text: Dana Blankstein- Cohen( born March 3, 1981) is the director of the Israeli Academy of Film and Television. She is a film director, and an Israeli culture entrepreneur.

title: Hanro Smitsman
text: Hanro Smitsman, born in 1967 in Breda( Netherlands), is a writer and director of film and television.

title: Brian Johnson (special effects artist)
text: Brian Johnson( born 1939 or 1940) is a British designer and director of film and television special effects.

title: Ian Barry (director)
text: Ian Barry is an Australian director of film and TV.

title: Àlex Gómez
text: Àlex Gómez Comes,( born 8 October 1972) is a Spanish football manager. Before starting his senior coaching career in Hong Kong, he has held various positions the youth academy of FC Barcelona.

title: Peter Holden
text: Peter Holden is an American actor and producer of film and television.

title: And the Spring Comes
text: And the Spring Comes is a 2007 film directed by Gu Changwei, written by Li Qiang. This is Gu's second feature following his acclaimed feature debut "Peacock".

title: And the Spring Comes
text: The film premiered at the 2007 Rome Film Festival, and the lead actress Jiang Wenli, also Gu Changwei's wife, won the Best Actress award.

title: Gu Changwei
text: Gu Changwei (born 12 December 1957) is a Chinese cinematographer and film director. Gu was born in Xi'an, Shaanxi in the People's Republic of China.

title: Gu Changwei
text: Gu is considered one of the major Chinese cinematographers working today.

title: James Woolley (clockmaker)
text: James Woolley or James Wolley( ca. 1695 – 22 November 1786) was a watch and clockmaker from Codnor, Derbyshire.

title: James A. Donohoe
text: James A. Donohoe( August 9, 1877 – February 26, 1956) was a United States District Judge of the United States District Court for the District of Nebraska.

title: Jakob Abbadie
text: Jakob Abbadie( 25 September 1727), also known as Jacques or James Abbadie, was a French Protestant minister and writer. He became Dean of Killaloe, in Ireland.

title: Andrew V. McLaglen
text: Andrew Victor McLaglen( July 28, 1920 – August 30, 2014) was a British- born American film and television director, known for Westerns and adventure films, often starring John Wayne or James Stewart.

title: James T. O'Donohoe
text: James T. O'Donohoe( 1898 – 27 August 1928 in Los Angeles, California) born James Thomas Langton O'Donohoe was a screenwriter in the early days of Hollywood, during the silent film era.

title: James T. O'Donohoe
text: His films include" Kindred of the Dust"( 1922)," The Lucky Lady"( 1926)," What Price Glory? "( 1926)," The Spaniard"( 1926)," Two Arabian Knights"( 1927)," Red Lips"( 1928), and" Show Girl"( 1928).

title: James Corker
text: James Corker or James Cleveland( born 1753 or 1754, died March 24, 1791) was a man of English descent who took part in clan fighting in precolonial Sierra Leone.

title: Jacob of Edessa
text: Jacob of Edessa( or James of Edessa)( c. 640 – 5 June 708) was one of the most distinguished of Syriac writers.

title: Kasey James
text: Kurt Sellers( born March 20, 1982), better known as Kasey/ KC James or James Curtis, an American retired professional wrestler who was best known for working in World Wrestling Entertainment.

title: Madame Pasca
text: Alice Marie Angèle Pasquier (November 16, 1833 – May 25, 1914), better known by her stage name Madame Pasca and also known as Alix-Marie Pasquier, was a French stage actress.

title: J. L. Carr
text: Joseph Lloyd Carr( 20 May 1912 – 26 February 1994), who called himself" Jim" or" James", was an English novelist, publisher, teacher and eccentric.

title: Tom Goddard
text: Tom Goddard( 1 October 1900 – 22 May 1966; in full, Thomas William John Goddard, or simply Thomas William Goddard) was an English cricketer and the fifth- highest wicket taker in first- class cricket.

title: Ernie Adams (footballer, born 1922)
text: Ernest William Adams (3 April 1922 – September 2009) was an English professional footballer who played in the Football League for Queens Park Rangers as a forward.

title: Thomas William Booker-Blakemore
text: Thomas William Booker- Blakemore( ne Thomas William Booker)( 28 September 1801 – 7 November 1858), MP, was an industrialist, landowner, and politician.

title: Thoman Burgkmair
text: Thoman Burgkmair, or Thomas Burgkmair( died 1523) was a German painter.

title: William Adams (minister)
text: William Adams( January 25, 1807 – August 31, 1880) was a noted American clergyman and academic.

title: D'Arcy Coulson
text: John D' Arcy Coulson( February 17, 1908 – April 13, 1996) was a Canadian professional ice hockey defenceman who played one season in the National Hockey League for the Philadelphia Quakers.

title: D'Arcy Coulson
text: Born in Sudbury, Ontario and raised in Ottawa, he first played for the Ottawa Shamrocks of the OCHL in 1927.

title: D'Arcy Coulson
text: He played for the Quakers in the 1930 – 31 season, scoring no goals in the NHL but ranking third in the league in penalty minutes that season.

title: D'Arcy Coulson
text: After leaving hockey, Coulson, whose father owned hotels in Sudbury, Ottawa and Hawkesbury and a golf club in Aylmer, Quebec, joined the family business.

title: D'Arcy Coulson
text: The hotel in Sudbury, although no longer owned by the Coulson family, is still named the Coulson Hotel.

title: William E. Adams (New York)
text: William E. Adams( December 25, 1922 – April 1983) was an American lawyer and politician from New York.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: Alfred Albert Thomas William Adams( 24 June 1842 – 1 June 1919), known as Thomas William Adams, was a New Zealand farmer, forester, churchman and educationalist.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: He was born in Graveley, Cambridgeshire, England on 24 June 1842. In 1862 he emigrated to New Zealand on the" African".

title: Thomas William Adams
text: He bought of virgin tussock land at Greendale in Canterbury in 1865 and converted them to farmland. The area prospered over the next few years as more farmers developed land.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: Adams married Lucy Pannett in 1867 and they had a daughter the following year. Lucy drowned in 1869. Adams married her sister Harriet in 1872, and they had five sons and three daughters together.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: Adams was a pioneer in planting trials, obtaining seeds from correspondents around the world, keeping records and publishing the results.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: He started planting trees in 1868 for shelter and fuel, and by 1908 had created an arboretum of 800 species.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: His recommendation of" Pinus radiata" and other pines influenced early New Zealand forestry.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: In 1913 he was a member of the Royal Commission on Forestry, and in 1918 he became a lifetime member of the New Zealand Forestry League.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: For 40 years, Adams taught Sunday school at Greendale, which began by teaching local children to read.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: He was instrumental in the formation of the Greendale day school in 1872, and served on the North Canterbury Education Board from 1892 to 1918, serving as chairman from 1897 to 1905.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: He was also a governor of Canterbury College( now University of Canterbury) from 1897 until his death. He was the first secretary of the Canterbury Baptist Association, and later its president.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: Adams died at Greendale on 1 June 1919 and was buried there. His will left £ 2000 and of land to Canterbury College to be used for a school of forestry.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: Harriet died 15 January 1934 and was buried with him. The school of forestry opened in 1924, and about 1975 a T.W. Adams Scholarship was set up to support postgraduate forestry students.

title: William Adams (wrestler)
text: William Adams was a British wrestler. He competed in the 1908 Summer Olympics.

title: W. Augustus Barratt
text: W. Augustus Barratt( 1873- 1947) was a Scottish- born, later American, songwriter and musician.

title: Nazareth Academy (La Grange Park, Illinois)
text: Nazareth Academy is a Roman Catholic college- preparatory high school located in LaGrange Park, Illinois, United States, in the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Chicago.

title: Nazareth Academy (La Grange Park, Illinois)
text: It was founded in 1900 by the Sisters of St. Joseph.

title: Saginaw High School (Texas)
text: Saginaw High School opened in 2005 as the second high school serving the Eagle Mountain- Saginaw Independent School District( EMS- ISD).

title: Saginaw High School (Texas)
text: It is a 5- A school located in Saginaw, Texas, United States. The mascot is the Rough Rider, and the school colors are cardinal red and Las Vegas gold.

title: Saginaw High School (Texas)
text: The principal is Karen Pressley. Enrollment is just shy of 2,000 students.

title: John Paul II Catholic High School (Schertz, Texas)
text: John Paul II High School is a private Roman Catholic college preparatory high school in Schertz, Texas. It is operated by the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of San Antonio.

title: Simonds Catholic College
text: Simonds Catholic College is a Roman Catholic school for boys located in Melbourne. The school consists of two campuses.

title: Simonds Catholic College
text: The St Mary's campus( years 7- 10) is in West Melbourne and is within walking distance of the Queen Victoria Market. The St Brigid's campus( Years 11- 12) is in Fitzroy North.

title: Simonds Catholic College
text: The college is an associate member of the Associated Catholic Colleges History Simonds was formed in 1996 through the amalgamation of Cathedral College, East Melbourne and St Mary's Boys School.

title: Simonds Catholic College
text: In 2010, the former St Brigid's Primary School in North Fitzroy was renovated, and a new senior campus of the college was opened there.

title: Simonds Catholic College
text: The school is named after Justin Simonds, the first ever Australian born Archbishop who served as Archbishop of Melbourne from 1963- 67.

title: Simonds Catholic College
text: He also served as parish priest of St Mary ’s where the Years 7- 10 campus is located.

title: Simonds Catholic College
text: Houses Students at Simonds are placed into houses at the start of commencement of year 7 and remain in the same house until Graduation.

title: Simonds Catholic College
text: The schools houses are Goold, Knox, Manix, Polding.

title: Simonds Catholic College
text: Each house is named after a previous Archbishop of Melbourne Throughout the year students are awarded points for their houses through house sports, co-curriculum activities, academic performance and many more ways.

title: Simonds Catholic College
text: The main house competitions are the Swimming Carnival and the Athletics Carnival. Both held in term 1.

title: Simonds Catholic College
text: High performing students in these events are selected to represent the school in the Associated Catholic Colleges Swimming and Athletics Championships

title: DeLaSalle High School (Minneapolis)
text: DeLaSalle High School is a Catholic, college preparatory high school in Minneapolis, Minnesota. It is located on Nicollet Island.

title: DeSales High School (Louisville, Kentucky)
text: DeSales High School is a private, Roman Catholic, college- preparatory school for boys in Louisville, Kentucky, United States.

title: DeSales High School (Louisville, Kentucky)
text: It was established in 1956 and is located in the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Louisville.

title: Saginaw High School
text: Saginaw High School( part of the Saginaw City School District) is located in Saginaw, Michigan, USA. The student enrollment is 593 students.

title: Saginaw High School
text: The school's mission statement is" Saginaw High is committed to ensuring a safe and academic environment where the students will become academically proficient, life long learners, and productive citizens.

title: Castleberry High School
text: Castleberry High School is a public high school in Fort Worth, Texas. It administers grades 9- 12 and is part of the Castleberry Independent School District.

title: Castleberry High School
text: Their rival is Lake Worth High School( Texas).

title: Holy Family High School (Broomfield, Colorado)
text: Holy Family High School in Broomfield, Colorado, is a Roman Catholic college- preparatory high school located in the technology corridor between Denver and Boulder.

title: Holy Family High School (Broomfield, Colorado)
text: The school is operated under the auspices of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Denver.

title: St. Joseph High School (Victoria, Texas)
text: St. Joseph High School is a co-educational, private Roman Catholic college preparatory high school in Victoria, Texas, USA.

title: St. Joseph High School (Victoria, Texas)
text: It is located in the Roman Catholic Diocese of Victoria in Texas.

title: Frederick Augustus, Duke of Nassau
text: Friedrich August, Duke of Nassau, Prince of Nassau- Usingen( 23 April 1738 in Usingen – 24 March 1816 in Wiesbaden) was the last Prince of Nassau- Usingen and, jointly with his cousin, Friedrich Wilhelm of Nassau- Weilburg, first Duke of Nassau.

title: Frederick Augustus, Duke of Nassau
text: He died without surviving male issue and was succeeded by his cousin's son, Wilhelm.

title: Adolf of Nassau (1540–1568)
text: Adolf of Nassau (Dillenburg, 11 July 1540 – Heiligerlee, 23 May 1568) was a count of Nassau, also known as Adolphus of Nassau.

title: Adolf of Nassau (1540–1568)
text: He was the fourth son and sixth child of William I, Count of Nassau-Dillenburg and Juliana of Stolberg. He was the second youngest brother of William the Silent.

title: Prince Nikolaus Wilhelm of Nassau
text: Prince Nikolaus Wilhelm of Nassau (20 September 1832 – 17 September 1905), was the only son of William, Duke of Nassau by his second wife Princess Pauline of Württemberg.

title: Princess Pauline of Württemberg (1810–1856)
text: Princess "Pauline" Friederike Marie of Württemberg, full German name: "Pauline Friederike Marie, Prinzessin von Württemberg" (25 February 1810, Stuttgart, Kingdom of Württemberg – 7 July 1856, Wiesbaden, Duchy of Nassau) was a member of the House of Württemberg and a Princess of Württemberg by birth.

title: Princess Pauline of Württemberg (1810–1856)
text: Through her marriage to William, Duke of Nassau, Louise was also a Duchess consort of Nassau.

title: Princess Pauline of Württemberg (1810–1856)
text: Pauline is an ancestress of the present Belgian, Danish, Dutch, Luxembourg, Norwegian, and Swedish Royal families.

title: Otto I, Count of Nassau
text: Otto I of Nassau,( † between 3 May 1289 and 19 March 1290) was Count of Nassau and is the ancestor of the Ottonian branch of the House of Nassau.

title: Walram II, Count of Nassau
text: Walram II of Nassau,( – 24 January 1276), was Count of Nassau and is the ancestor of the Walramian branch of the House of Nassau.

title: Frederick William, Prince of Nassau-Weilburg
text: Frederick William, Prince of Nassau- Weilburg( 25 October 1768, The Hague – 9 January 1816, Weilburg) was a ruler of Nassau- Weilburg.

title: Frederick William, Prince of Nassau-Weilburg
text: In 1806 he was given the title of Prince of Nassau, while his cousin, Prince Frederick Augustus of Nassau- Usingen, became the Duke of Nassau.

title: Frederick William, Prince of Nassau-Weilburg
text: Frederick William died in January 1816, only two months before his cousin. Both men were succeeded by Frederick William's son, William.

title: Elisabeth of Nassau-Dillenburg, Countess of Wied

title: Elisabeth of Nassau-Dillenburg, Countess of Wied
text: She was a daughter of John V of Nassau-Dillenburg and his wife Elisabeth of Hesse-Marburg. Her brothers were Henry III of Nassau-Breda, John of Nassau-Vianden-Dietz, Ernest of Nassau and William the Rich.

title: Elisabeth of Nassau-Dillenburg, Countess of Wied
text: Her sister was Maria of Nassau.

text: Countess Sophie Nikolaievna of Merenberg, Countess de Torby( 1 June 1868 – 14 September 1927), also known as" Countess Torbay", was the elder daughter of Prince Nikolaus Wilhelm of Nassau and his morganatic wife, Natalia Alexandrovna Pushkina( who had been granted the title of Countess of Merenberg).

title: Henry I, Count of Nassau-Siegen

title: Henry I, Count of Nassau-Siegen
text: He comes from the Ottonian branch of the House of Nassau.

title: James Tinling
text: James Tinling( May 8, 1889 in Seattle – May 14, 1967 in Los Angeles) was an American film director.

title: James Tinling
text: He worked during the silent period as a prop boy and stuntman, and directed primarily for 20th Century Fox in the 1930s and 1940s.

title: James Tinling
text: He has been cited as one of the best B-film directors for Fox, known for directing numerous westerns and lighthearted films, including" Charlie Chan in Shanghai"( 1935).

text: The Intended is 2002 English- language period drama film directed by Kristian Levring and starring Janet McTeer( who also co-wrote the screenplay), JJ Feild, Olympia Dukakis, Tony Maudsley and Brenda Fricker.

title: The Intended
text: It centres on a surveyor and his fiancée who arrive in a remote Malaysian trading post and encounter a close- fisted ivory trader and her ill- meaning family.

title: 45 Fathers

text: The art director was Tomoo Shimogawara.

title: Kristian Levring
text: His feature films as director include" Et skud fra hjertet The King is Alive The Intended Fear Me Not", and" The Salvation".

title: Duchess Maria Elisabeth in Bavaria
text: Duchess" Maria Elisabeth" Amalie Franziska in Bavaria( 5 May 1784 – 1 June 1849) was a Duchess in Bavaria as a member of the Palatine Birkenfeld- Gelnhausen line of the House of Wittelsbach and through her marriage to Louis- Alexandre Berthier became Princess of Wagram and Princess of Neuchâtel.

title: Louis-Alexandre Berthier
text: Louis- Alexandre Berthier( 20 November 1753 – 1 June 1815), 1st Prince of Wagram, Sovereign Prince of Neuchâtel, was a French Marshal and Vice- Constable of the Empire, and Chief of Staff under Napoleon.

title: Alexandre Louis Philippe Marie Berthier, 4th Prince of Wagram
text: Alexandre Louis Philippe Marie Berthier( July 20, 1883, Paris – May 30, 1918, Barenton- sur- Serre; 4th Prince de Wagram) was the son of Bertha Clara von Rothschild of the German branch of the prominent Rothschild family and Louis Philippe Marie Alexandre Berthier, 3rd Prince de Wagram( 1836 – 1911).

title: Alexandre Louis Philippe Marie Berthier, 4th Prince of Wagram
text: The family resided in the ancestral home, the Château de Grosbois, a large estate in Boissy- Saint- Léger, southeast of Paris.

title: Alexandre Louis Philippe Marie Berthier, 4th Prince of Wagram
text: Alexandre Berthier was an active collector of impressionist paintings and owned works by Gustave Courbet, Édouard Manet, Claude Monet, and Pierre- Auguste Renoir.

title: Alexandre Louis Philippe Marie Berthier, 4th Prince of Wagram
text: Through a relationship with Marie- Louise Salivas dite Welson, he had a daughter, Monique Berthier de Wagram( 1914–2000).

title: Alexandre Louis Philippe Marie Berthier, 4th Prince of Wagram
text: Alexandre Berthier had not yet married when he was killed in action at Barenton- sur- Cere during World War I. As such, the title became extinct.

title: Alexandre Louis Philippe Marie Berthier, 4th Prince of Wagram
text: His daughter, though married three times( to two men), had no children, and so Alexander Berthier has no living descendants.

title: Louis d'Orléans, Prince of Condé

title: Louis d'Orléans, Prince of Condé
text: He was the first member of a royal house to visit the Australian continent.

title: Louis Philippe, Crown Prince of Belgium
text: Louis- Philippe, Crown Prince of Belgium( Louis Philippe Léopold Victor Ernest; 24 July 1833 – 16 May 1834), was the eldest child and heir- apparent of King Leopold I of the Belgians and his second wife, Princess Louise d'Orléans.

text: George Louis, Prince of Erbach- Schönberg( 1 January 190327 January 1971) was the 3rd Prince of Erbach- Schönberg, elder son of Alexander, 2nd Prince of Erbach- Schönberg.

title: Napoléon Alexandre Berthier, 2nd Prince of Wagram
text: Napoléon Alexandre Louis Joseph Berthier, 2nd Prince of Wagram (11 September 1810, Paris10 February 1887, Paris) was a French politician and nobleman.

title: Napoléon Alexandre Berthier, 2nd Prince of Wagram
text: Son of Louis-Alexandre Berthier, 1st Prince of Wagram, and Duchess Maria Elisabeth in Bavaria (and by his mother, grandnephew of King Maximilian I of Bavaria).

text: Jean-Marie Alexandre is a French politician, who, from 1987 until 1994, was a Member of the European Parliament representing France for the Socialist Party.

text: Louis Philippe Marie "Alexandre" Berthier, 3rd Prince of Wagram (24 March 1836, Paris – 15 July 1911, Château de Grosbois) was a French nobleman and prince of Wagram.

title: Alexandre Berthier, 3rd Prince of Wagram
text: He was the son of Napoléon Alexandre Berthier and Zénaïde Françoise Clary and grandson of Louis Alexandre Berthier.

title: Prince Philippe, Count of Paris
text: He was the Count of Paris as Orléanist claimant to the French throne from 1848 until his death.

text: Giacomo Feo( c. 1471 – 27 August 1495), was the second husband of Caterina Sforza, Countess of Forlì. He was born and died in Forlì.

title: Alberto Visconti

title: Gian Galeazzo Visconti
text: Gian Galeazzo Visconti (16 October 1351 – 3 September 1402), son of Galeazzo II Visconti and Bianca of Savoy, was the first Duke of Milan (1395) and ruled the late-medieval city just before the dawn of the Renaissance.

title: Gian Galeazzo Visconti
text: He was the founding patron of the Certosa di Pavia, completing the Visconti Castle at Pavia begun by his father and furthering work on the Duomo of Milan.

title: Pietro Visconti
text: Pietro Visconti( born 24 May 1989) is an Italian football player who plays for Novara.

title: Mario Visconti
text: Mario Visconti( born 23 October 1968) is a former professional tennis player from Italy.

title: Giovanni Visconti (cyclist)
text: Giovanni Visconti( born 13 January 1983) is an Italian professional road racing cyclist, who currently rides for UCI Professional Continental team.

title: Caterina Visconti
text: Caterina Visconti (1361 – 17 October 1404) was Duchess of Milan as the second spouse of Gian Galeazzo Visconti, the first Duke of Milan, and was the mother of two succeeding Dukes of Milan, Gian Maria and Filippo Maria Visconti.

title: Caterina Visconti
text: Caterina served as Regent of Milan from 1402 to 1404, during her elder son's minority, but due to Gian Maria's suspicion of her alleged treason (planted in his mind by her enemy, the condottiero Facino Cane), he had his mother arrested and imprisoned in the castle of Monza, where she was presumably poisoned in 1404.

title: A Quiet Place in the Country
text: A Quiet Place in the Country is a 1968 giallo thriller film directed by Elio Petri, and starring Franco Nero and Vanessa Redgrave.

title: A Quiet Place in the Country
text: Based on the short story" The Beckoning Fair One" by Oliver Onions, its plot follows an artist who relocates to a rural villa with his girlfriend, where he begins to experience increasingly terrifying, apparently supernatural events.

title: Hassan Zee
text: Hassan Zee is a Pakistani- American film director who was born in Chakwal, Pakistan.

title: Han Tae-you
text: Han Tae- you( born March 31, 1981) is a South Korean football player who since 2004 has played for FC Seoul.

title: A Quiet Place Part II
text: A Quiet Place Part II is an upcoming American horror film that is the sequel to "A Quiet Place" (2018).

title: A Quiet Place Part II
text: The sequel film, written and directed by John Krasinski, stars Emily Blunt, Millicent Simmonds, and Noah Jupe reprising their roles from the first film.

title: A Quiet Place Part II
text: Cillian Murphy and Djimon Hounsou also join the cast. Talks of a sequel began in April 2018 following the box-office success of the first film.

title: A Quiet Place Part II
text: By August 2018, Krasinski was writing the film and he was hired in February 2019 to direct. Production took place in Western New York from June 2019 to September 2019.

title: A Quiet Place Part II
text: Paramount Pictures plans to release "A Quiet Place Part II" in theaters on March 20, 2020.

title: W. Augustus Barratt

title: A Quiet Place to Kill
text: A Quiet Place to Kill is a 1970" giallo" film directed by Umberto Lenzi.

title: When Were You Born
text: When Were You Born is a 1938 murder mystery film directed by William C. McGann and starring Anna May Wong as an astrologer who helps the police.

title: When Were You Born
text: Each of the twelve principal characters was born under a different astrological sign.

title: William C. McGann
text: William C. McGann( April 15, 1893 – November 15, 1977) was an American film director. He directed 52 films between 1930 and 1942.

title: William C. McGann
text: He was born in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and died in Los Angeles, California.

text: Hartley W Lobban (9 May 1926 – 15 October 2004) was a Jamaican-born first-class cricketer who played 17 matches for Worcestershire in the early 1950s.

title: Nelson J. Beach
text: Nelson John Beach( September 21, 1800 Hebron, Tolland County, Connecticut- February 22, 1876 Watson, Lewis County, New York) was an American surveyor, businessman and politician from New York.

title: Gordon Persons
text: Seth Gordon Persons( February 5, 1902 – May 29, 1965) was an American Democratic politician who was the 43rd Governor of Alabama from 1951 to 1955.

title: Gordon Persons
text: He was born and died in Montgomery, Alabama. The Dauphin Island Bridge south of Mobile is formally named for him.

title: Gordon Persons
text: The Gordon Persons Building is a six floor, 60,000 square foot state government office building in Montgomery.

title: Gordon Persons
text: Persons built a successful business running electrical lines in rural Alabama( benefiting from Rural Electrification Administration contracts); in addition to financial gain, he also won considerable popularity.

title: Gordon Persons
text: When running for office in 1950, Persons gained notoriety by touring the state in a helicopter( prompting one opponent to dub him" the man from Mars").

title: Gordon Persons
text: He won the Democratic nomination by defeating a crowded field that included former governor Chauncey Sparks.

title: Gordon Persons
text: In office, his notable accomplishments included abolishing flogging in Alabama's prisons, advocating for the establishment of Alabama Public Television, and imposing speed limits on state highways.

title: Gordon Persons
text: Persons largely accomplished his goal of having four years of" no fighting," maintaining a truce among the various wings of the state Democratic Party.

title: Gordon Persons
text: At the end of his term, Persons ordered the National Guard into Phenix City following the assassination of Attorney- General- elect Albert Patterson.

title: Gordon Persons
text: After leaving office as governor, Persons never sought statewide public office again, although he did make an unsuccessful run for circuit judge late in life.

title: Gordon Persons
text: Persons was an alumnus of Auburn University, though he attended for only one year.

title: Gordon Persons
text: While at Auburn, Persons served as president of a student organization( known as the" Boxcar Reds and Boxcar Blacks") that traveled to away football games.

title: Wale Adebanwi
text: Wale Adebanwi( born 1969) is a Nigerian- born first Black Rhodes Professor at St Antony's College, Oxford.

title: John Beach
text: Major John Beach( January 1, 1812 – August 31, 1874) was a United States Army officer during the Black Hawk and American Civil War.

title: John Beach
text: He was the last U.S. Indian Agent to the Sac and Fox tribes.

title: John Beach
text: A so n-in-law to General Joseph Street, Beach succeeded him as agent to the Sac and Fox upon Street's death, and he eventually hosted the week- long council that resulted in the signing of the treaty for the purchase of much of Iowa from the Sac and Fox Indians in October 1842.

title: John McMahon (Surrey and Somerset cricketer)
text: John William Joseph McMahon( 28 December 1917 – 8 May 2001) was an Australian- born first- class cricketer who played for Surrey and Somerset in England from 1947 to 1957.

title: Greg A. Hill (artist)
text: Greg A. Hill is a Canadian- born First Nations artist and curator. He is Kanyen'kehaka, from Six Nations of the Grand River Territory, Ontario.

title: Wesley Barresi
text: Wesley Barresi( born 3 May 1984) is a South African born first- class and Netherlands international cricketer.

title: Wesley Barresi
text: He is a right- handed wicket keeper- batsman and also bowls right- arm offbreak.

title: Lucio Fulci
text: Lucio Fulci( 17 June 1927 – 13 March 1996) was an Italian film director, screenwriter, producer, and actor.

title: Lucio Fulci
text: Although he worked in a wide array of genres through a career spanning nearly five decades, including comedy, spaghetti western, adventure, science fiction and erotica, he garnered an international cult following for his giallo and horror films.

title: Lucio Fulci
text: His most notable films include the" Gates of Hell" trilogy —" City of the Living Dead"( 1980)," The Beyond"( 1981), and" The House by the Cemetery"( 1981) —as well as" Massacre Time"( 1966)," One on Top of the Other"( 1969)," A Lizard in a Woman's Skin"( 1971)," Do n't Torture a Duckling"( 1972)," White Fang"( 1973)," Four of the Apocalypse"( 1975)," Sette note in nero"( 1977)," Zombi 2"( 1979)," Contraband"( 1980)," The Black Cat"( 1981)," The New York Ripper"( 1982)," Murder Rock"( 1984), and" A Cat in the Brain"( 1990).

title: Lucio Fulci
text: Because of the high level of visceral graphic violence present in many of his films, especially" Zombi 2" and" The Beyond", Fulci is frequently referred to as" The Godfather of Gore", a title also given to Herschell Gordon Lewis.

title: Lucio Fulci
text: Fulci was in his young adult years a politically active radical for the Italian Communist Party.

title: Charlie Chan in Honolulu
text: Charlie Chan in Honolulu is a 1939 American film directed by H. Bruce Humberstone, starring Sidney Toler as the fictional Chinese- American detective Charlie Chan.

title: Charlie Chan in Honolulu
text: The film is the first appearance of both Toler as Chan and Victor Sen Yung as" number two son" Jimmy.

title: Charlie Chan in London
text: Charlie Chan in London is a 1934 American mystery film directed by Eugene Forde. The film stars Warner Oland as Charlie Chan.

title: Charlie Chan in London
text: This is the sixth film produced by Fox with Warner Oland as the detective, and the second not to be lost, after" The Black Camel"( 1931).

title: Charlie Chan in London
text: Robert Altman's film" Gosford Park", set in 1932, features a( fictional) character who produces the Chan films for Fox and claims to be in England doing research for" Charlie Chan in London".

title: H. Bruce Humberstone
text: H. Bruce" Lucky" Humberstone( November 18, 1901 – October 11, 1984) was a movie actor( as a child), a script clerk, an assistant director, working with directors such as King Vidor, Edmund Goulding and Allan Dwan and, ultimately, a director.

title: Charlie Chan in Shanghai
text: Charlie Chan in Shanghai is the ninth Charlie Chan film produced by Fox Film Corporation with the title character played by Warner Oland.

title: The Golden Eye
text: The Golden Eye is a 1948 American film directed by William Beaudine and starring Roland Winters in his fourth appearance as Charlie Chan.

title: The Golden Eye
text: The film is also known as Charlie Chan in Texas( Belgian English title) and Charlie Chan in the Golden Eye( American poster title).

title: Charlie Chan in Paris
text: Charlie Chan in Paris is the seventh film produced by Fox with Warner Oland as Charlie Chan.

title: Charlie Chan in Paris
text: Long thought lost, it is now available on DVD as part of Twentieth Century Fox Home Video's" Charlie Chan Collection, Vol. 1".

title: Charlie Chan in Paris
text: It is the first entry in the series to feature actor Keye Luke, who would go on to become a mainstay in his role as Chan's" Number One Son" Lee.

title: The House by the Cemetery
text: The House by the Cemetery is a 1981 Italian horror film directed by Lucio Fulci. The film stars Catriona MacColl, Paolo Malco, Ania Pieroni, Giovanni Frezza, Silvia Collatina and Dagmar Lassander.

title: The House by the Cemetery
text: It s plot revolves around a series of murders taking place in a New England home – a home which happens to be hiding a gruesome secret within its basement walls.

title: Charlie Chan in Egypt
text: Charlie Chan in Egypt is the eighth of 16 20th Century Fox Charlie Chan films starring Warner Oland in the title role. It was released in 1935.

title: Layne Tom Jr.
text: Layne Tom Jr.( June 19, 1927 – January 14, 2015) was an American actor.

title: Layne Tom Jr.
text: He holds the sole distinction of having played three different Charlie Chan sons: as Charlie Chan Jr. in" Charlie Chan at the Olympics"( 1937), as Tommy Chan in" Charlie Chan in Honolulu"( 1938), and in 1940's" Charlie Chan's Murder Cruise" as Willie Chan, Chan's number seven son.

title: Layne Tom Jr.
text: He also appeared with child star Shirley Temple in" Stowaway"( 1936) as an uncredited Chinese Boy in the Musical Band.

title: Layne Tom Jr.
text: He was credited as Mako with Dorothy Lamour, Jon Hall, and C. Aubrey Smith in" The Hurricane( 1937)", and as an uncredited extra in" San Francisco"( 1936) with stars Clark Gable, Jeanette MacDonald, and Spencer Tracy.

title: Layne Tom Jr.
text: After he got out of the Navy when World War II ended, he turned down a five- year movie contract with Monogram Pictures to go to college instead to become an architect.

title: Layne Tom Jr.
text: He only returned to show business to film two documentaries about Charlie Chan: and" Legacy of Charlie Chan" as himself.

title: Layne Tom Jr.
text: His daughter Kiana Tom is a television host, star of" Kiana's Flex Appeal" fitness series and one of the most widely recognized fitness experts in the world.

title: John Farrell (businessman)
text: John Farrell is the director of YouTube in Latin America.

title: Marcel Brands
text: Marcel Brands( born 1962) is a Dutch former professional footballer who is the Director of Football at English club Everton.

title: Eric Chan
text: Eric Chan Kwok- ki, SBS, IDSM( born 1959) is a Hong Kong civil servant who is the Director of the Chief Executive's Office.

title: Eric Chan
text: Previously, Chan was the Director of Immigration( 2011–2016).

title: La Leona (film)
text: La Leona is a 1964 Argentine film directed by and starring Armando Bo with Isabel Sarli.

title: Armando Bó
text: Armando Bó (3 May 1914 – 8 October 1981) was an Argentine film actor, director, producer, screenwriter and score composer of the classic era.

title: Armando Bó
text: He is mostly known for his sexploitation films in the 1960s and 1970s starring his favorite actress and romantic partner, sex symbol Isabel Sarli.

title: Armando Bó
text: His works include the first nude scene in an Argentine film ("El trueno entre las hojas"). Bó's son is the actor Víctor Bó and his grandson is the screenwriter Armando Bó.

title: Laurent Le Bon

text: Michael Govan( born 1963) is the director of the Los Angeles County Museum of Art since 2006. Prior to this, Govan worked as the director of the Dia Art Foundation in New York City.

title: Afonso III of Portugal
text: " o Bolonhês"), King of Portugal (5 May 121016 February 1279) was the first to use the title "King of Portugal and the Algarve", from 1249.

title: Blanche of Portugal (1259–1321)
text: Blanche of Portugal (25 February 1259 in Santarém, – 17 April 1321 in Burgos; Branca in Portuguese and Blanca in Spanish), was an "infanta", the firstborn child of King Afonso III of Portugal and his second wife Beatrice of Castile.

title: Blanche of Portugal (1259–1321)
text: Named after her great-aunt Blanche of Castile, queen of France, Blanche was the Lady of Las Huelgas, Montemor-o-Velho, Alcocer and Briviesca, the city which she founded.

title: Maximus of Tyre
text: Maximus of Tyre( fl. late 2nd century AD), also known as Cassius Maximus Tyrius, was a Greek rhetorician and philosopher who lived in the time of the Antonines and Commodus, and who belongs to the trend of the Second Sophistic.

title: Maximus of Tyre
text: His writings contain many allusions to the history of Greece, while there is little reference to Rome; hence it is inferred that he lived longer in Greece, perhaps as a professor at Athens.

title: Maximus of Tyre
text: Although nominally a Platonist, he is really an Eclectic and one of the precursors of Neoplatonism.

title: Aristides Baltas
text: Aristides Baltas( born 9 February 1943) is a philosopher of science and physicist who served as the Minister of Culture and Sports of Greece and as the Minister of Culture, Education and Religious Affairs in the cabinet of Alexis Tsipras from 27 January 2015 to 4 November 2016.

title: Aristides Baltas
text: He is currently the Emeritus Professor of Philosophy of Science at the National Technical University of Athens and President of the Nicos Poulantzas Institute.

title: Aristides Baltas

title: Nicos Poulantzas
text: Nicos Poulantzas( 21 September 1936 – 3 October 1979) was a Greek- French Marxist political sociologist and philosopher.

title: Nicos Poulantzas
text: In the 1970s, Poulantzas was known, along with Louis Althusser, as a leading Structural Marxist and, while at first a Leninist, eventually became a proponent of eurocommunism.

title: Nicos Poulantzas
text: He is most well known for his theoretical work on the state, but he also offered Marxist contributions to the analysis of fascism, social class in the contemporary world, and the collapse of dictatorships in Southern Europe in the 1970s( e.g., Franco's rule in Spain, Salazar's in Portugal, and Papadopoulos' in Greece).

title: Giuseppe Cesari
text: Giuseppe Cesari ( February 1568 – 3 July 1640) was an Italian Mannerist painter, also named Il Giuseppino and called Cavaliere d' Arpino, because he was created" Cavaliere di Cristo" by his patron Pope Clement VIII.

title: Giuseppe Cesari
text: He was much patronized in Rome by both Clement and Sixtus V. He was the chief of the studio in which Caravaggio trained upon the younger painter's arrival in Rome.

title: Vincenzo Manenti
text: Vincenzo Manenti( also known as Vincenzio Manenti)( c. 1600- 1674) was an Italian painter of the Baroque period.

title: Vincenzo Manenti
text: He was born, worked and died in Canemorto( now Orvinio) in the region of Sabina and province of Rieti where he had been first a pupil of his father, Ascanio Manenti, but then apprenticed with Giuseppe Cesari and Domenichino.

title: Vincenzo Manenti
text: He painted several works, among them some frescoes and the portraits of cardinals Giulio Roma and Marcello Santacroce, for Tivoli Cathedral and a" St. Xavier" in the Jesuits' church, which no longer exists.

title: Francesco Ruschi
text: Francesco Ruschi was an Italian painter born in Rome around 1610. He studied in Rome under Giuseppe Cesari( Cavalier d' Arpino), Francesco Albani and Pietro da Cortona.

title: Francesco Ruschi
text: His work also shows the influence of Caravaggio. He settled in Venice before 1629. He became a friend of the writer Giovan Francesco Loredan, for whom he drew the cover pages of several works.

title: Francesco Ruschi
text: He moved to Treviso from 1656, and died there in 1661.

title: Volker Schlöndorff
text: He was a prominent member of the New German Cinema of the late 1960s and early 1970s, which also included Werner Herzog, Wim Wenders, Margarethe von Trotta and Rainer Werner Fassbinder.

title: Volker Schlöndorff
text: He won an Oscar as well as the Palme d'or at the 1979 Cannes Film Festival for" The Tin Drum"( 1979), the film version of the novel by Nobel Prize- winning author Günter Grass.

title: Nights on the Road
text: Nights on the Road is a 1952 West German drama film directed by Rudolf Jugert and starring Hans Albers, Hildegard Knef and Lucie Mannheim.

title: Nights on the Road
text: It was produced by the veteran Erich Pommer who had returned to Germany after years of exile. It is one of the more prominent German film noirs.

title: Nights on the Road
text: It was acclaimed by German critics on its release and was awarded a prize at the Berlin Film Festival.

title: Nights on the Road
text: It was shot at the Bavaria Studios in Munich and on location in Frankfurt and various autobahns. The film's sets were designed by Rudolf Pfenninger and Ludwig Reiber.

title: Nights on the Road
text: The production budget was around 900,000 deutschmarks.

title: Adam Baal Shem
text: According to Hasidic legend, Adam Baal Shem of Ropczyce was a rabbi and mystic who first introduced the movement of Hasidism.

title: Adam Baal Shem
text: The leadership of the movement was later handed down from Rabbi Adam to Rabbi Yisrael ben Eliezer, the Baal Shem Tov. The exact identity of Rabbi Adam is unknown.

title: Adam Baal Shem
text: Since the name Adam was rare among European Jewry, Gershom Scholem considers it to be a pseudonym for Heshel Zoref( died 1700).

title: Adam Baal Shem
text: According to Aryeh Kaplan, others identify this Adam with Rabbi David Moshe Abraham( whose initials are Adam) of Troyes or with Adam Zerweiker.

title: Adam Baal Shem
text: Kaplan also writes that it may be an anonym to protect the subject's identity.

title: Adam Baal Shem
text: According to Rabbi Yosef Yitzchak Schneersohn, Rabbi Adam was a disciple of Rabbi Yoel Baal Shem of Zamość, who in turn was a disciple of Rabbi Eliyahu Baal Shem of Worms.

title: Adam Baal Shem
text: According to the" Shivhei HaBesht", Rabbi Adam found manuscripts in a cave, containing hidden secrets of the Torah.

title: Adam Baal Shem
text: Rabbi Adam asked in a dream to whom should he hand down the manuscripts? He was answered to hand them down to Rabbi Israel ben Eliezer of the city of Okopy.

title: Adam Baal Shem
text: Before his death, he commanded his only son, who was an eminent scholar, to search for the city with that name and hand the manuscripts to Israel ben Eliezer.

title: Adam Baal Shem
text: After Rabbi Adam died, his son traveled until he arrived at Okopy, where he married the daughter of a wealthy man and eventually gave the manuscripts to the Baal Shem Tov.

title: Christophe Honoré
text: Christophe Honoré (born 10 April 1970) is a French writer and film director. Honoré was born in Carhaix, Finistère.

title: Christophe Honoré
text: After moving to Paris in 1995, he wrote articles in "Les Cahiers du Cinéma". He started writing soon after.

title: Christophe Honoré
text: His 1996 book "Tout contre LéoClose to Leo") talks about HIV and is aimed at young adults; he made it into a film in 2002.

title: Christophe Honoré
text: He wrote other books for young adults throughout the late 1990s. His first play, "Les Débutantes", was performed at Avignon's Off Festival in 1998.

title: Christophe Honoré
text: In 2005, he returned to Avignon to present "Dionysos impuissant" in the "In" Festival, with Joana Preiss and Louis Garrel playing the leads.

title: Christophe Honoré
text: A well-known director, he is considered an "auteur" in French cinema. His 2006 film "Dans Paris" has led him to be considered by French critics as the heir to the Nouvelle Vague cinema.

title: Christophe Honoré
text: In 2007, "Les Chansons d'amour" was one of the films selected to be in competition at the 2007 Cannes Film Festival.

title: Christophe Honoré
text: Honoré is openly gay, and some of his movies or screenplays (among them "Les Filles ne savent pas nagerDix-sept fois Cécile Cassard" and "Les Chansons d'amour") deal with gay or lesbian relations.

title: Christophe Honoré
text: Honoré has been the screenwriter for some of Gaël Morel's films. He has also directed Louis Garrel in five different films.

title: Brian Kennedy (gallery director)
text: Brian Patrick Kennedy( born 5 November 1961) is an Irish- born art museum director who has worked in Ireland and Australia, and now lives and works in the United States.

title: Brian Kennedy (gallery director)
text: He is currently the director of the Peabody Essex Museum. He was the director of the Toledo Museum of Art in Ohio from 2010 to 2019.

title: Brian Kennedy (gallery director)
text: He was the director of the Hood Museum of Art from 2005 to 2010, and the National Gallery of Australia( Canberra) from 1997- 2004.

title: Olav Aaraas
text: From 1982 to 1993 he was the director of Sogn Folk Museum, from 1993 to 2010 he was the director of Maihaugen and from 2001 he has been the director of the Norwegian Museum of Cultural History.

title: Paul Scheuring
text: Paul T. Scheuring( born November 20, 1968) is an American screenwriter and director of films and television shows.

title: Paul Scheuring
text: His work includes the 2003 film" A Man Apart" and the creation of the television drama" Prison Break", for which he was also credited as an executive producer and head writer.

title: Man at Bath
text: Man at Bath is a 2010 French film by Christophe Honoré starring François Sagat and Chiara Mastroianni.

title: Man at Bath
text: The film premiered in competition at Locarno International Film Festival in Switzerland in 2010 and was released in cinemas on 22 September 2010.

title: Man at Bath
text: This is gay pornographic actor François Sagat's second major role in general release non-pornographic film as Emmanuel after his role in "L.A. Zombie".

title: Man at Bath
text: Director Christopher Honoré told French gay website Yagg.com that he was interested in Sagat because he "redefines the notion of masculinity".

title: Man at Bath
text: Sagat was the only actor to feature in two competition entries during the festival.

title: Paul Annesley Gore
text: Paul Annesley Gore( – 1780) was an Irish politician. He was the second son of Sir Arthur Gore, 2nd Baronet and Elizabeth Annesley, and younger brother of Arthur Gore, 1st Earl of Arran.

title: Paul Annesley Gore
text: He sat in the House of Commons of Ireland, as a Member of Parliament for Mayo from 1751 to 1760, and for Sligo County from 1765 to 1768.

title: Thomas Bruce, 2nd Earl of Ailesbury
text: Thomas Bruce, 2nd Earl of Ailesbury( later styled Aylesbury) and 3rd Earl of Elgin( 1656 – 16 December 1741) was an English politician and memoirist.

title: Thomas Bruce, 2nd Earl of Ailesbury
text: He was the son of Robert Bruce, 2nd Earl of Elgin, and Lady Diana Grey. His maternal grandparents were Henry Grey, 1st Earl of Stamford, and Lady Anne Cecil, daughter of William Cecil, 2nd Earl of Exeter.

title: Thomas Bruce, 2nd Earl of Ailesbury
text: His" Memoirs", which were not published until long after his death, are a valuable source for English history in the last quarter of the seventeenth century.

title: James Stewart, Earl of Arran
text: Captain James Stewart, Earl of Arran( died 1595) was created Earl of Arran by the young King James VI, who wrested the title from James Hamilton, 3rd Earl of Arran.

title: James Stewart, Earl of Arran
text: He rose to become Lord Chancellor of Scotland and was eventually murdered in 1595.

title: James Hamilton, Duke of Châtellerault
text: James Hamilton, Duke of Châtellerault, 2nd Earl of Arran( – 22 January 1575) was a regent for Mary, Queen of Scots.

title: John Evans-Freke, 6th Baron Carbery
text: John Evans- Freke, 6th Baron Carbery( 11 November 1765 – 12 May 1845), styled Sir John Evans- Freke, 2nd Baronet between 1777 and 1807, was an Anglo- Irish politician and peer.

title: John Evans-Freke, 6th Baron Carbery
text: He was the son of Sir John Freke, 1st Baronet. In 1777 he succeeded to his father's baronetcy. He served in the Irish House of Commons as the Member of Parliament for Donegal Borough between 1783 and 1790.

title: John Evans-Freke, 6th Baron Carbery
text: He then represented Baltimore from 1790 to 1800. On 4 March 1807 he succeeded his first cousin once removed, John Evans, as Baron Carbery, and in 1824 was elected to the House of Lords as an Irish representative peer.

title: John Evans-Freke, 6th Baron Carbery
text: On 25 January 1783 he married his cousin, Lady Catherine Charlotte Gore, the third daughter of Arthur Gore, 2nd Earl of Arran.

title: John Evans-Freke, 6th Baron Carbery
text: He died without surviving male issue, and was succeeded in his titles by his nephew, George Evans- Freke.

title: Ralph Neville, 3rd Earl of Westmorland
text: Ralph Neville, 3rd Earl of Westmorland( c. 1456 – 6 February 1499) was an English peer. He was the grandfather of Ralph Neville, 4th Earl of Westmorland.

title: Arthur Gore, 1st Earl of Arran
text: Arthur Gore, 1st Earl of Arran PC (Ire) (1703 – 17 April 1773), known as Sir Arthur Gore, 3rd Baronet from 1741 to 1757 and as Viscount Sudley from 1758 to 1762, was an Irish politician.

title: Arthur Gore, 1st Earl of Arran
text: Arran was the son of Sir Arthur Gore, 2nd Baronet, and Elizabeth Annesley, and was educated at Trinity College, Dublin.

title: Arthur Gore, 1st Earl of Arran
text: In 1727 he was elected to the Irish House of Commons for Donegal Borough, a seat he held until 1758. He was also High Sheriff of Wexford in 1738 and was admitted to the Irish Privy Council in 1748.

title: Arthur Gore, 1st Earl of Arran
text: In 1758 he was raised to the Peerage of Ireland as Baron Saunders, of Deeps in the County of Wexford, and Viscount Sudley, of Castle Gore in the County of Mayo.

title: Arthur Gore, 1st Earl of Arran
text: In 1762 he was further honoured when he was created Earl of Arran, of the Arran Islands in the County of Galway.

title: Arthur Gore, 1st Earl of Arran
text: This was the third occasion that the title Earl of Arran had been created in the Peerage of Ireland. His sister Anne married John Browne, the 1st Earl of Altamont in December 1729.

title: Arthur Gore, 1st Earl of Arran
text: Lord Arran married Jane Saunders, daughter of Richard Saunders (a grandson of the MP Henry Whitfield), in 1731. They had three sons and two daughters.

title: Arthur Gore, 1st Earl of Arran
text: He died in April 1773 and was succeeded in his titles by his eldest son Arthur.

title: Philip Gore, 4th Earl of Arran
text: Philip Yorke Gore, 4th Earl of Arran( 23 November 1801 – 25 June 1884), known as Philip Gore until 1837, was an Anglo- Irish peer and diplomat.

title: Philip Gore, 4th Earl of Arran
text: Born at Dublin Castle, Arran was the eldest son of Colonel the Hon. William John Gore, second son of Arthur Gore, 2nd Earl of Arran, and his wife Caroline, daughter of Sir Thomas Hales, 4th Baronet.

title: Philip Gore, 4th Earl of Arran
text: In 1820 Gore was sent as attaché to the British embassy in Stockholm, was transferred to Paris in 1825 and to Lisbon a year later.

title: Philip Gore, 4th Earl of Arran
text: In 1828 he was promoted to secretary of legation in Buenos Aires where he was" chargé d'affaires" 1832 –34.

title: Philip Gore, 4th Earl of Arran
text: He succeeded his uncle Arthur as earl in 1837 and was made a Knight of the Order of St Patrick in 1841.

title: Philip Gore, 4th Earl of Arran
text: Lord Arran married Elizabeth Marianne Napier, second daughter of Sir William Francis Patrick Napier, in 1838. They had two sons and three daughters.

title: Philip Gore, 4th Earl of Arran
text: He died in June 1884, aged 82, and was succeeded in his titles by his eldest son Arthur. Lady Arran died in 1899.

title: Arthur Gore, 2nd Earl of Arran
text: Arthur Saunders Gore, 2nd Earl of Arran KP, PC (Ire) (25 July 1734 – 8 October 1809) styled The Honourable Arthur Gore from 1758 to 1762 and Viscount Sudley from 1762 to 1773, was an Irish peer and politician.

title: Arthur Gore, 2nd Earl of Arran
text: Arran was the eldest son of Arthur Gore, 1st Earl of Arran, and Jane Saunders.

title: Arthur Gore, 2nd Earl of Arran
text: He was elected to the Irish House of Commons for Donegal Borough in 1759, a seat he held until 1761 and again from 1768 to 1774 and also represented Wexford County between 1761 and 1768.

title: Arthur Gore, 2nd Earl of Arran
text: In 1773 he succeeded his father as second Earl of Arran and entered the Irish House of Lords. Arran was also appointed High Sheriff of County Wexford in 1757 and High Sheriff of Mayo in 1765.

title: Arthur Gore, 2nd Earl of Arran
text: He was admitted to the Irish Privy Council in 1771 and in 1783 he was invested as one of the original sixteen Knights of the Order of St Patrick.

title: Sir Arthur Gore, 2nd Baronet
text: Sir Arthur Gore, 2nd Baronet( c. 1685 – 10 February 1742) was an Irish politician and baronet.

title: Sir Arthur Gore, 2nd Baronet
text: He was the son of Paul Gore, himself son of Sir Arthur Gore, 1st Baronet, and his wife Anne Gore, daughter of Sir John Gore. Gore succeeded his grandfather as baronet in 1697.

title: Sir Arthur Gore, 2nd Baronet
text: He was High Sheriff of Mayo in 1711 and Member of Parliament( MP) in the Irish House of Commons. Gore represented Ballynakill from 1703 to 1713 and then for Donegal Borough until 1715.

title: Sir Arthur Gore, 2nd Baronet
text: Subsequently, he sat for Mayo until 1741. Gore was married to Elizabeth Annesley, daughter of Maurice Annesley. They had eight children, four daughters and four sons.

title: Sir Arthur Gore, 2nd Baronet
text: Gore was succeeded in the baronetcy by his eldest son Arthur, who later was raised to the Peerage of Ireland as 1st Earl of Arran.

title: Sir Arthur Gore, 2nd Baronet
text: Of his daughters, Anne married John Browne, 1st Earl of Altamont and Elizabeth married James Cuffe( died 1762).

title: John Stuart, Lord Mount Stuart
text: John Stuart, Lord Mount Stuart (25 September 1767 – 22 January 1794), was an England-born Scottish Tory politician.

title: John Stuart, Lord Mount Stuart
text: Mount Stuart was the son of the John Stuart, 1st Marquess of Bute and the grandson of Prime Minister John Stuart, 3rd Earl of Bute. His mother was the Hon.

title: John Stuart, Lord Mount Stuart
text: Charlotte Jane, daughter and heiress of Herbert Windsor, 2nd Viscount Windsor. He was born at Grosvenor Square, London in 1767 and educated at Eton and St John's College, Cambridge.

title: John Stuart, Lord Mount Stuart
text: In 1790, he was elected Member of Parliament for Cardiff, a seat he held until his death.

title: John Stuart, Lord Mount Stuart
text: He was appointed Colonel of the Glamorganshire Militia in 1791 and was also Lord-Lieutenant of Glamorganshire between 1793 and his death.

title: John Stuart, Lord Mount Stuart
text: Lord Mount Stuart married Lady Elizabeth McDouall-Crichton, daughter of Patrick McDouall-Crichton, 6th Earl of Dumfries, and his wife Margaret (née Crauford), on 12 October 1792.

title: John Stuart, Lord Mount Stuart
text: They had two sons, who both added the surname "Crichton" before that of "Stuart" in 1805: Lord Mount Stuart died at Bassingbourn Hall near Stansted, Essex, in January 1794, only 26 years of age, a month after being injured in a fall from his horse.

title: John Stuart, Lord Mount Stuart
text: Lady Mount Stuart survived him by three years and died in July 1797, aged 24.

title: Lord Patrick Crichton-Stuart
text: Born Patrick Stuart , he was the second son of John Stuart, Lord Mount Stuart, eldest son of John Stuart, 1st Marquess of Bute, son of Prime Minister John Stuart, 3rd Earl of Bute.

title: Lord Patrick Crichton-Stuart
text: His mother was Lady Elizabeth Penelope, daughter and heiress of Patrick McDouall-Crichton, 6th Earl of Dumfries, while John Crichton-Stuart, 2nd Marquess of Bute, was his elder brother.

title: Lord Patrick Crichton-Stuart
text: His father was killed in a riding accident six months before he was born and his mother died when he was three.

title: Lord Patrick Crichton-Stuart
text: In 1817 he was granted the rank of a younger son of a marquess and assumed by Royal licence the surname of Crichton.

title: Lord Patrick Crichton-Stuart
text: The following year he was returned to Parliament for Cardiff, succeeding his uncle Lord Evelyn Stuart, a seat he held until 1820 and again from 1826 to 1832.

title: Lord Patrick Crichton-Stuart

title: Lord Patrick Crichton-Stuart
text: Their son James also represented Cardiff in the House of Commons. Crichton-Stuart died in September 1859, aged 65. His wife survived him by thirteen years and died in June 1872.

title: Arshad Khan (cricketer)
text: Arshad Khan (born March 22, 1971) is a Pakistani Australian cab driver and former cricketer. He is a right-handed batsman and a right-arm off break bowler.

title: Arshad Khan (cricketer)
text: Arshad was first picked to play against the West Indies during the 1997–98 season, and the following year, was part of the team which won the Asian Test Championship at Dhaka against Sri Lanka.

title: Arshad Khan (cricketer)
text: He captained Pakistan in the 1998 Commonwealth Games Kuala Lumpur. He was a regular inclusion in the Pakistani side until 2001.

title: Arshad Khan (cricketer)
text: Four years later, a strong performance in the Pakistani domestic championship meant that Arshad earned a recall for Pakistan's 2005 tour of India.

title: Arshad Khan (cricketer)
text: He performed credibly, particularly in the Bangalore Test, which Pakistan won in the last session to draw the series.

title: Arshad Khan (cricketer)
text: He toured the Caribbean in May 2005, and has retained his place for the upcoming England series.

title: Arshad Khan (cricketer)
text: During the 2005 One Day International series against England, Arshad was used in the second and fifth matches and proved effective at repressing the England batsmen, allowing very few runs to be scored off him and also taking wickets.

title: Arshad Khan (cricketer)
text: During the fifth match, his economy was just over 3 runs per over – a very good figure for any bowler, especially a spinner.

title: Arshad Khan (cricketer)
text: A tall man at 6'4", Arshad bowls in a classical off-spinner's mould, preferring a nagging line to any great variation. Khan now lives in Sydney, Australia.
