title: Douglas Leiterman
text: Douglas Leiterman (1927 – 19 December 2012) was a Canadian television producer. He was born in 1927 in South Porcupine, Ontario.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: During the early 1950s, he attended the University of British Columbia for a Bachelor of Arts degree, while also working as a "Vancouver Province" reporter.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: He had a brother, cinematographer Richard Leiterman, and a sister, Elaine Campbell, who was married to producer Norman Campbell.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: His sister Phyllis, a teacher and poet, was married to acclaimed film director Allan King.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: He had a sister Mary, a teacher and founder of a school, who was married to renowned Ibiza architect and artist Rolph Blakstad.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: He attended Harvard University in 1954 on a Nieman Fellowship. Leiterman had five children with his first wife, Mary. He toured Eastern Europe with Mary in 1955.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: In 1968 he divorced Mary and married Beryl Fox, who had worked for him at CBC, and had one daughter.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: Leiterman got his start in journalism in British Columbia, before becoming a correspondent on Parliament Hill in Ottawa for the Southam News Service.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: His television credits include "This Hour Has Seven Days" which he co-produced with Patrick Watson from 1964 to 1966. It was the second most popular CBC program.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: After that series was cancelled, Leiterman joined CBS to provide advice for the development of the "60 Minutes" series. He produced a special "Sixteen in Webster Grove" for CBS.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: He produced other series such as "The Fabulous Sixties" and "Here Come the Seventies" (CTV, 1969-1972). He produced documentaries for the United Nations and a nature film documentary series.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: He founded WIred CIty Communications, a cable company in Toronto, in the 1970s. He founded Motion Picture Guarantors Inc.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: , in the 1970s in Canada and The Motion PIcture Bond Company Ltd. , in the 1980s, the second largest completion bond company in the world for motion pictures.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: He operated both companies internationally and bonded such films as "Peter The Great" and TV series such as "Baywatch". He sold MPB to AIG in the early 2000s.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: Leiterman died at his winter residence in Vero Beach, Florida on 19 December 2012.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: He was survived by his partner of 50 years, documentary filmmaker Beryl Fox and their daughter and three of his daughters from his first marriage.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: He was predeceased by his first wife Mary and two of their five children, Mark and Lisa.

title: Margaret Douglas, Fair Maid of Galloway
text: Margaret Douglas, Countess of Douglas( died c. 1474), known as the Fair Maid of Galloway, was a Scottish noblewoman, a member of the Black Douglas family towards the end of the family's position as a major force in Scotland.

title: Margaret Douglas, Fair Maid of Galloway
text: She was the daughter of Archibald Douglas, 5th Earl of Douglas, and Eupheme Graham, daughter of Patrick Graham, Earl of Strathearn and Euphemia Stewart, Countess of Strathearn.

title: Margaret Douglas, Fair Maid of Galloway
text: She acquired Galloway when her two brothers( one of whom was William Douglas, 6th Earl of Douglas) were murdered at the Black Dinner in Edinburgh Castle.

title: Margaret Douglas, Fair Maid of Galloway
text: She married her cousin William Douglas, 8th Earl of Douglas.

title: Margaret Douglas, Fair Maid of Galloway
text: When he was assassinated she obtained permission to marry his brother, James Douglas, 9th Earl of Douglas, but it is not entirely clear that the marriage ever happened, if it did it must have ended in divorce since they both married again.

title: Margaret Douglas, Fair Maid of Galloway
text: She then married John Stewart, 1st Earl of Atholl. She had no children by the Earls of Douglas, but two daughters by the Earl of Atholl.

title: Margaret Douglas, Fair Maid of Galloway
text: These were Janet, wife of Alexander Gordon, 3rd Earl of Huntly and Elizabeth, wife of Andrew Gray, 2nd Lord Gray. They both had issue by their respective husbands.

title: Who...
text: "Who... " is a Japanese-language song recorded by singer Ayumi Hamasaki.

title: Who...
text: It served as a standard track to her second studio album "Loveppears" (1999), and was re-recorded and released as a promotional single by Avex Trax in Japan as part of the promotion towards her fifth greatest hits compilation album on September 10, 2008.

title: Who...
text: The track was written by Hamasaki herself, while production was handled by long-time collaborator Max Matsuura.

title: Who...
text: Musically, it is a J-Pop ballad that was written in third-person perspective, like the rest of the content from "Loveppears".

title: Who...
text: The lyrics details the encapsulation of Hamasaki, and explaining her message of her own philosophy.

title: Who...
text: During its promotional release in 2008, it reached number 49 on the "Billboard" Adult Alternative Songs chart in Japan, and number 19 on the RIAJ Monthly Ringtones chart.

title: Who...
text: It was certified Platinum by the Recording Industry Association of Japan (RIAJ) for digital sales of 250,000 units.

title: Who...
text: To promote the single, it appeared on remix and greatest hits compilation albums conducted by Hamasaki.

title: Ayumi Hamasaki
text: Born and raised in Fukuoka, Fukuoka Prefecture, Hamasaki moved to Tokyo at fourteen in 1993 to pursue a career in singing and acting.

title: Ayumi Hamasaki
text: In 1998, under the tutelage of Avex CEO Max Matsuura, Hamasaki released her debut single "Poker Face" and debut major-label album "A Song for XX".

title: Ayumi Hamasaki
text: The album debuted at the top of the Oricon charts and remained there for five weeks, selling over a million copies.

title: Ayumi Hamasaki
text: Her next ten albums shipped over a million copies in Japan, with her third, "Duty," selling nearly three million.

title: Ayumi Hamasaki
text: " A Best", her first compilation album, is her best-selling album, with more than four million copies sold in Japan.

title: Ayumi Hamasaki
text: Since 2006, after her album "Secret" was released, album and single sales have declined. Hamasaki has sold over 80 million records, making her the best-selling Japanese solo artist of all time.

title: Ayumi Hamasaki
text: During the height of her career, Hamasaki was dubbed the "Empress of J-pop" because of her popularity in Japan and Asia.

title: Ayumi Hamasaki
text: Following an ear infection in 2000, she has suffered worsening hearing loss and is completely deaf in one ear.

title: Alexandre Gaydamak
text: Alexandre "Sacha" Gaydamak (born May 1976 in France) is a French and Israeli businessman. A member of the wealthy Gaydamak family, he is the only son of Arcadi Gaydamak.

title: Alexandre Gaydamak
text: In January 2006 he announced that he was following his father into association football club ownership by becoming co-owner of English Premier League club Portsmouth F.C. with Milan Mandarić.

title: Alexandre Gaydamak
text: His father was the owner of Israeli side Beitar Jerusalem. In July 2006 Alexandre Gaydamak became the sole owner of Portsmouth, although Mandarić remained at the club as non-executive chairman until later that year.

title: Alexandre Gaydamak
text: Gaydamak owns a Luxembourg-based company, Belvia SARL and a British Virgin Islands company, Devondale Investments, which owned Portsmouth F.C. On 21 July 2009, Gaydamak agreed to sell Portsmouth F.C. to Sulaiman Al Fahim in principle, and therefore stepped down from the board.

title: Alexandre Gaydamak
text: He remained the owner of the club until the details of the sale had been finalised on 8 June 2009.

title: Alexandre Gaydamak
text: Gaydamak has been alleged to have asset stripped Portsmouth F.C. before this sale and yet still retains a claim, said to be £32,000,000, against the club as a creditor despite the huge debts at the club.

title: Alexandre Gaydamak
text: Investigations into these allegations are ongoing. On 22 October 2010 Gaydamak's business acumen came into question after reports of him demanding a payment from his former club Portsmouth for an apparent £2.5million.

title: Alexandre Gaydamak
text: It seems that he was unsure that his unpaid debt would be repaid. The case was made more embarrassing after Portsmouth F.

title: Alexandre Gaydamak
text: C had received confirmation several times from Gaydamak himself that the terms were agreed and that he was a secured creditor meaning that not only would be paid in full, but he would also be paid before many unsecured creditors who are set to only receive 20% of any debt.

title: Arcadi Gaydamak
text: Arcadi Aleksandrovich Gaydamak (born 8 April 1952 in Moscow, USSR) is a Russian-born French-Israeli businessman, philanthropist, and President of the Congress of Jewish Religious Communities and Organizations of Russia (KEROOR).

title: Arcadi Gaydamak
text: He emigrated to Israel at the age of 20 and lived on a kibbutz, then moved to France and opened a translation bureau.

title: Arcadi Gaydamak
text: In the 1990s he was awarded the French "Ordre national du Mérite" and the "Ordre du Mérite agricole" for actions taken to rescue personnel in the War in Bosnia.

title: Arcadi Gaydamak
text: In the AngolaGate scandal, he was convicted of failure to declare income. On November 24, 2015, he started serving a prison sentence at Fresnes prison in France for that tax issue.

title: Arcadi Gaydamak
text: In the early 21st century, Gaydamak returned to Israel, where he founded Social Justice, a movement that became a political party.

title: Arcadi Gaydamak
text: He ran for mayor of Jerusalem but did not win. He bought Hapoel Jerusalem, a professional basketball club. He also bought two newspapers, one in France and one in Russia.

title: Arcadi Gaydamak
text: He directed the latter to take a pro-government/Vladimir Putin editorial stance. In Israel he has been a generous philanthropist.

title: Elliot Silverstein
text: Elliot Silverstein( born August 3, 1927, in Boston, Massachusetts) is an American director, who is best known for being the director of the movie" Cat Ballou"( 1965).

title: Tjuyu
text: Tjuyu( sometimes transliterated as Thuya or Thuyu) was an Egyptian noblewoman and the mother of queen Tiye, and the wife of Yuya.

title: Tjuyu
text: She is the grandmother of Akhenaten, and great grandmother of Tutankhamun.

title: Henry IV of France
text: Henry IV (read as ; 13 December 1553 – 14 May 1610), also known by the epithet Good King Henry or Henry the Great, was King of Navarre (as Henry III) from 1572 and King of France from 1589 to 1610.

title: Henry IV of France
text: He was the first monarch of France from the House of Bourbon, a cadet branch of the Capetian dynasty.

title: Henry IV of France
text: He was assassinated in 1610 by François Ravaillac, a fanatical Catholic, and was succeeded by his son Louis XIII.

title: Henry IV of France
text: The son of Antoine de Bourbon, Duke of Vendôme and Jeanne d'Albret, the Queen of Navarre, Henry was baptised as a Catholic but raised in the Protestant faith by his mother.

title: Henry IV of France
text: He inherited the throne of Navarre in 1572 on his mother's death. As a Huguenot, Henry was involved in the French Wars of Religion, barely escaping assassination in the St. Bartholomew's Day massacre.

title: Henry IV of France
text: He later led Protestant forces against the royal army. He and his predecessor Henry III of France were direct descendants of Saint-King Louis IX.

title: Henry IV of France
text: Henry III belonged to the House of Valois, descended from Philip III of France, elder son of Saint Louis; Henry IV belonged to the House of Bourbon, descended from Robert, Count of Clermont, younger son of Saint Louis.

title: Henry IV of France
text: As Head of the House of Bourbon, Henry was "first prince of the blood". Upon the death of his brother-in-law and distant cousin Henry III in 1589, Henry was called to the French succession by the Salic law.

title: Henry IV of France
text: He initially kept the Protestant faith (the only French king to do so) and had to fight against the Catholic League, which denied that he could wear France's crown as a Protestant.

title: Henry IV of France
text: To obtain mastery over his kingdom, after four years of stalemate, he found it prudent to abjure the Calvinist faith.

title: Henry IV of France
text: As a pragmatic politician (in the parlance of the time, a "politique"), he displayed an unusual religious tolerance for the era.

title: Henry IV of France
text: Notably, he promulgated the Edict of Nantes (1598), which guaranteed religious liberties to Protestants, thereby effectively ending the Wars of Religion.

title: Henry IV of France
text: Considered a usurper by some Catholics and a traitor by some Protestants, Henry became target of at least 12 assassination attempts.

title: Henry IV of France
text: An unpopular king among his contemporaries, Henry gained more status after his death. He was admired for his repeated victories over his enemies and his conversion to Catholicism.

title: Henry IV of France
text: The "Good King Henryle bon roi Henri") was remembered for his geniality and his great concern about the welfare of his subjects.

title: Henry IV of France
text: An active ruler, he worked to regularise state finance, promote agriculture, eliminate corruption and encourage education.

title: Henry IV of France
text: During his reign, the French colonization of the Americas truly began with the foundation of the colony of Acadia and its capital Port-Royal.

title: Henry IV of France
text: He was celebrated in the popular song "Vive le roi Henri" (which later became an anthem for the French monarchy during the reigns of his successors) and in Voltaire's "Henriade".

title: Philip, Count of Vertus
text: Philip of Orléans, Count of Vertus( 21/24 July 1396 – 1 September 1420), was the second son of Louis I, Duke of Orléans, and Valentina Visconti, and a grandson of Charles V of France.

title: Philip, Count of Vertus
text: His older brother was the noted poet Charles, Duke of Orléans and his younger brother was John, Count of Angoulême.

title: Prince Henri of Orléans
text: Prince Henri of Orléans( 16 October 1867 – 9 August 1901) was the son of Prince Robert, Duke of Chartres, and Princess Françoise of Orléans.

title: Hannah Arnold
text: Hannah Arnold, also known as Hannah Waterman King, was the grandmother of Benedict Arnolds children.

title: Gaston, Duke of Orléans
text: Gaston, Duke of Orléans (24 April 1608 – 2 February 1660), was the third son of King Henry IV of France and his wife Marie de' Medici.

title: Gaston, Duke of Orléans
text: As a son of the king, he was born a "Fils de France". He later acquired the title Duke of Orléans, by which he was generally known during his adulthood.

title: Gaston, Duke of Orléans
text: As the eldest surviving brother of King Louis XIII, he was known at court by the traditional honorific Monsieur.

title: Prince Jacques, Duke of Orléans
text: Prince Jacques of Orléans, Duke of Orléans," fils de France"( Jacques Jean Jaroslaw Marie; born 25 June 1941 in Rabat, Morocco), is the son of Henri, Count of Paris( the Orléanist claimant to the French throne from 1940 until his death) and his wife, Princess Isabelle of Orléans- Braganza.

title: Philip, Duke of Orléans
text: Philip of Orléans( 1 July 1336 at Vincennes – 1 September 1375 at Orléans) was a Duke of Orléans, Touraine, and Count of Valois, the fifth son of King Philip VI of France and his wife Joan the Lame.

title: Philip, Duke of Orléans
text: His father named him Duke of Orléans, a newly created duchy, in 1344.

title: Charles, Duke of Orléans
text: Charles of Orléans( 24 November 1394 – 5 January 1465) was Duke of Orléans from 1407, following the murder of his father, Louis I, Duke of Orléans, on the orders of John the Fearless, Duke of Burgundy.

title: Charles, Duke of Orléans
text: He was also Duke of Valois, Count of Beaumont- sur- Oise and of Blois, Lord of Coucy, and the inheritor of Asti in Italy via his mother Valentina Visconti, daughter of Gian Galeazzo Visconti, Duke of Milan.

title: Charles, Duke of Orléans
text: He is now remembered as an accomplished medieval poet owing to the more than five hundred extant poems he produced, written in both French and English, during his 25 years spent as a prisoner of war and after his return to France.

title: Hubba bint Hulail
text: Hubba bint Hulail was the grandmother of Hashim ibn' Abd Manaf, thus the great- great- great- grandmother of the Islamic" Nabī"( Prophet) Muhammad ibn Abdullah.

title: Olav Aaraas
text: Olav Aaraas( born 10 July 1950) is a Norwegian historian and museum director. He was born in Fredrikstad.

title: Olav Aaraas
text: From 1982 to 1993 he was the director of Sogn Folk Museum, from 1993 to 2010 he was the director of Maihaugen and from 2001 he has been the director of the Norwegian Museum of Cultural History.

title: Olav Aaraas
text: In 2010 he was decorated with the Royal Norwegian Order of St. Olav.

text: He was the director of the Hood Museum of Art from 2005 to 2010, and the National Gallery of Australia( Canberra) from 1997- 2004.

title: John Francis Dillon (director)
text: He also appeared in 74 films between 1914 and 1931. He was born in New York, New York, was a brother of Robert A. Dillon, and died in Los Angeles, California from a heart attack.

text: James Armour (15 January 1730 – 20 September 1798) was a master mason and father of Jean Armour, and therefore the father-in-law of the poet Robert Burns.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: Hans Barthold Andresen Butenschøn( 27 December 1877 – 28 November 1971) was a Norwegian businessperson.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: He was born in Kristiania as a son of Nils August Andresen Butenschøn and Hanna Butenschøn, and grandson of Nicolay Andresen.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: Together with Mabel Anette Plahte( 1877 – 1973, a daughter of Frithjof M. Plahte) he had the son Hans Barthold Andresen Butenschøn Jr. and was through him the father- in- law of Ragnhild Butenschøn and grandfather of Peter Butenschøn.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: Through his daughter Marie Claudine he was the father- in- law of Joakim Lehmkuhl, through his daughter Mabel Anette he was the father- in- law of Harald Astrup( a son of Sigurd Astrup) and through his daughter Nini Augusta he was the father- in- law of Ernst Torp.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: He took commerce school and agricultural school. He was hired in the family company N. A. Andresen& Co, and became a co-owner in 1910.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: He eventually became chief executive officer. The bank changed its name to Andresens Bank in 1913 and merged with Bergens Kreditbank in 1920.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: The merger was dissolved later in the 1920s. He was also a landowner, owning Nedre Skøyen farm and a lot of land in Enebakk.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: He chaired the board of Nydalens Compagnie from 1926, having not been a board member before that.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: He also chaired the supervisory council of Forsikringsselskapet Viking and Nedre Glommen salgsforening, and was a supervisory council member of Filharmonisk Selskap.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: He was a member of the gentlemen's club SK Fram since 1890, and was proclaimed a lifetime member in 1964. He was buried in Enebakk.

title: John Vernou Bouvier III
text: John Vernou" Black Jack" Bouvier III( May 19, 1891 – August 3, 1957) was an American Wall Street stockbroker and socialite.

title: John Vernou Bouvier III
text: He was the father of First Lady Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis and of socialite Lee Radziwill, and was the father- in- law of John F. Kennedy.

title: Peter Burroughs
text: Peter Burroughs( born 27 January 1947) is a British television and film actor, the director of Willow Management. He is the father- in- law of actor and TV presenter Warwick Davis.

title: Hermann I, Landgrave of Thuringia
text: Hermann I (died 25 April 1217), Landgrave of Thuringia and (as Hermann III) Count Palatine of Saxony, was the second son of Louis II, Landgrave of Thuringia ("the Iron"), and Judith of Hohenstaufen, the sister of Emperor Frederick Barbarossa.

title: Ludwig von Westphalen
text: Johann Ludwig von Westphalen( 11 July 1770 – 3 March 1842) was a liberal Prussian civil servant and the father- in- law of Karl Marx.

title: Ogawa Mataji
text: Viscount was a general in the early Imperial Japanese Army. He was also the father- in- law of Field Marshal Gen Sugiyama.

title: Sophia of Wittelsbach

title: Sophia of Wittelsbach
text: In 1196, Sophia married Landgrave Hermann I of Thuringia; she was his second wife. They had the following children:

title: Harry Smith (athlete)

title: Harry Smith (athlete)
text: He was also the father of Hart wrestling family matriarch Helen Hart and the father- in- law of Stu Hart.

title: Reginar III, Count of Hainaut
text: Reginar III (c. 920 – 973) was a Count of Hainaut from approximately 940 until his exile in 958. He was the son of Reginar II, Count of Hainaut.

title: Reginar III, Count of Hainaut
text: He took part in the rebellion of his uncle Gilbert, Duke of Lorraine. When Gilbert was killed in 939, Regnier had to pledge fealty to King Otto the Great.

title: Reginar III, Count of Hainaut
text: He then allied himself with King Louis IV of France, but King Otto sent duke Hermann of Swabia to quell the rebels in 944.

title: Reginar III, Count of Hainaut
text: Otto appointed Conrad the Red as duke of Lotharingia, who tried to diminish the power of Reginar. However, when Conrad rose against Otto, Reginar supported him.

title: Reginar III, Count of Hainaut
text: In an anarchic situation, Reginar appropriated the dowry of Gerberga of Saxony, Otto's sister and mother of the French king, and also church property.

title: Reginar III, Count of Hainaut
text: In 953, Bruno, Archbishop of Cologne, who had also been appointed duke of Lotharingia, restored order and defeated Reginar.

title: Reginar III, Count of Hainaut
text: As Reginar refused to submit, he was exiled to Bohemia, where he died.

title: Werner, Count of Valenciennes
text: Werner( Garnier, Warin)( died 973), Count of Valenciennes and Count of Hesbaye and Zülpich, brother of Renaud, Count of Mons. His parentage is unknown.

title: Werner, Count of Valenciennes
text: In 953, Reginar III was defeated by King Lothair and Archbishop Bruno, and banished to Bavaria.

title: Werner, Count of Valenciennes
text: At that time, Werner became the successor of Rudolf as Count of Hesbaye, Werner, is referred to as count in a charter confirmed by Bruno.

title: Werner, Count of Valenciennes
text: Before 966, it appears that at least some of Rudolf's property was confiscated and placed under Werner.

title: Werner, Count of Valenciennes
text: After the disgrace of Count Reginar III, Godfrey I, Duke of Lower Lorraine, received the County of Hainaut, which included the cities of Mons and Valenciennes.

title: Werner, Count of Valenciennes
text: After the death of Godfrey, Amaury became Count of Valenciennes, while Richer assumed the countship of Mons.

title: Werner, Count of Valenciennes
text: After the death of Amaury, Emperor Otto I appointed Werner as the Count of Valenciennes.

title: Werner, Count of Valenciennes
text: Returning from exile in 973, the sons of Reginar III, Reginar IV, Count of Mons, and Lambert I, Count of Louvain, killed both Werner and his brother Renaud at the battle of Peronne.

title: Werner, Count of Valenciennes
text: Werner had no known children.

title: Lambert I, Count of Louvain
text: Lambert I of Louvain nicknamed "The Bearded" (born in Louvain, Duchy of Lotharingia, East Francia c.

title: Lambert I, Count of Louvain
text: 950, died in Florennes, County of Namur, Duchy of Lower Lorraine, Holy Roman Empire on 12 September 1015) was the first Count of Louvain in 1003.

title: Lambert I, Count of Louvain
text: He was killed by Godfrey II, Duke of Lower Lorraine in battle for Godfrey's claim of Count of Verdun.

title: Lambert I, Count of Louvain
text: He was the son of Reginar III, Count of Hainaut and Adela d' Eguisheim, daughter of Hugh V, Count of Eguisheim. His brother was Reginar IV, Count of Mons.

title: Lambert I, Count of Louvain
text: He was the husband of Gerberga of Lower Lorraine, and father of:

title: Henry II, Count of Louvain
text: Henry II( German:" Heinrich", Dutch:" Hendrik", French:" Henri") was Count of Louvain( Leuven) from 1054 through 1071.

title: Henry II, Count of Louvain
text: Henry II was the son of Lambert II, Count of Louvain and Oda of Verdun. His maternal uncles included Pope Stephen X and Godfrey the Bearded, Duke of Lorraine.

title: Henry I, Count of Louvain
text: Henry I was Count of Louvain from 1015 until 1038.

title: Conon, Count of Soissons
text: Conon of Nesle( died 1180), son of Raoul II of Nesle and Gertrude, daughter of Lambert, Count of Montaigu. Châtelain of Bruges, Count of Soissons.

title: Conon, Count of Soissons
text: Conon became Count of Soissons upon the death of his uncle Yves II in 1178. In 1164, Conon married Agather of Pierrefonds, daughter of Dreux, Seigneur of Perrefonds, and his wife Beatrix.

title: Conon, Count of Soissons
text: They had no children. Upon his death in 1180, Conon was succeeded as Count of Soissons by his brother Raoul.

title: Lambert II, Count of Lens
text: Lambert II, Count of Lens( died 1054) was a French nobleman. He was likely born circa 1030. This would put his death age at about 24 years old.

title: Lambert II, Count of Lens
text: He was the son of Eustace I, Count of Bologne and of Maud of Louvain( daughter of Lambert I of Louvain).

title: Lambert II, Count of Lens
text: he married Adelaide of Normandy, Countess of Aumale, daughter of Robert I, Duke of Normandy and sister of William the Conqueror.

title: Lambert II, Count of Lens
text: Adelaide was the widow of Enguerrand II, Count of Ponthieu who died in 1053. Lambert and Adelaide had a daughter, Judith of Lens, although Lambert would scarcely have seen her; he was killed at the battle of Lille in 1054.

title: Lambert II, Count of Lens
text: Lambert was supporting Baldwin V, Count of Flanders against Henry III, Holy Roman Emperor when he was killed in battle.

title: Lambert II, Count of Lens
text: His widow, Adelaide, married thirdly, Odo, Count of Champagne.

title: Sigramnus, Count of Hesbaye
text: Sigramnus (Sigrand), was the Count of Hesbaye. Sigramnus became Count of Hesbaye by virtue of his marriage to the daughter of Lambert, Count of Hesbaye.

title: Sigramnus, Count of Hesbaye
text: The dates of his rule are unknown but are believed to be between that of Lambert’s son and grandson, and so it was perhaps an interim position until the latter became of age.

title: Sigramnus, Count of Hesbaye
text: The only knowledge available on Sigramnus is through his son, the Bishop of Metz, and grandson Ingerman of Hesbaye, father of Ermengard, wife of Louis the Pious.

title: Sigramnus, Count of Hesbaye
text: Sigramnus is known to have been an early supporter of Charles Martel, even before the Battle of Amblève. Sigramnus married , daughter of Lambert, Count of Hesbaye.

title: Sigramnus, Count of Hesbaye
text: They had three children: Previous histories have portrayed Sigramnus as the husband of the daughter of Charles Martel, but this has been largely discredited.

title: Sigramnus, Count of Hesbaye
text: Sigramnus was succeeded by his nephew Cancor as Count of Hesbaye.

title: Henry III, Count of Louvain
text: Henry III of Louvain( German:" Heinrich", Dutch:" Hendrik", French:" Henri"; died 1095), was count of Louvain( Leuven) and landgrave of Brabant, son of Henry II( c.

title: Henry III, Count of Louvain
text: 1020 – 1078), count of Louvain and Brussels, and Adela of Orthen( or Betuwe), a daughter of Count Everard of Orthen.

title: Otto I, Margrave of Meissen
text: Otto I was the Margrave of Meissen from 1062 until his death in 1067, and the second Margrave of the family of the counts of Weimar and Orlamünde.

title: Otto I, Margrave of Meissen
text: He was a younger son of William III of Weimar and Oda, daughter of Thietmar, Margrave of the Saxon Ostmark.

title: Otto I, Margrave of Meissen
text: He inherited Orlamünde from his father in 1039 and Weimar from his brother William in 1062. He was appointed by the Emperor Henry IV to succeed William in Meissen as well.

title: Otto I, Margrave of Meissen
text: He became Advocate of the Cathedral of Merseburg in 1066. He married Adela of Louvain, daughter of Lambert II, Count of Louvain, son of Lambert I of Louvain, before 1060.

title: Otto I, Margrave of Meissen
text: She gave him three daughters: When he died, she remarried to Dedi I of Lusatia, Otto's stepfather.

text: Naftuli "Nathan" Hertz Juran (Gura Humorului – , Palos Verdes Estates, California, USA) was an American film art director, and later film and television director.

title: Nathan Juran
text: As an art director, he won the Oscar for Best Art Direction in 1942 for "How Green Was My Valley", along with Richard Day and Thomas Little.

title: Nathan Juran
text: His work on "The Razor's Edge" in 1946 also received an Academy nomination. In the 1950s, he began to direct, and was known for science fiction and fantasy films such as "Attack of the 50 Foot Woman".

title: Nathan Juran
text: He was also the brother of quality guru Joseph M. Juran.

title: Anselm Franz, 2nd Prince of Thurn and Taxis
text: Anselm Franz, 2nd Prince of Thurn and Taxis, full German name:" Anselm Franz Fürst von Thurn und Taxis"( 30 January 1681 – 8 November 1739) was the second Prince of Thurn and Taxis, Postmaster General of the Imperial Reichspost, and Head of the House of Thurn and Taxis from 21 February 1714 until his death on 8 November 1739.

title: Prince Max Emanuel of Thurn and Taxis
text: Father" Emmeram" of Thurn and Taxis OSB, until his profession Prince" Max Emanuel" Maria Siegfried Joseph Antonius Ignatius Lamoral of Thurn and Taxis( 1 March 1902, Regensburg, Kingdom of Bavaria – 3 October 1994, Regensburg, Bavaria, Germany) was a German Benedictine and member of the Princely House of Thurn and Taxis.

title: Princess Lida of Thurn and Taxis
text: Lida, Princess Victor of Thurn and Taxis( née Lida Eleanor Nicolls; July 28, 1875 – December 6, 1965), also styled as Princess Lida of Thurn and Taxis, was an American millionairess, socialite, and the wife of Prince Victor of Thurn and Taxis.

title: Princess Lida of Thurn and Taxis
text: She was well known for her involvement in several highly publicized legal disputes, making her a fixture in newspapers such as" The New York Times".

title: Princess Lida of Thurn and Taxis
text: The first such dispute was with former New York showgirl Josephine Moffitt, who claimed to be the legal spouse of Prince Victor using the name" Josephine, Princess of Thurn and Taxis" and the second was with Bernard Francis S. Gregory, who sued her for$ 50,000, alleging she had slandered him.

title: Princess Mathilde Sophie of Oettingen-Oettingen and Oettingen-Spielberg
text: Princess Mathilde Sophie of Oettingen-Oettingen and Oettingen-Spielberg (in German: " Mathilde Sophie, Prinzessin zu Oettingen-Oettingen und Oettingen-Spielberg"; 9 February 1816, Oettingen, Kingdom of Bavaria– 20 January 1886, Obermais, Meran, County of Tyrol, Austria–Hungary) was a member of the Princely House of Oettingen-Spielberg and a Princess of Oettingen-Oettingen and Oettingen-Spielberg by birth.

title: Princess Mathilde Sophie of Oettingen-Oettingen and Oettingen-Spielberg
text: Through her marriage to Maximilian Karl, 6th Prince of Thurn and Taxis, Mathilde Sophie was also a member of the Princely House of Thurn and Taxis and Princess consort of Thurn and Taxis.

title: Princess Eulalia of Thurn and Taxis
text: Princess Eulalia Maria Antoine Eleonore of Thurn and Taxis, also known as Illa, (21 December 1908 - 30 December 1993) was the eldest child of Prince Friedrich Lamoral of Thurn and Taxis and his wife, Princess Eleonore de Ligne.

title: Princess Eulalia of Thurn and Taxis
text: She belonged to the Czech branch of the House of Thurn and Taxis.

title: Prince Nikolaus of Thurn and Taxis (1885–1919)
text: Prince Nikolaus of Thurn and Taxis( later Nikolaus, Baron of Hochstadt)( 21 January 1885 – 8 June 1919) was a member of the Princely House of Thurn and Taxis and a Prince of Thurn and Taxis.

title: Prince Nikolaus of Thurn and Taxis (1885–1919)
text: Nikolaus was a Lieutenant in the German Imperial Navy.

title: Prince Raphael Rainer of Thurn and Taxis
text: "Raphael Rainer" Karl Maria Joseph Antonius Ignatius Hubertus Lamoral Prince of Thurn and Taxis (30 May 1906 at Regensburg, Germany - 8 June 1993 at Schwangau, Germany) was the sixth son of Albert, 8th Prince of Thurn and Taxis and his wife Archduchess Margarethe Klementine of Austria.

title: Prince Raphael Rainer of Thurn and Taxis
text: He is the father of Prince Max Emanuel of Thurn and Taxis, the heir presumptive to Albert, 12th Prince of Thurn and Taxis.

title: Prince Gabriel of Thurn and Taxis
text: Prince Gabriel Albert Maria Michael Franz Joseph Gallus Lamoral of Thurn and Taxis( 16 October 1922 – 17 December 1942) was a member of the Princely House of Thurn and Taxis and a Prince of Thurn and Taxis.

title: Prince Gabriel of Thurn and Taxis
text: Gabriel was second in the line of succession to the Headship of the House of Thurn and Taxis after his father Franz Joseph, Hereditary Prince of Thurn and Taxis until his death in the Battle of Stalingrad, at which point he was replaced by his uncle Prince Karl August of Thurn and Taxis.

title: Prince Gustav of Thurn and Taxis (1848–1914)
text: Prince "Gustav" Otto Maximilian Lamoral of Thurn and Taxis (1848–1914), full German name: " Gustav Otto Maximilian Lamoral Prinz von Thurn und Taxis", was the sixth child of Maximilian Karl, 6th Prince of Thurn and Taxis and his second wife Princess Mathilde Sophie of Oettingen-Oettingen and Oettingen-Spielberg.

title: Prince Gustav of Thurn and Taxis (1848–1914)
text: He was born on 2 February 1848 in Regensburg, Kingdom of Bavaria.

title: Prince Victor of Thurn and Taxis
text: Prince" Victor" of Thurn and Taxis( 18 January 1876, Ecska – 28 January 1928, Vienna, Austria) was a member of the Princely House of Thurn and Taxis and a Prince of Thurn and Taxis.

title: Caspar Babypants
text: Caspar Babypants is the stage name of children's music artist Chris Ballew, who is also widely known as the singer of The Presidents of the United States of America.

title: Panda (Astro song)
text: " Panda" is a song of the Chilean band Astro and is the fifth song of the homonymous album of the year 2011.

title: Panda (Astro song)
text: The song was composed and produced by the singer of the band Andrés Nusser and released like third single of the album on February 1, 2013.

title: Joe Jackson (musician)
text: David Ian "Joe" Jackson (born 11 August 1954) is an English musician and singer-songwriter.

title: Joe Jackson (musician)
text: Having spent years studying music and playing clubs, Jackson scored a hit with his first release, "Is She Really Going Out with Him? ", in 1979.

title: Joe Jackson (musician)
text: This was followed by a number of new wave singles before he moved to more jazz-inflected pop music and had a Top 10 hit in 1982 with "Steppin' Out".

title: Joe Jackson (musician)
text: He is associated with the 1980s Second British Invasion of the US. He has also composed classical music. He has recorded 19 studio albums and received 5 Grammy Award nominations.

title: Kristian Leontiou
text: Kristian Leontiou (born February 1982) is a British singer of Greek Cypriot descent, and is the singer for the indie rock band One eskimO.

title: O Valencia!
text: " O Valencia! " is the fifth single by the indie rock band The Decemberists, and the first released from their fourth studio album," The Crane Wife".

title: O Valencia!
text: The music was written by The Decemberists and the lyrics by Colin Meloy. It tells a story of two star- crossed lovers.

title: O Valencia!
text: The singer falls in love with a person who belongs to an opposing gang.

title: O Valencia!
text: At the end of the song, the singer's lover jumps in to defend the singer, who is confronting his lover's brother( the singer's" sworn enemy") and is killed by the bullet intended for the singer.

title: Dáithí Sproule
text: Dáithí Sproule( born 23 May 1950) is a guitarist and singer of traditional Irish music. His niece is the singer Claire Sproule.

title: Sunday Papers
text: "Sunday Papers" is a song written and performed by British new wave musician Joe Jackson. It was released on his debut album, "Look Sharp! ".

title: Sunday Papers
text: Written as a critique of the British press, "Sunday Papers" features mocking lyrics and reggae inspired music.

title: Sunday Papers
text: "Sunday Papers" was released as a single in the UK as the follow-up to his single, "Is She Really Going Out with Him? ", but did not chart.

title: Sunday Papers
text: Despite this, the song has generally received positive critical reception.

title: Bernie Bonvoisin
text: Bernard Bonvoisin, known as Bernie Bonvoisin( born 9 July 1956 in Nanterre, Hauts- de- Seine), is a French hard rock singer and film director.

title: Bernie Bonvoisin
text: He is best known for having been the singer of Trust. He was one of the best friends of Bon Scott the singer of AC/ DC and together they recorded the song" Ride On" which was one of the last songs by Bon Scott.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Etan Boritzer( born 1950) is an American writer of children ’s literature who is best known for his book" What is God? " first published in 1989.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His best selling" What is? " illustrated children's book series on character education and difficult subjects for children is a popular teaching guide for parents, teachers and child- life professionals.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer gained national critical acclaim after" What is God? " was published in 1989 although the book has caused controversy from religious fundamentalists for its universalist views.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: The other current books in the" What is? " series include What is Love? , What is Death? , What is Beautiful? , What is Funny? , What is Right?

title: Etan Boritzer
text: , What is Peace? , What is Money? , What is Dreaming? , What is a Friend? , What is True? , What is a Family? , What is a Feeling?

title: Etan Boritzer
text: " The series is now also translated into 15 languages. Boritzer was first published in 1963 at the age of 13 when he wrote an essay in his English class at Wade Junior High School in the Bronx, New York on the assassination of John F. Kennedy.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His essay was included in a special anthology by New York City public school children compiled and published by the New York City Department of Education.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer now lives in Venice, California and maintains his publishing office there also. He has helped numerous other authors to get published through" How to Get Your Book Published!

title: Etan Boritzer
text: " programs. Boritzer is also a yoga teacher who teaches regular classes locally and guest- teaches nationally.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: He is also recognized nationally as an erudite speaker on" The Teachings of the Buddha. "

title: Billy Milano
text: Billy Milano is a Bronx- born heavy metal musician now based in Austin, Texas.

title: Billy Milano
text: He is the singer and- occasionally- guitarist and bassist of crossover thrash band M.O.D., and he was also the singer of its predecessor, Stormtroopers of Death.

title: Billy Milano
text: He was also the singer of United Forces, which also featured his Stormtroopers of Death bandmate Dan Lilker.

title: Antonieta
text: Antonieta is a 1982 film by Spanish director Carlos Saura, starring Isabelle Adjani and Hanna Schygulla.

title: Antonieta
text: The film, a Mexican- Spanish French co production, was based on a novel by Andrés Henestrosa.

title: Antonieta
text: The plot centers on the life of Antonieta Rivas Mercado, a Mexican writer who killed herself inside Paris' Notre Dame in 1931.

title: Wale Adebanwi
text: Wale Adebanwi( born 1969) is a Nigerian- born first Black Rhodes Professor at St Antony's College, Oxford.

title: Dodging the Clock
text: Dodging the Clock is a Quebec film directed by Ricardo Trogi and released in 2005.

title: Carlos Saura
text: Carlos Saura Atarés( born 4 January 1932) is a Spanish film director, photographer and writer. Along with Luis Buñuel and Pedro Almodóvar, he is counted among the Spain ’s three most renowned filmmakers.

title: Carlos Saura
text: He has a long and prolific career that spans over half a century. Several of his films have won many international awards.

title: Carlos Saura
text: Saura began his career in 1955 making documentary shorts. He quickly gained international prominence when his first feature- length film premiered at Cannes Film Festival in 1960.

title: Carlos Saura
text: Although he started filming as a neorealist, Saura quickly switched to films encoded with metaphors and symbolism in order to get around the Spanish censors.

title: Carlos Saura
text: In 1966, he was thrust into the international spotlight when his film" La Caza" won the Silver Bear at the Berlin International Film Festival.

title: Carlos Saura
text: In the following years, he forged an international reputation for his cinematic treatment of emotional and spiritual responses to repressive political conditions.

title: Carlos Saura
text: By the 1970s, Saura was the best known filmmaker working in Spain. His films employed complex narrative devices and were frequently controversial.

title: Carlos Saura
text: He won Special Jury Awards for" La Prima Angélica"( 1973) and" Cría Cuervos"( 1975) in Cannes; and an Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film nomination in 1979 for" Mama Cumple 100 Años".

title: Carlos Saura
text: In the 1980s, Saura was in the spotlight for his Flamenco trilogy –" Bodas de SangreCarmen" and" El Amor Brujo," in which he combined dramatic content and flamenco dance forms.

title: Carlos Saura
text: His work continued to be featured in worldwide competitions and earned numerous awards. He received two nominations for Academy Awards for Best Foreign Language Film, for" Carmen"( 1983) and" Tango"( 1998).

title: Carlos Saura
text: His films are sophisticated expression of time and space fusing reality with fantasy, past with present, and memory with hallucination.

title: Carlos Saura
text: In the last two decades of the 20th century, Saura has concentrated on works uniting music, dance and images.

title: Dodging the Dole
text: Dodging the Dole is a 1936 British musical comedy film directed by John E. Blakeley and starring Roy Barbour, Dan Young and Jenny Howard.

title: Dodging the Dole
text: It was made by Mancunian Films at Highbury Studios and Southall Studios.

title: John E. Blakeley
text: John E. Blakeley ( 1 October 1888 – 20 February 1958) was a British film producer, director and screenwriter, the founder of Mancunian Films.

title: John E. Blakeley
text: Born in Ardwick, Manchester, son of James Blakeley( born c. 1862; Manchester), and Margaret Quirk( born c.

title: John E. Blakeley
text: 1861; Glasgow, Scotland), he was of Lancashire( Church of England) descent on his father's side of the family and Irish Catholic on his mother's.

title: John E. Blakeley
text: His father had become an early film distributor in 1908 after previous work as a travelling draper.

title: John E. Blakeley
text: Blakeley joined his father's business and soon came to understand the tastes of the emerging cinema audiences in the northern industrial towns.

title: John E. Blakeley
text: By the 1930s, the younger Blakeley was making films starring the idols of northern music hall comedy: George Formby, Frank Randle and Sandy Powell.

title: John E. Blakeley
text: Initially relying on London studios, rising costs encouraged him to found the Mancunian Film Studios in his hometown in 1947, on £ 70,000 capital.

title: John E. Blakeley
text: The studios produced a sequence of profitable films, often on shoestring budgets, until Blakeley's retirement in 1953. He died in Stockport aged 69.

title: Hartley Lobban
text: Hartley W Lobban (9 May 1926 – 15 October 2004) was a Jamaican-born first-class cricketer who played 17 matches for Worcestershire in the early 1950s.

title: John McMahon (Surrey and Somerset cricketer)
text: John William Joseph McMahon( 28 December 1917 – 8 May 2001) was an Australian- born first- class cricketer who played for Surrey and Somerset in England from 1947 to 1957.

title: Claude Weisz
text: Claude Weisz is a French film director born in Paris.

title: Henry Moore (cricketer)
text: Henry Walter Moore( 1849 – 20 August 1916) was an English- born first- class cricketer who spent most of his life in New Zealand.

title: Breakaway Airport
text: Breakaway Airport is an airport located in Cedar Park, Texas.

title: Nikolsk Airport
text: Nikolsk( also listed as Nikolsk South) is an airport in Russia located 5 km southeast of Nikolsk in Vologda Oblast.

title: Nikolsk Airport
text: It is a small paved civilian airfield with parking area and administration buildings.

title: Bennett Airport
text: Bennett Airport is a privately owned public- use airport located in Salisbury, Maryland.

title: Madang Airport
text: Madang Airport, is an airport located in Madang, Papua New Guinea.

title: Ampanihy Airport
text: Ampanihy Airport is an airport located in Ampanihy, Madagascar.

title: Svobodny Airport
text: Svobodny is an airport in Amur Oblast, Russia located 11 km north of Svobodny. It is a small general aviation airport.

title: Ayapel Airport
text: Ayapel Airport is an airport located in Ayapel, Colombia.

title: Esquimalt Airport
text: Esquimalt Airport was an airport located in Esquimalt, British Columbia, Canada.

title: Antonio Maceo Airport
text: Antonio Maceo Airport is an international airport located in Santiago, Cuba.

title: Erzincan Airport
text: Erzincan Airport is an airport located in Erzincan, Turkey.

title: Joan of Geneva
text: Joan of Geneva( born c. 1040, died 1095) was a Countess Consort of Savoy; married to Amadeus II, Count of Savoy.

title: Joan of Geneva
text: According to the much later" Chronicles of Savoy", Amadeus married Joan, daughter of" Girard, Count of Burgundy", which scholars have surmised to have been Count Gerold of Geneva.

title: Joan of Geneva
text: The" Chronicon Altacumbae" says only that" the wife of Amadeus from Burgundy", which might refer to Amadeus I. If his wife were Genevan, it would explain how the house of Savoy came so early to possess a large portion of the Genevois.

title: Joan of Geneva
text: His wife, whatever her name and origins, bore Amadeus II several children, although there is some uncertainty about how many:

title: Bonne of Bourbon
text: Bonne of Bourbon (1341 – 19 January 1402) was a daughter of Peter I, Duke of Bourbon, and Isabella of Valois, and hence a sister of Joanna of Bourbon.

title: Bonne of Bourbon
text: She served as regent of Savoy during the absence of her spouse from 1366 to 1367, in 1383, and during the minority of her grandson Count Amadeus VIII in 1391.

title: Louis of Piedmont
text: Louis( 1364 – 11 December 1418) was the Lord of Piedmont and titular Prince of Achaea from 1402. He was a son of James of Piedmont and Marguerite de Beaujeu( 1346 – 1402).

title: Louis of Piedmont
text: In 1405, he founded the University of Turin. On 24 January 1403, he married Bona( 1388 – 1432), daughter of Amadeus VII, Count of Savoy, but they never had any children.

title: Louis of Piedmont
text: When he died in 1418, the Piedmont- Achaea cadet branch of the House of Savoy died with him. His titles and estates were inherited by the senior line of the House of Savoy.

title: Beatrice of Viennois
text: Beatrice of Vienne( 1160 –1230) was a Countess of Savoy by marriage to Humbert III, Count of Savoy.

title: Amadeus VIII, Duke of Savoy
text: Amadeus VIII( 4 September 1383 – 7 January 1451) was a Savoyard nobleman, the son of Amadeus VII, Count of Savoy and Bonne of Berry. He was surnamed the Peaceful.

title: Amadeus VIII, Duke of Savoy
text: After the death of his father in 1391, his mother acted as a regent, because of his youth.

title: Amadeus VIII, Duke of Savoy
text: He was an antipope of the Catholic Church from 1439 to 1449 as Felix V, in opposition to Popes Eugene IV and Nicholas V.

title: Marie of Savoy, Duchess of Milan
text: Marie of Savoy( 1411–1469) was a daughter of Amadeus VIII, Duke of Savoy( later the Antipope Felix V) and Mary of Burgundy.

title: Marie of Savoy, Duchess of Milan
text: She married Filippo Maria Visconti, the Duke of Milan in 1428. They had no children.

title: Cecile of Baux
text: Cecile of Baux( 1230 – 1275), was a Countess Consort of Savoy; married in 1244 to Amadeus IV, Count of Savoy. She was the daughter of Barral of Baux and his wife, Sibylle d'Anduze.

title: Cecile of Baux
text: She was the Regent of Savoy during the minority of her son, Boniface, Count of Savoy, from 1253 until 1259.

title: Amadeus VII, Count of Savoy
text: Amadeus VII (March 1360, Chambéry – 1 November 1391), known as the Red Count, was Count of Savoy from 1383 to 1391.

title: Amadeus VII, Count of Savoy
text: Amadeus was the son of Amadeus VI, Count of Savoy and Bonne of Bourbon. Amadeus VII was known for his hospitality, for he would entertain people of all stations and never turned a person from his table without a meal.

title: Amadeus VII, Count of Savoy
text: He married Bonne of Berry, daughter of John, Duke of Berry, who was the younger brother of Charles V of France.

title: Amadeus VII, Count of Savoy
text: They had three children: Upon his death at age 29 from tetanus, controversy arose because of his will.

title: Amadeus VII, Count of Savoy
text: Amadeus VII left the important role of guardian of his son and heir, Amadeus VIII, to his own mother, a sister of the powerful Duke de Bourbon, instead of following the tradition of appointing the child's mother, who was a daughter of the equally powerful Duke de Berry.

title: Amadeus VII, Count of Savoy
text: It took three months of negotiations to restore peace in the family.

title: Yolande Louise of Savoy
text: Yolande Louise of Savoy( 1487–1499), was a Duchess Consort of Savoy; married to Philibert II, Duke of Savoy.

title: Humbert II, Count of Savoy
text: Umberto II, nicknamed the Fat( 1065, Carignano, Piedmont – 19 October 1103), was Count of Savoy from 1080 until his death in 1103. He was the son of Amadeus II of Savoy.

title: Humbert II, Count of Savoy
text: He was married to Gisela of Burgundy, daughter of William I, Count of Burgundy, and had 7 children:

title: Farouk Shami
text: Farouk Shami is an American businessman and founder of the hair- care and spa products company, Farouk Systems located in Texas.

title: Farouk Shami
text: In 2009, Shami ran in the 2010 Texas gubernatorial election.

title: IEEE Transactions on Control Systems Technology
text: The IEEE Transactions on Control Systems Technology is published bimonthly by the IEEE Control Systems Society.

title: IEEE Transactions on Control Systems Technology
text: The journal publishes papers, letters, tutorials, surveys, and perspectives on control systems technology. The editor- in- chief is Prof. Andrea Serrani( The Ohio State University).

title: IEEE Transactions on Control Systems Technology
text: According to the" Journal Citation Reports", the journal has a 2017 impact factor of 3.882.

title: IEEE Control Systems Award
text: The IEEE Control Systems Award is a technical field award given to an individual by the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers( IEEE)" for outstanding contributions to control systems engineering, science or technology".

title: IEEE Control Systems Award
text: It is an IEEE- level award, created in 1980 by the Board of Directors of the IEEE, but sponsored by the IEEE Control Systems Society.

title: IEEE Control Systems Award
text: Originally the name was IEEE Control Systems Science and Engineering Award, but after 1991 the IEEE changed it to" IEEE Control Systems Award".

title: IEEE Control Systems Award
text: Recipients of this award receive a bronze medal, a certificate, and an honorarium.

title: Control engineering
text: Control engineering or control systems engineering is an engineering discipline that applies automatic control theory to design systems with desired behaviors in control environments.

title: Control engineering
text: The discipline of controls overlaps and is usually taught along with electrical engineering at many institutions around the world.

title: Control engineering
text: The practice uses sensors and detectors to measure the output performance of the process being controlled; these measurements are used to provide corrective feedback helping to achieve the desired performance.

title: Control engineering
text: Systems designed to perform without requiring human input are called automatic control systems( such as cruise control for regulating the speed of a car).

title: Control engineering
text: Multi-disciplinary in nature, control systems engineering activities focus on implementation of control systems mainly derived by mathematical modeling of a diverse range of systems.

title: Telus
text: Telus Communications( stylized as TELUS) is a Canadian national telecommunications company that provides a wide range of telecommunications products and services including internet access, voice, entertainment, healthcare, video, and IPTV television.

title: Telus
text: The company is based in the Vancouver, British Columbia area; it was originally based in Edmonton, Alberta, before its merger with BC Tel in 1999.

title: Telus
text: Telus' wireless division, Telus Mobility, offers HSPA+, and LTE- based mobile phone networks. Telus is the incumbent local exchange carrier in British Columbia and Alberta.

title: Telus
text: Telus' primary competitors are Shaw Communications( in the western provinces). It also competes in the mobile sector with Rogers Communications, Bell Canada and Vidéotron( in Quebec).

title: Telus
text: Telus is a member of the British Columbia Technology Industry Association.

title: Digital model railway control systems
text: Digital model railway control systems are an alternative to control a layout and simplify the wiring and add more flexibility in operations.

title: Digital model railway control systems
text: A number of control systems are available to operate locomotives on model railways.

title: Digital model railway control systems
text: Analog systems where the speed and the direction of a train is controlled by adjusting the voltage on the track are still popular while they have recently given way to control systems based on computer technology.

title: Information Control Systems
text: Information Control Systems( founded in 1962) was a computer programming and data processing company serving clients in the Midwestern United States.

title: Tom, Dick & Harry Creative Co.
text: Tom, Dick & Harry Creative, Co. is an American advertising agency in Chicago, Illinois that creates integrated marketing communications programs for both businesses and not-for-profit organizations.

title: Measurex
text: Measurex was an American company based in Cupertino, California. It was one of the first companies to develop computer control systems for industry, primarily the paper- making industry.

title: Measurex
text: The development of the control systems included the development of control software, and development of scanning sensors to measure different properties of paper.

title: Measurex
text: The company was acquired by Honeywell in at a price tag of almost At the acquisition, Measurex had 2,250 employees in 30 countries and revenue of$ 254 million.

title: ZTR Control Systems
text: ZTR Control Systems is a privately held company based in London, Ontario, Canada and with an office in Minneapolis, Minnesota, USA.

title: ZTR Control Systems
text: ZTR provides monitoring and control systems for the railway and industrial off- road compact construction equipment markets.

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: Sir Alfred Joseph Hitchcock,( 13 August 1899 – 29 April 1980) was an English film director and producer, widely regarded as one of the most influential and extensively studied filmmakers in the history of cinema.

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: Known as" the Master of Suspense", he directed over 50 feature films in a career spanning six decades, becoming as well known as any of his actors thanks to his many interviews, his cameo roles in most of his films, and his hosting and producing of the television anthology" Alfred Hitchcock Presents"( 1955 – 1965).

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: His films garnered a total of 46 Oscar nominations and six wins.

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: Born in Leytonstone, Essex, Hitchcock entered the film industry in 1919 as a title card designer after training as a technical clerk and copy writer for a telegraph- cable company.

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: He made his directorial debut with the silent film" The Pleasure Garden"( 1925). His first successful film,( 1927), helped to shape the thriller genre, while his 1929 film," Blackmail", was the first British.

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: Two of his 1930s thrillers," The 39 Steps"( 1935) and" The Lady Vanishes"( 1938), are ranked among the greatest British films of the 20th century.

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: By 1939 Hitchcock was a filmmaker of international importance, and film producer David O. Selznick persuaded him to move to Hollywood.

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: A string of successful films followed, including" Rebecca"( 1940)," Foreign Correspondent"( 1940)," Suspicion"( 1941)," Shadow of a Doubt"( 1943), and" Notorious"( 1946).

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: " Rebecca" won the Academy Award for Best Picture, although Hitchcock himself was only nominated as Best Director; he was also nominated for" Lifeboat"( 1944) and" Spellbound"( 1945), although he never won the Best Director Academy Award.

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: The" Hitchcockian" style includes the use of camera movement to mimic a person's gaze, thereby turning viewers into voyeurs, and framing shots to maximise anxiety and fear.

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: The film critic Robin Wood wrote that the meaning of a Hitchcock film" is there in the method, in the progression from shot to shot.

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: A Hitchcock film is an organism, with the whole implied in every detail and every detail related to the whole.

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: " After a brief lull of commercial success in the late 1940s, Hitchcock returned to form with" Strangers on a Train"( 1951) and" Dial M For Murder"( 1954).

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: By 1960 Hitchcock had directed four films often ranked among the greatest of all time:" Rear Window"( 1954)," Vertigo"( 1958)," North by Northwest"( 1959), and" Psycho"( 1960) with the first and last of these garnering him Best Director nominations.

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: In 2012," Vertigo" replaced Orson Welles's" Citizen Kane"( 1941) as the British Film Institute's greatest film ever made based on its world- wide poll of hundreds of film critics.

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: By 2018 eight of his films had been selected for preservation in the United States National Film Registry, including his personal favourite," Shadow of a Doubt"( 1943).

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: He received the BAFTA Fellowship in 1971, the AFI Life Achievement Award in 1979 and was knighted in December that year, four months before he died.

title: John Williams (actor)
text: John Williams( 15 April 1903 – 5 May 1983) was an English stage, film and television actor.

title: John Williams (actor)
text: He is remembered for his role as Chief Inspector Hubbard in Alfred Hitchcock's" Dial M for Murder", as the chauffeur in Billy Wilder's" Sabrina"( both 1954), and as portraying the second" Mr. French" on TV's" Family Affair" in its first season( 1967).

title: New Year (1989 film)
text: " New Year" is a 1989 Malayalam movie which was a remake of 1985 Hindi movie" Aitbaar" which itself was a remake of Alfred Hitchcock's classic murder mystery" Dial M for Murder".

title: April Walker
text: April Walker( 1941) is a British actress, primarily for the BBC, best known for her regular appearances on the hit variety show" The Two Ronnies", episodic guest roles on numerous other shows, such as" Fawlty Towers" and" Dial M for Murder", and also for having been the first woman cast in the seminal role of Sarah Jane Smith for the series" Doctor Who".

title: Sayeed Quadri
text: Sayeed Quadri is an Indian poet and lyricist who works in Bollywood. He was born in Jodhpur, Rajasthan.

title: Sayeed Quadri
text: He won the Best Lyricist award at the 6th IIFA Awards for" Murder", and Standout Performance by Lyricist at the Stardust Awards 2005 for" Murder".

title: Marius (1931 film)
text: Marius is a 1931 French drama film directed by Alexander Korda. It is based on the play with the same title by Marcel Pagnol.

title: Marius (1931 film)
text: The film is a part of a trilogy which includes the films" Fanny"( Marius's ex-fiancée) and" César"( Marius's father).

title: Marius (1931 film)
text: The film was selected to be screened in the Cannes Classics section of the 2015 Cannes Film Festival.

title: Marius (1931 film)
text: The restored film was also given a limited re-release in the United States by Janus Films on 4 January 2017, first premiering at Film Forum.

title: Marius (1931 film)
text: The film was made by Korda for the French subsidiary of Paramount Pictures.

title: Marius (1931 film)
text: A separate Swedish- language version" Längtan till havet" by John W. Brunius was also released in 1931 and a German- language version" The Golden Anchor", also directed by Korda, was released the following year.

title: Satan Town
text: Satan Town is a 1926 American Western film featuring Harry Carey. Prints of the film have survived.

title: Dial M for Murder
text: Dial M for Murder is a 1954 American crime mystery film directed by Alfred Hitchcock, starring Ray Milland, Grace Kelly, Robert Cummings, and John Williams.

title: Dial M for Murder
text: Both the screenplay and the successful stage play on which it was based were written by English playwright Frederick Knott.

title: Dial M for Murder
text: The play premiered in 1952 on BBC Television, before being performed on stage in the same year in London's West End in June, and then New York's Broadway in October.

title: Dial M for Murder
text: Originally intended to be shown in dual- strip polarized 3- D, the film played in most theatres in ordinary 2- D due to the loss of interest in the 3- D process( the projection of which was difficult and error- prone) by the time of its release.

title: Dial M for Murder
text: The film earned an estimated$ 2.7 million in North American box office rentals in 1954.

title: Norman Afzal Simons
text: Norman Avzal Simons( born 12 January 1967), also known as the" Station Strangler," is a South African rapist and serial killer who was convicted in 1995 on one count of murder and one count of kidnapping Elroy van Rooy, age 10.

title: Norman Afzal Simons
text: He was sentenced to 35 years( 25 for murder and 10 for kidnapping) in prison.

title: Alexander Korda
text: Sir Alexander Korda( born Sándor László Kellner, 16 September 1893 – 23 January 1956) was a British film producer and director and screenwriter, who founded his own film production studios and film distribution company.

title: Alexander Korda
text: Born in Hungary, where he began his career, he worked briefly in the Austrian and German film industries during the era of silent films, before being based in Hollywood from 1926 to 1930 for the first of his two brief periods there( the other was during World War II).

title: Alexander Korda
text: The change led to a divorce from his first wife, the Hungarian film actress María Corda, who was unable to make the transition from silent films to" talkies" because of her strong Hungarian accent.

title: Alexander Korda
text: From 1930, Korda was active in the British film industry, and soon became one of its leading figures.

title: Alexander Korda
text: He was the founder of London Films and, post-war, the owner of British Lion Films, a film distribution company.

title: Alexander Korda
text: Korda produced many outstanding classics of the British film industry, including" The Private Life of Henry VIIIRembrandtThings To Come The Thief of Baghdad" and" The Third Man".

title: Alexander Korda
text: In 1942, Korda became the first filmmaker to receive a knighthood.

title: Robin Kačaniklić
text: Robin Kačaniklić( born 25 August 1988) is a Swedish footballer of Serbian and Macedonian descent who plays for Real Åstorp FF as a Midfielder.

title: Robin Kačaniklić
text: He is older brother to the Hammarby IF and former Swedish national team player Alexander Kačaniklić.

title: Eugene Raskin
text: Eugene Raskin or Gene Raskin( Bronx, New York, 5 September 1909 – Manhattan, New York, 7 June 2004), was an American musician and playwright, author of the lyrics of the English version of the Russian song" Those Were the Days" and also of three books on architecture and adjunct professor at Columbia University( 1936 – 1976).

text: Gary Gene Watson( born October 11, 1943) is an American country singer. He is most famous for his 1975 hit" Love in the Hot Afternoon," his 1981# 1 hit" Fourteen Carat Mind," and his signature 1979 song" Farewell Party.

title: Gene Watson
text: " Watson's long career has notched five number ones, 23 top tens and over 76 charted singles.
